story:
We are a collection of over 20 volunteer game developers and educators who have worked at great studios such as Rockstar, BioWare, Sony Online Entertainment, and Bethesda, just to name a few. Each of us have over 5-10 years of experience working in our industry - collectively, over 125 years! We know how to make extremely fun games that your kids will not want to put down - and perhaps you too!

We want to set a new standard for educational video games. Our games will delight, challenge, and educate players completely free with no in-app purchases. The potential of this public games movement is exciting! 
Projects like this will help to close the achievement-gap. Children in low-income households tend to have less exposure to educational practice opportunities, whether that is in the form of adult support, access to books, or paid media platforms. However, the ubiquity of mobile devices is getting stronger, even among low-income families. 
Please help support our cause and make our first game, Otmar's Adventure, a reality! Spelling your first word is a memorable milestone in life - and we want to combine that with worlds, music, and characters that you and the kids in your life will look back on with fond memories for years to come. 

We wanted to be very transparent and honest about the minimum amount we'd need to develop a project to the quality and scope that we're making. We have set our goal at $500,000. This is a number that we feel, after fees and rewards, would leave us enough to finish the game. The money from this campaign will allow us to hire talented game developers full-time to create code, beautiful artwork, and create all the fun activities in the game.

This crowdfunding project poses a unique challenge compared to similar video game campaigns because contributors are not buying access to our game. Treefort Academy games will never have any paid access of any kind - no purchase price, no in-app purchases, no paid-for DLC. We are building public games, for the public, for free! We hope that our contributors will see the value in that and consider their contributions a type of way they can gift the game to everyone. That spirit of giving is critical to our success. 

To help get people excited about this, we've focused on having creative and high quality rewards that both kids and adults can enjoy.


If our entire goal isn't met, fear not! We will do everything we can to pursue other funding opportunities to release this product. While game development is by no means risk-free or guaranteed -  everything raised will still go towards development of the game, whether that development is in a small or large capacity. 


Otmar's Adventure is a first-of-its-kind educational game where parents can actually enjoy playing with their kids, and players of all ages can have fun and be challenged despite their level of reading comprehension.  It will be a fully packaged traditional video game experience guiding the player through challenging games, fantastic music, visuals, and a compelling narrative.  As you probably have noticed, this is not seen in typical educational games. 

Many of us have experience in education or are currently educators, and we believe we have a solid plan to keep the educational efficacy of our games high. Part of this plan is to adhere to a strict entertainment first strategy while keeping our educational scope small and focused. 

The completely free nature of this product means it will have great potential to reach those who need it most. We have so many schools in this country that are highly impacted by second language learning populations, and so many schools that are highly impacted with very low socio-economics. The majority of children in these impacted areas read far below grade level and never catch up.  The stakeholders in their lives simply cannot do enough to bridge that academic chasm, because they lack the time and the resources necessary for reaching these students and keeping them engaged.  A free, engaging literacy development experience like Otmar’s Adventure is the missing tool.  It bridges that gap between home and school and keeps the student moving forward, building the literacy skills they need to succeed in the classroom and the world beyond.


  • Very ambitious game with full voice over and cut-scenes. This will require a lot of additional work compared to a traditional mobile game

  • Current design plan uses animation tech not commonly seen on mobile platforms just yet. We really need the player who doesn't read to be able to hear and see the character talking for instruction and have that character serve as a mentor. This is a bold decision for mobile.

  • Finding additional charitable funding if needed

Our plans for solving these challenges are as follows:

  • We have set our funding goal at a level, we believe, will offer us adequate funding to build and release a game of this quality.

  • We believe that our development cycle is such that when the game is released we feel the animation tech we are using will be more widely supported on mobile. We also will do everything we can to tap into our network of developers to engineer solutions where needed.

If you are unable to contribute we completely understand. We've all been there. The best way you can help is by sharing this on Facebook or Twitter! Also, if you have access to a large audience, we'd encourage you to share this very important cause with them. Even a simple "This looks very promising" could be enough to tip the scales towards successfully making our game, and helping people's lives. 


The other way you can help is by becoming a Treefort Academy Volunteer! We are always looking for new devs or other experienced people to help us out. To pass along your information send us an email.


Q: Are my contributions through IndieGoGo tax-deductible? 


A: Maybe. We are recognized as a non-profit in the state of California, however, we are currently still in the application process for being awarded 501(c)3 status, which can take many months. If we do complete this process before the end of the calendar year, you may put your contributions down as tax-deductible.

Q: I don't see an estimated completion time. When are you going to be finished?

A: Because game development is so unpredictable, it's very hard to nail down how long a game will take, especially this early in development. We also want to take as much time as we need to make sure the game is engaging and effective. However, depending on how well funded the project is, we can estimate a 18-24 month completion time. As we move further into full production we will be able to provide a more accurate estimate. 


Special Thank you:

Music provided by: Zoltan Vegvari
Character modeling help: Gavin Rich
Animations: Eric Young
To other anonymous Treefort Academy Volunteers who took time away from their busy jobs to help out with this project!
Butterflies for release provided by: A Butterfly Affaire

story:
Nine Dragons RPG Ltd

Thirty days ago seems like a whole other reality...

It has been a remarkable few days, and amazing few last hours, for our campaign. From being close to our $800 target with a few days to go there was a sudden, unexpected but very welcome rush of support from a group of our friends and supporters.

We needed US$800 and we got US$1300!  Better than we ever hoped for.  Now, compared to all those super-sexy high tech gadget campaigns which raise $300000 in their first week, our might not seem much of an achievement, but for us it makes all the difference in the world for the first time ever Nine Dragons RPG has some real cash behind it.

So, what now?

Well first off, the campaign has become "In Demand". This means we can keep the campaign running and receiving backing and even use it as a sales device. So those of you who backed us during the thirty days, thank you, and we will fulfill the perks as soon as possible, and it isn't over yet!

We still want to sell the game to as many individuals as possible, and claiming it via a perk is a great way to do that, so please, pass the link on to your contacts, especially your gaming contacts, and encourage them to check out the game and consider backing it too. The more funds raised, the better the whole game will be.

What would more backing bring?

Good question.

Japan
Well, we already have a Nihon (Japan) source-book being written by expert in all things Japanese, Amelia Laughlan. As well as being an expert on Japan Amelia is also a talented writer, an experienced role-player and a jolly good egg! Getting her book to print is one of our medium term priorities.

Miniatures
We have already written about the miniatures, and if any of you have seen the work of effincoolminis.com (see tooled up gorilla below) then you will know that we are looking in the correct direction! Between them and the boys at Marrow, we're going to get something special.

Adventure
We have our first Honour RPG Official Adventure, HA1: The Wedding Banquet in the works. It has been played and played and then played some more (it was a great success at HKGameX a few weekends ago) and it is all the stronger for the input of the various players who ran characters through it. Special thanks to Casper Zweerus for his particularly useful insight into the adventure story-arc!

Handbook
Finally, we are very keen to get a Player's Handbook written and in print, we have so many ideas for making the players experience so much more! "What ideas?" we hear you cry. Ok...

1. More careers of both legitimate and illegitimate types, so characters can be developed even more before they step into the world of Pangu.

2. More skills, more martial arts, more blades and more guns!

3. More cool tech that does things that cool tech should do (see through walls, levitate stuff, create force fields, communicate with different realities, brew great tea...)

4. The ability to play demon or charmed characters as well as humans.

5. More ready to go clan sorceries and with those, a closer look at each of the clans.

And that is just the beginning...

So there you have it; The Campaign is Dead, Long Live the Campaign!

Again thanks you to all of you who backed us right off the bat, you have given far more than financial support. Let's keep this thing going, let's build a company together that we and Hong Kong and the world of role-playing can be proud of!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you play games, please talk about us, tweet about us and post about us.  Follow us on Twitter and Facebook and encourage your friends to check out this campaign.  Tweet about us (@NineDragonsPub)!  If you got 9 friends together and each donated US$10 then we'd be well on the way to our goal, and you'd be part of the RPG industry!

This is a campaign for those of us who look back dewy-eyed at Dungeons and Dragons, who get tearful over Traveller and who just want a nice long cuddle with Cthulhu.  This is a campaign for role-players who still remember starting play at 11am and not finishing until 5pm the next day.  This is a campaign for you.  We'd love you to be involved!  Peace.  Love.  Game.

This is a campaign for those of us who look back dewy-eyed at Dungeons and Dragons, who get tearful over Traveller and who just want a nice long cuddle with Cthulhu.  This is a campaign for role-players who still remember starting play at 11am and not finishing until 5pm the next day.  This is a campaign for you.  We'd love you to be involved!  Peace.  Love.  Game.
campaign_city: Kowloon Walled City (Dark City), Hong Kong

story:
What are you going to do with it?  

Game Designer, Kirsten Bonanza, created Waste Not because it drives her crazy to have to throw things away.  The game itself as a way to explain the possible options available when an object is no longer good for its inital use. The core question of the game - What are you going to do with it? - challenges players to rethink trash as potential and resources.  Waste Not is being made available as a card game for in person play and as an online game.

  • 1-100 players

  • Ages 12 - 120 (Can be played with younger if an adult helps)

  • For Classrooms, Community Groups, Businesses going green, Designers, & Families

Kirsten's background is in teaching, facilitating, and consulting.  Her interest in design lies in educating for sustainability and systems thinking.  She also believes that we will achieve a sustainable future more easily by giving people the experience of how a large system (Earth) works in a playful environment.

After Kirsten realized that she'd begun work on her 10th idea for a game, that while her heart calls out to teach and work with Entrepreneurs on building their organizations, it is obvious that Game Design is no longer just a hobby or tool for her own personal use.  With her company Create Better Impact Games, Kirsten seeks to do just that - create better impact on the world. 

Funding This Campaign Creates Better Impact!

  • Getting this Transformative Tool into the hands of many people

  • Spread the seeds of Curiosity and Innovation

  • Become Resource Full

  • Creating positive thought patterns

All of the above helps us to live the changes that we wish to see in our culture and world.  Really understanding what is behind our actions can help us to form new actions that are more well informed and better for the planet. 

Better for the planet = Better for us!

 

  • Eco-friendly production by a Green Printer

  • Upcycled decks available

  • Supporting Local Businesses

Supporting Create Better Impact Games in this campaign goes deeper than the game into the business itself.  CBIGames proudly works with locally-based companies in Western Mass like Rich Roth, Weyakin Designs, Ellipsis Video, and is a proud member of Pioneer Valley Local First.  The game is printed on recycled content, and vegetable based inks through our local, green printing business Tiger Press.  CBIGames is also actively looking into making games in a way that uses upcycled materials.  So far Kirsten's collected enough used cards to make 20 decks.

What We Need & What You Get

For the Card Game the money will go to print and ship the first edition of 1,000 copies.  More games will be printed if the goal is exceeded. 

For the Online game the current version is fairly basic and the funds are being devoted to upgrading it to a better and more complete player experience. Including
1) Adding sound so that people with disabilities can play as well,
2) There is currently no plan to make this an app, BUT we'd like to revise the website so that it is more easily readable/ playable on mobile phones, and tablets.
 
Super Hero's Guild formation - Create Better Impact wants to create a Unique user experience using its own crowd funding and engagement platform where members of the Guild can vote for topics and ideas for new boardgames online.  Membership in the Guild includes discounts on future products.

Perks

Thank you card
Sent electronically this card can be printed out ang hung by your trash can as a reminder to Waste Not!

Play Online
Access to play the full version of Waste Not including Upcycling, Re-Design and Hazardous Waste

Upcycled copy of Waste Not - 20 available
Please keep in mind that Upcycling means Re-Using materials and turning them into something new.  These decks will all be unique, based on available materials, and will not have the graphics of the print game.

Waste Not Card Game
Printed on recycled content by a FSC certified printer with veggie based inks. What more could you want?

Invite to the Launch party
Join us in April in Western Mass  *Travel not included* to celebrate the launch and pick up your very own Card Game at the same time.

Supporter
Listing on our website in the Credits for the game as a Supporter. Invite to the Launch party - Join us in April in Western Mass  *Travel not included* to celebrate the launch and your very own Card Game.

Card Game Proof - 2 available
Own one of the first two copies of the game ever printed, mistakes and all.  Invite to the Launch party - Join us in April in Western Mass  *Travel not included* to celebrate the launch and pick up your very own Card Game at the same time.

Producer's credit - 2 available
Listing online under the Credits for the game as a producer, your logo or name will be on the printed rules for the Card Game, AND you get to choose an item to add to the game.  Invite to the Launch party - Join us in April in Western Mass to celebrate the launch and pick up your very own Card Game at the same time.

If the goal is not met then the card game will still be printed but there will be fewer copies.  The online game will still have most of the upgrades made.  The Superhero's Guild might have to wait to be built out fully, but future discounts would still apply.

The Impact

Shift your thinking

The lessons learned and assimilated through playing Waste Not have the ability to make real change in behaviors and how we interact with the world.  By playing until the deck is mastered, players will start to shift their thinking into a way that is more sustainable.

Use resources more efficiently

Understandings in an office setting might look like more sustainable use of available supplies, and better ideas on how to operate without waste.  In a team of designers the game would enable them to look at the product or process they are developing with an understanding the leftover materials should be considered, to think about what will happen to what they are making at the end of its lifecycle, and to inherently be more creative with the products and processes that they employ. 

Get Creativity and Innovation into the hands of our Future

Finally and perhaps most importantly, Waste Not can help to enable our next generation to be thinkers.  Students are our future and with their fresh take on established systems the sooner that they are looking at how to do things differently, the better.  Waste Not can build these patterns of thinking early and in a way that they stick.

This is the first game brought to market, but not the first designed to completion.  The first, Common Cents, was designed to teach why buying local matters in a playshop (workshop simulation) format.  Because of its more limited audience the choice to wait to make it more widely available became clear. In addition to Common Cents, Kirsten also regularly works with organizations to design games and playful experiences.

Having this campaign funded would not only allow Waste Not to be brought into the world to create positive action, it would also serve to provide Kirsten the opportunity to work on and bring to life the next of the 10+ other ideas that she has for games on sustainability.

Share, share, share! 

Make some noise using Indiegogo's share tools.  Ask your local, independant game store to pre-order, tell your friends who are teachers, have families, like games, or work with Green Businesses.

Check out the trial version for FREE at our website.

And while you are at the site check out how you can play while healping to spread the word during this campaign via Social Media.

For Twitter users, follow @WasteNotGame

Basically you get to play the game using the social media that you are on and other people can chime in too! You get to be a part of raising awareness about how to best use our Resources and spread the word about the campaign. 

Like Waste Not  & Create Better Impact Games on Facebook for updates and to play along!

If the goal is not met then the card game will still be printed but there will be fewer copies.  The online game will still have most of the upgrades made.  The Superhero's Guild might have to wait to be built out fully, but future discounts would still apply.


The Impact
Shift your thinking
The lessons learned and assimilated through playing Waste Not have the ability to make real change in behaviors and how we interact with the world.  By playing until the deck is mastered, players will start to shift their thinking into a way that is more sustainable.
Use resources more efficiently
Understandings in an office setting might look like more sustainable use of available supplies, and better ideas on how to operate without waste.  In a team of designers the game would enable them to look at the product or process they are developing with an understanding the leftover materials should be considered, to think about what will happen to what they are making at the end of its lifecycle, and to inherently be more creative with the products and processes that they employ. 
Get Creativity and Innovation into the hands of our Future
Finally and perhaps most importantly, Waste Not can help to enable our next generation to be thinkers.  Students are our future and with their fresh take on established systems the sooner that they are looking at how to do things differently, the better.  Waste Not can build these patterns of thinking early and in a way that they stick.
This is the first game brought to market, but not the first designed to completion.  The first, Common Cents, was designed to teach why buying local matters in a playshop (workshop simulation) format.  Because of its more limited audience the choice to wait to make it more widely available became clear. In addition to Common Cents, Kirsten also regularly works with organizations to design games and playful experiences.
Having this campaign funded would not only allow Waste Not to be brought into the world to create positive action, it would also serve to provide Kirsten the opportunity to work on and bring to life the next of the 10+ other ideas that she has for games on sustainability.


Share, share, share! 
Make some noise using Indiegogo's share tools.  Ask your local, independant game store to pre-order, tell your friends who are teachers, have families, like games, or work with Green Businesses.
Check out the trial version for FREE at our website.
And while you are at the site check out how you can play while healping to spread the word during this campaign via Social Media.
For Twitter users, follow @WasteNotGame 
Basically you get to play the game using the social media that you are on and other people can chime in too! You get to be a part of raising awareness about how to best use our Resources and spread the word about the campaign. 
Like Waste Not  & Create Better Impact Games on Facebook for updates and to play along!

story:
We know that there are literally tens of thousands of kids around the world that really want to play with other kids online, in a multiplayer environment.

If you have seen what goes on in most of these Minecraft Servers you will know that there is profound and profuse swearing, bullying (often called griefing) and 'raging'.  We have developed MinecraftBuddy to ensure that the playing environment is safe, infact, it is moderated by teachers and vetted adults to make sure that if a kid does need help, there is someone there to guide them, or referee a problem.

MinecraftBuddy is a Minecraft Server that allows children to play in survival or creative mode, to play minigames, complete challenges and quests and enter competitions.  It is a 'whitelisted' server, meaning that only those players that meet our requirements can join. Because the server is whitelisted we have a very small membership (around 400). We know that kids want to play with other kids.

Kids want to play with other kids, that is the whole idea of playing online.  The problem we have encountered is that because we are whitelisted, there are often no kids on the server.

- and when there are no kids on the server, no one else wants to play there either; so we are experiencing a vicious circle: people sign up, the kids see only a few others playing, and soon stop playing on our server, and parents cancel their subscription.  

We believe in this concept, of having a safe place for kids to play their favourite game.

We also think that is is possible to offer this service to families for free, and ultimately, that's what we want to do.

We had an awesome Admin on the server called Simplimazing and while she was a full time admin the number of kids on the server at any one time was increasing.  Our money ran out, and we could no longer afford to pay Simp, and our numbers dropped as soon as she left.

So, we want to pay Simp a full time wage for 12 months, and pay for the server to be hosted while we make our improvements and set the server up to be the very best 'kid safe server' we can.

As you can see, we have stretch goals that will improve the server beyond belief, as explained below.

The main reason we want to have Simp as a full time admin is that she keeps the server safe.  She also makes it fun and engaging too.  Some of the really cool stuff Simp did as a full time admin was:

  •  to help shy kids to make friends
  •  work effectively with kids on the spectrum (ASD - autism spectrum disorder),  helping them to build their ability to communicate through the 'chat' function
  •  communicate with parents to resolve issues
  •  create displays for the website and the Facebook page to keep players and  families informed about cool stuff that was happening on the server
  •  Develop and manage treasure hunts
  •  Make continual improvements, including fixing and creating mini games
  •  Encourage players to be creative and have fun

As our numbers grow we will look to add a second paid Admin, but for now we have some awesome volunteers that have been helping to make MinecraftBuddy a safe place to play.

Originally we set up a subscription model to help pay for the server, with the idea of increasing subscriptions giving us the scope to further develop and improve the MinecraftBuddy concept.

The subscriptions haven't helped to keep MinecraftBuddy up and running.  We decided to follow the example many other successful servers have developed, and will create BuddyVerse, a minigames server that will generate the income needed to keep MinecraftBuddy running.  The donations received through Indiegogo will help us sustain MinecraftBuddy for 12 months, and if we can hit some of our stretch goals, we can set the server up to be FREE for the future.

MinecraftBuddy is a vast server, and needs constant maintenance.  This is one of the important reasons we need a full time Admin.  We are always getting great ideas from our player group to improve MinecraftBuddy, and while Simplimazing was a full time Admin, some of those ideas came to life.  

With Simp as the Admin again, and with some of our stretch goals being reached, we can continue to improve MinecraftBuddy.  Some of our goals for continual improvement are:

  • Customising the current website at http://minecraftbuddy.co and moving it to minecraftbuddy.com
  • Developing tutorials and in-game challenges for those that are new to Minecraft or have a learning difficulty
  • Developing and improving the http://minecraftchallenges.com website, then integrating the quests and challenges on the server, so that challenges and quest completion are recorded on the challenges website.  Linking Ranks to completion of quests or challenge sequences
  • Further developing academic challenges for the minecraftchallenges.com website.  Linking Google Apps For Education as part of the challenge process

We tried to make this a user pays server, and although it seemed like a good idea, it doesn't promote its continual growth.  We are now asking for donations and the way we will use them are as follows, we will pay for:

  1. The server hosting
  2. Simp's Admin wage for 12 months.  As soon as we have 3 months wages donated Simp will join the server and our plans can begin to see fruit.
  3. Once we have 12 months of Simp's wages and 12 months of server hosting, we will declare the server free to join.

We will continue to develop the server as donations come in, which is clearly stated in the next section, the budget.

The rewards will also be explained in more detail below, though it can be noted that we will deliver all digital rewards within 7 days.  Anything that needs packing and posting will depend upon where you are from; be assured that we will send things off as soon as we can.  We will be encouraging you to take a picture of your rewards and post them through social media.

Our initial goal, that of sustaining a safe Minecraft server for kids to play, is $28,368. This in itself is a large sum of money.  You have probably already noticed that our stretch goals go well beyond this?  As is stated in the next section we have grand dreams of what MinecraftBuddy can be.  Through conversations with parents and educators the world over, we are convinced that this is a service that is needed, not just for 'mainstream' kids, kids on the ASD spectrum, and children with learning difficulties, but also for seniors, war veterans and people that have suffered PTSD.  We also believe that this will develop into a very handy and much needed teaching tool.


How the money will be spent, initially, is quite simple.

Goal: $28,368

Fees: $2,128

Server Hosting: $480

Admin Wage: $20,800

Rewards:$5,000

The rewards will seem a high percentage (about 25%), but keep in mind that the high end rewards are Minecraft Camps anywhere in the world.  These Camps are not cheap to run locally, so if we are offered the opportunity to hold them throughout the world, we need to make sure we have priced our goals and perks accordingly.

We will continue to report on our MinecraftBuddy accomplishments, and will post photos, videos and artwork of the project as we go.

Once we have MinecraftBuddy as a sustainable server (hosting and Simp's wage) we will look at improvement.  As explained in the budget above, these stretch goals have financial figures attached and each goal will help MinecraftBuddy to grow.

  • Freedom - $28,368 MinecraftBuddy is FREE 
  • Master Coder - $72600 we can employ the Master Coder - Tsugaga - 12 months
  • Coder Buddy - $86,900 To speed up the process, and add detail to the planned improvements, a second coder will be employed (part time).
  • 2nd Admin - $114,400 we will secure a second Administrator for the server.  We will look to have our 2nd admin in another timezome, allowing us to cover more hours in the day.
  • Coders 3 & 4 - $143,000 to continue to improve and maintain the MinecraftBuddy and Buddyverse servers we will bring in 2 more coders.
  • Website Designers - $184,800 we will look to have complete integration throughout the server and the sites (Ranks, money, quests) and for this we will use our coders and employ website designers that specialise in Minecraft server integration with Wordpress.
  • Dedicated Server Hosting - $199,500 will allow us to get a dedicated server for hosting (12 months)
  • Veterans Server - $214,000 we can introduce the MinecraftBuddy Seniors & Vets Server.  One of our Grandparents on the site, Agnak12 is leading the introduction of a MinecraftBuddy concept for Seniors (over 60) and war veterans. As we pursue this we are looking to develop the server with neuro linguistic aspects to help keep veterans and the elderly 'sharp' of mind.
  • Multinational Multi Servers - $242,400 will allow 4 x Dedicated multinational servers.  As MinecraftBuddy grows across all continents, we will need to have our hosting dedicated, and close to our players.

If we reach a significant portion of our stretch goals without many Minecraft Camp donations, and therefore have not spent so much on rewards, we will hold a raffle for our funders, and the winner will get a Minecraft Camp in their town - please note that this is subject to the types on perks/rewards/donations funders choose to help with.

_______________________________________________________________________


So, what's in it for you? We love the fact that you are on the same page as we are, and that you 'get it'.  We also really, really appreciate your support, so we have put together some seriously crazy perks to entice and reward you.  The following is a list of the rewards, following this is are the perks that they are grouped in.


Here's a blurb on each of the rewards we offer:

Wow.....just Wow!  You have seen our Minecraft Camps on Facebook, now, by donating to the MinecraftBuddy project you can have a Minecraft Camp in your own town - Anywhere in the world!  We come to you.

MinecraftBuddy has some amazing items in our online store.  Players can purchase things like a Farmer's Starter Pack, In-Game Money & Enchanted Items.  Choose any 2 products other than ranks.

Let us tell the world how awesome you are, We will post on Facebook, Google+ and Twitter announcing your pledge to the MinecraftBuddy project.

Our resident artist, Glenda will create custom MinecraftBuddy wallpapers that you will want to have on your computers and mobile devices too; and hey, they are yours to share with others if you want to.

This guide, written by Tim Wicks and Sean Firth will set your parents straight on the ins and outs of Minecraft.  For those of you that are parents, it will help you get your head around how to make sure your child gets the most of Minecraft and how they can stay safe.

Ranks add to the fun of MinecraftBuddy.  Here we are offering the Veteran, Lord, Maverick and Legend ranks.  We are also introducing a new rank called Angel.  We will continue to add a new rank for every $25,000 raised.  The supporter that has driven the most traffic to our Indiegogo project at the time will be asked to contribute ideas for the rank.

One of our Pro Builders will build something for you.

You can offer ideas for a minigame and/or name it, as long as you come up with something cool ;)

Glenda has designed some sick Tshirts for you.  We also offer hats, mouse mats etc.

This is the crafting book (digital edition) from our Minecraft Camps, but we have revised and updated it, so it is even better.

Now you can stay productive and see your favourite MinecraftBuddy images in this beautiful 2014 calendar (digital edition).

Get your tatts on!  We will send you a custom MinecraftBuddy tattoo designed by Glenda, our in-house artist.

Spend 30 minutes with the MinecraftBuddy Team:

- Discuss any help/support you need

- Offer advice on changes that will improve the server

- Ask for a short tutorial on any MinecraftBuddy related topic

- Talk with Mr Doody (Owner) and/or Simplimazing (Admin)


_______________________________________________________________________

This is how the above rewards will be grouped:


Server Shop Items - Choose ANY 2 products (not ranks) from the Minecraftbuddy store

Shoutouts To Facebook, Google+ & Twitter

Your name and a quote by you with the title Tourist on our dedicated Supporter webpage


Server Shop Items - Choose ANY 2 products (not ranks) from the Minecraftbuddy store

Awesome MinecraftBuddy Wallpaper Pack &

Parent's Guide To Minecraft Book (Full Edition)

Shoutouts To Facebook, Google+ & Twitter

Your name and a quote by you with the title Member on our dedicated Supporter webpage

Server Shop Items - Choose ANY 2 products (not ranks) from the Minecraftbuddy store

Awesome MinecraftBuddy Wallpaper Pack &

Parent's Guide To Minecraft Book (Full Edition)

Minecraft Camps 2014 Calendar

Shoutouts To Facebook, Google+ & Twitter

'Lord Rank' forever in MinecraftBuddy

Your name and a quote by you with the title Lord on our dedicated Supporter webpage

Get our Pro Builder to build a simple (yet stunning) structure for you in the MinecraftBuddy survival world and protect it for you.

Awesome MinecraftBuddy Wallpaper Pack &

Parent's Guide To Minecraft Book (Full Edition)

& Minecraft Camps 2014 Calendar

Shoutouts To Facebook, Google+ & Twitter

Your name and a quote by you with the title Builder on our dedicated Supporter webpage

Choose the name for a Large MiniGame and this donation will pay for it to be made. We will provide you with a list of games to choose from. - The name must be cool!

Awesome MinecraftBuddy Wallpaper Pack &

Parent's Guide To Minecraft Book (Full Edition)

Crafting Recipe Book Original and exclusive (digital)

& Minecraft Camps 2014 Calendar

Shoutouts To Facebook, Google+ & Twitter

Your name and a quote by you with the title MiniGame Benefactor on our dedicated Supporter webpage

Radical Temporary Tattoo

Have a City named after yourself (or a name of your choosing) in MinecraftBuddy Survival world

MinecraftBuddy Tshirt with original design

Minecraftbuddy Original Cap

Crafting Recipe Book Original and exclusive (digital)

Choose the name for one of our key NPC characters

Awesome MinecraftBuddy Wallpaper Pack &

Parent's Guide To Minecraft Book (Full Edition)

& Minecraft Camps 2014 Calendar

Get our Pro Builder to build a simple (yet stunning) structure for you in the MinecraftBuddy survival world and protect it for you.

Shoutouts To Facebook, Google+ & Twitter

Legend Rank forever in MinecraftBuddy

Your name and a quote by you with the title Legend on our dedicated Supporter webpage


A two day Minecraft Camp for up to 20 participants in ANY location of your choosing within Australia. We bring all the equipment to you, to your town, and hod a Minecraft Camp for you and your friends/students/colleagues.

All costs included.

Full access to the Teacher Minecraft Resource Pack

A two day Minecraft Camp for up to 20 participants in ANY location of your choosing anywhere in the world. We bring all the equipment to you, to your town, and hod a Minecraft Camp for you and your friends/students/colleagues.

All costs included.

Full access to the Teacher Minecraft Resource Pack

story:
Encounter wild animals, revive ancient machines, and fly like a bird in the aerial exploration game Secrets of Rætikon.

This game is in active development. Support us by joining the Open Alpha of Secrets of Rætikon. We are developing this game while you are reading this and we will update the game nearly every week. Within a day, you get a copy of the game if you support this campaign. It's full of surprises, bugs and missing features, but Secrets of Rætikon already looks and plays beautiful. Watch us create a world brimming with life and full of stories.

      

We are the indie developers Broken Rules, creators of And Yet It Moves. 
Secrets of Rætikon is our third and most ambitious project; an open world action-adventure with a focus on exploration. Secrets of Rætikon will launch on Windows, Mac and Linux.

Development started with a dream about flying. One day, Felix came into the office and told us about a dream he had, and we started sharing stories about how each of us flies in dreams. It turned out we all love those dreams. So we decided to make this game, a game where you swoop over hills and mountains, as in a dream.

The world of Secrets of Rætikon is richly populated with robins, lynx, jackdaws, stag, foxes, rabbits, buzzards, bats and more to come. Throughout the Alps, you find remnants of an ancient civilization. Some of the secrets of the Rætikon are hidden behind their fantastic contraptions - strange machines that you'll activate to progress through the game. A world made of triangles invites you to become part of the enduring struggle between nature and civilization.

      

      


We've been working on Secrets of Rætikon for more than two years, and now the alpha is ready for you to play.

If you support this campaign, we will send you a copy of the game as soon as Indiegogo has processed your order. Be aware that we have to send out the keys by hand, so it might take us a few days.

Like any good alpha, things can sometimes go haywire in the game. Fortunately, most of the time it's great fun when they do! Things we've seen happen recently include:

  • Rabbits getting catapulted into the sky.
  • A stag got bitten by a lynx, then blithely dragged it through half the level before meeting an untimely end.
  • Sporadic cases of rabbit necrophilia
  • ... and odd game crashes. Those are not as fun, though.

We need your help to finish the game because we are running out of funds! 

We want to finish the game with YOU instead of turning to a publisher. In return, we open our development. By 'open' we mean that we will share our assets and tools that we use to create the game. That includes the level editor which is already included in the first tier.

We plan to ship the finished game in the first quarter of 2014 if we are successful in funding the rest of the development. That's where you come into play!

Fortunately we've received a government grant for Secrets of Rætikon that carried us this far. The grant was for a series of games based in the Alps. Secrets of Rætikon is the second game in this series, following Chasing Aurora, our multiplayer game that launched on the Wii U. The rest of the Rætikon development was funded with the revenue of And Yet It Moves and our private money.

We need to continue working on the game for at least two months, cover our license fees, and promote the game at a number of game festivals. We're based in Europe, so traveling to the United States, where most of those festivals take place, costs quite a bit of money.

Most of the funding we receive through this campaign goes directly into game development. A small fraction goes to Indiegogo for hosting the campaign. And of course we need to pay for the manufacturing and shipping of the physical rewards.

There is still a lot of content to be added to the game and we want to be able to take the time to give the game the amount of polish deserves. Also we need to feed ourselves and our families.

Fun fact: during the production of this game and the engine, five babies were born and one more is on its way. True story.

Broken Rules started out as a student project in 2006. The initial team, consisting of Felix, Jan and Peter, met at a game design course at Vienna’s Technical University. During that course we made And Yet It Moves. When we won the Student Award at the Independent Games Festival 2007 we decided to turn the prototype into a real game. Two years later, we founded Broken Rules and released And Yet It Moves on Steam and the Nintendo Wii. At that time, Clemens and Martin joined the team. Together, we started working on Chasing Aurora which we released as a launch title for the Nintendo Wii U.

Christof is the musical mastermind behind Secrets of Rætikon. He is a composer, zither player and rocks the bassoon. For Secrets of Rætikon, he works with all kinds of strange instruments - from wood and water to electronics - to put together a unique soundscape. 

Clemens is our pixel pusher. He's our sole artist and creates all the graphics for Secrets of Rætikon.

Felix is CEO and game designer. He programs a lot of the gameplay, A.I. and signs contracts. He coded the rabbits in the game.

Husky is our graphics programmer. He also manages the Windows and Linux versions.

Jan does our sound design and is also responsible for gameplay. He writes a lot of our A.I. and manages the Mac version of the game.

Martin runs our marketing and writes our stories. He is also responsible for the level editor and business. He talks a lot.

Peter is our lead programmer. He made the engine that the game runs on. He dreams in code.

Tier 1 - Alpha Æccess | Tier 2 - Benefæctor Edition | Tier 3 - Collectors Edition
Tier 4 - Character Pack | Tier 5 - Rætic Pilgrim | Tier 6 - Unique Artefæct
Tier 7 - Lore Mæster | Tier 8 - Rætic Deity

We've cooked up special rewards for our supporters. Here's a quick overview of all the different rewards you will find in the  tiers shown above.

A copy of the game. Continuous updates throughout the alpha and beyond. Windows and Mac version available right now. Linux coming soon. Be aware that we have to send out the keys by hand, so it might take us a few days to process your order.

Steam keys on launch. As soon as we launch Secrets of Rætikon on Steam you will receive a download key.

Exclusive project updates. Whatever we add to the game – as an Indiegogo supporter you will hear about it first.

Access to the secret alpha boards. Discuss anything and everything with other players and the creators of the game.

Lay your hands on the in-game editor we're using to build Secrets of Rætikon. Make your own levels. Change the levels we've built. Create your own game.

All music tracks originally composed by our musician Christof Dienz. Digital download in FLAC, MP3 and OGG format.

Check out these samples: Isadora's Cave | Into the Wild | Hunting

Get mentioned in the credits. Your name in the credits level. On a parallax layer, because it looks cool.

There will be two options to get extra characters. In one tier, you'll receive a community-voted alternate character: after this campaign is over, we'll run a poll with everybody who has bought this tier. The character that receives most votes goes into the build. You'll be able to choose between Ruth, Solitude, Fex and Storm from Chasing Aurora.

In a higher tier, you'll get all four extra characters already included in the package.

From the 'Collectors Edition' tier on upwards, you will get an early, never publicly seen before prototype of the game featuring unique levels, bugs and hostile animals.

The Book of Rætikon is a collection of transcriptions and illustrations from the five Rætic Lore Mæsters. It is a rare item and only few printed copies remain. Luckily, modern technology allows digital reprography and now everybody can enjoy the full backstory, sketches, concept art and high resolution images.

Receive an exclusive, signed and numbered art print, created by Clemens, our artist. These prints are limited to 250.

We will send you a finely crafted cardboard box that holds a beautiful, custom branded USB stick made of wood.

You will receive a personalized wallpaper featuring your name in Rætic runes.

Your name will be carved into stone at a sacred pilgrimage site that marks the entrance to the cave of the Rætic gods. You get to choose a pilgrim's name, which will be written in Rætic runes.

The backstory is told in the game using quotes from the Book of Rætikon. The book was written by five lore masters and each quote is attributed to one of them. Together with Martin, author of the backstory, you will get to name one of the lore masters and customize the quotes in game.

Your likeness in the cave of the Rætic gods. Send us a photo of you, your dear loved one or your pet baby alligator! We will erect a statue in the cave, carrying your/his/her/its name.

You will receive a unique, hand-drawn artwork, signed by our artist Clemens.

            

All rewards except the alpha will be delivered after the game is finished!

The louder you are the more money we'll raise.
The person who makes the most noise about this campaign will receive a unique gift from us: a larger-than-life fox statue made from cardboard. We’ll be awarding this statue to the individual who brings the most contributions in using Indiegogo’s sharing tools.

Just be sure to create an Indiegogo account and use their tools to earn a chance at this a one-of-a-kind reward. Use the sharing tools to shepherd the most friends and family to our campaign and the fox is yours!

Every game project has some risks attached. We have a running alpha version of the game. If you support us you get a playable build of the game as soon as we process your payment. We're a small indie studio, so a little bit of patience will be required.

This is a campaign makes it possible for us to finish the game. We can't do that without you. Please join us in the Alpha!

story:
**Note** The Project is moving forward with or without reaching the flex goal. There is no worry or your donation being meaningless or lost and your donation will only help us enhance the projects timeline and features.



Sabaton: War of the Weeping Lands is a new fresh take on a classic game, Brigandine: the Legend of Forsena. For some time fans have been asking for a Brigandine 2 but alas this has not come to pass. 

Consternation spread through the three nations as one by one members of their ruling families began to disappear. The nations, all self-absorbed by nature, tried to resolve the problems diplomatically, offering help and apologies to each other. However, these messengers never reached their goals, butchered on the way. Each province assumed that this was an act of hostility by the other – a clear admission of guilt for the kidnappings – and the three of them joined in battle. As they interrogated the prisoners they took that day, they realised that something was wrong, that far from slaying their messengers, the nations they were now fighting had been just as eager for peace as they had. But it was too late, blood had been shed, territories seized: the victors could not let their position of strength go and the losers wanted revenge. So the wars carried on, even as they realised that this conflict had been orchestrated by someone else, someone who wanted to see them weakened, someone with a terrible and inscrutable purpose. They fought and did not relent because they did not want to face whatever was to come when the war was over. 

The Kingdoms

  • The Carnifair - a nation dominated by an artificial and gratuitous system of government. Huge beasts stalk their lands, attacking the villages of the province endlessly. For their protection, these settlements hire hero’s from the central guild, playing them for their protection. Little do they know that it is the guild themselves that create these monsters, desperate to ensure that their income and dominance in society remains intact, even at the expense of the progress of their nation and the lives of their people. 


  • The Urbz - a city in constant motion. Not across the land, like the fabled desert tribes, but down. The land that the city was built upon appeared firm initially, but as the capitol grew larger and larger it began slowly to sink. Its citizens were unwilling to abandon the city of their birth and the favourable location it occupied, so they built up frantically, trying to outpace the rising earth. Over the years they have become a nation dedicated to this one purpose, architects supervising construction day and night whilst foragers swarm across its territory collecting the resources required.

  • The Stema - Many years ago a man was born. A man who saw within himself potential too vast for any one lifetime. Tantalized by the thousands of possibilities he saw, he slew himself, turning his dead body into a production line, birthing endless copies of himself. These, clones, the Stema, set about to realize the potential he had seen, all training themselves in different things, changing their environmental conditions to unlock new possibilities. They are a race ferociously unified and yet divided, all the same man, but each of them pursuing something different. 


Evolution System

In Sabaton we envision a detailed branching evolution system. You will have the choice of taking the creatures in many many different directions. Don't believe me. Check This Out! We will go into more detail on each creature as we progress!

And this is only the common creatures. Not the Kingdom specific creatures or heroes!

Future Content

We will be releasing more and more content as we go for free! Release 2 is planned for shortly after the launch to the public and will include 3 more fully playable kingdoms for your enjoyment as well as a multi-player aspect for crushing others in a with friends style single battle mode, and in a full game using the with friends aspect style.

That's:

  • 3 Additional Kingdoms for a total of 6
  • Much larger map to include all the Kingdoms
  • Single Battle Multi-Player support, with friends style (with time limit & AI)
  • Full game Multi-Player support, with friends style (with time limit & AI)
  • Additional items, weapons, armor, & more
  • Additional Creatures, Heroes, & Evolution's


The Weeping Land is an enormous geyser that flows for miles. Each Kingdom will have their place and will fight for dominance. No one knows where the water comes from.

The Battles will be 3 heroes versus 3 heroes. Each Hero will have his own monster horde. Movement and fighting will be based on a turn based system. 

The Battle Map will be a hexagonal mapping system with various terrain that will include bonuses and penalties depending on the creature type in the location.

The Questing System will be interactive and allow for the player to manage the choices the heroes will take while on a quest. There is some randomness included to ensure that the player gets unique experiences.


Your donations are the chance to make a big splash and get into the game. Whether it's a simple donation, being in the credits, or participating in the alpha's or beta's, or getting free game currency for life, it matters.

Remolding a classic is a tough job! Enhancing it and placing it on mobile devices is even harder. If you can't donate, Spread The Word.



                                 





  Phillip - Game Designer & Lead Project Manager

  Josh - Creative Writer, Project Manager, & Game Designer

  Waqi - Graphic Designer

  Stan - Lead Developer



                                                     Bit Bot - Team Mascot

Thank you all for your continued support. We appreciate all you can do and hope that people will come to love our game.

If you can't donate, Spread The Word.                                   Phillip - Game Designer & Lead Project Manager  Josh - Creative Writer, Project Manager, & Game Designer  Waqi - Graphic Designer  Stan - Lead Developer                                                     Bit Bot - Team MascotThank you all for your continued support. story:
MAFIA THE PARTY GAME is a multiplayer role-playing game centered on a battle between an informed minority and an uninformed majority. Players are secretly assigned roles in two distinct aspects: either as discreet members of the Mafia, who know each other; or Citizens who know only the number of Mafia among them. In the game's Night Phase the Mafia covertly operates to "murder" a Citizen. During the Day Phase, all surviving players debate the identities of the Mafia and vote to eliminate a suspect. Play continues until all of the Mafia members have been eliminated, or until the Mafia outnumbers the Citizens.


Features

Unlike the traditional way of playing Mafia, where players must be gathered in one room and where the game can easily get out of hand, players will be able play in organized (or optionally timed') games against each other all over the world without having to leave the comfort of their home.

Additionally, points accumulated during play can be used to obtain items for  protection or to heighten the stakes. Need to put a hit on someone? Or hire a private investigator to unearth the truth about your suspicions? Earned points can be used in-game to acquire these professionals.


Screenshots of characters, weapons and scenes:



Why indiegogo?

Our full-time investment of time and money has produced 20% of the game. Additional resources are required to complete the production for a timely release by March 2014. Through this indiegogo project, you can help us raise money to produce an amazing and unforgettable cross-platform game.

How will the money be used?

Money raised will be used to meet these milestones:

- Goal of $25,000: develop the iPhone, iPod and iPad version of the game

- Goal of $50,000: extend the game for use on Andriod and Windows operated devices

- Goal of $100,000: extend the game for use on Blackberry, PC and Mac through Facebook

Features
Unlike the traditional way of playing Mafia, where players must be gathered in one room and where the game can easily get out of hand, players will be able play in organized (or optionally timed') games against each other all over the world without having to leave the comfort of their home.
Additionally, points accumulated during play can be used to obtain items for  protection or to heighten the stakes. Need to put a hit on someone? Or hire a private investigator to unearth the truth about your suspicions? Earned points can be used in-game to acquire these professionals.





Screenshots of characters, weapons and scenes:



























Why indiegogo?
Our full-time investment of time and money has produced 20% of the game. Additional resources are required to complete the production for a timely release by March 2014. Through this indiegogo project, you can help us raise money to produce an amazing and unforgettable cross-platform game.
How will the money be used?
Money raised will be used to meet these milestones:
- Goal of $25,000: develop the iPhone, iPod and iPad version of the game
- Goal of $50,000: extend the game for use on Andriod and Windows operated devices
- Goal of $100,000: extend the game for use on Blackberry, PC and Mac through Facebook

story:
My name is James Arndt. I'm an established game developer based out of Central Florida. You can see my work at www.jamesarndt3d.com and check out a history of some of the games I've worked on.
This campaign is based around the idea of bringing high quality assets to people for a very low price. It's also geared towards providing assets for projects being developed for mobile platforms like iOS and Android. These assets are low poly, low bone count and have low texture overhead. I'll get into the nitty gritty technical details below.

What I'm hoping to achieve with this campaign is : Provide low cost assets to game developers for usage in their mobile projects. At the same time I am hoping to fund my own hourly work on these assets and expand the collection to include all (3) of the character sets. The sets will include a low poly zombie pack, a low poly military personnel pack, and a civilian pack. Each pack will consist of one universal model and (5) texture variations for each...this means 15 different animated characters for your game!

What you will get in this campaign is direct digital delivery of (3) different character packs. These consist of the Low Poly Zombie Pack, the Low Poly Military Pack and the Low Poly Civilian Pack. Each of these packs comes with (5) texture variations and at least  (10) animations per character. Depending on the perk you choose you can choose to receive any single character set, (2) character sets or the entire (3) character pack! Don't forget the Low Poly Military Pack comes bundled with the Low Poly Weapon Pack (see below). 

UPDATED - Every character pack now comes with the Low Poly Melee Weapons Bundle!

What I need are funds to cover my hourly rate for modeling, texturing, rigging and animation of the additional assets required to complete all of the packs. I anticipate this will be 2-3 weeks of work polishing up the assets and getting them all to a final deliverable state. I anticipate 30-40 production hours to complete the pack and my funding goal fits right into that.

Some technical details: 

  • All characters contain 16 Bones in their respective rig setups.

  • The characters are setup using Biped in 3DS Max. This is important for editing or addition of new animations. I am providing the models in .max, .obj and .fbx formats. These formats are usable in a variety of game engines.

  • Characters are 500 quad polygons, some characters may exceed this to a ceiling of 600 quad polygons.

  • All characters use either a 256x256 or 512x512 PSD texture. These textures are fully editable, contain aptly named layers and make extensive use of layer styles and color overlays (allows flexibility in customizing look further).

Here are web demos of the Zombie and Military Character animations and texture variations. 


(You will need Unity Webplayer plugin)

Zombie Animations/Textures Web Demo

Military Character Animations Web Demo

Soldier Variations Web Demo (Marching)

Completed Civilians Web Demo

 

 

UPDATE - COMPLETED VARIATIONS FOR MILITARY PACK

UPDATE - VARIATIONS FOR CIVILIANS

 UPDATE - COMPLETED FIRST CIVILIAN CHARACTER MODEL


 UPDATE - COMPLETED 2ND CIVILIAN CHARACTER MODEL

UPDATE - COMPLETED 3RD CIVILIAN CHARACTER MODEL

 

A sample of all (5) texture variations applied to the Zombie character 

The other character sets will also consist of (5) texture variations each. This is the bulk of the work for this campaign. Producing (4) more texture variations of the military personnel character and producting (5) civilian texture varations as well as a brand new base model for the civilians (male and female).

BONUS - Low Poly Weapon Pack (Comes bundled with the Military Personnel Pack)

These assets are specifically designed for iOS or Android development purposes. The handgun is 328 quad polygons, the combat knife is 128 quad polygons, the assault rifle is 1,394 quad polygons and the shotgun is 537 polygons. These assets will help you develop your mobile FPS, zombie shooter or any kind of military style game. They use 512x512 PSD textures which are also optimized for mobile purposes.

 

WEAPON DEMO - YOUTUBE VIDEO

UPDATED BONUS - Low Poly Melee Weapons (Comes bundled with every character Pack)

These assets are specifically designed for iOS or Android development purposes. The Axe is 100 quad polygons, the baseball bat is 120 quad polygons, the machete is 130 quad polygons, the katana sword is 65 quad polygons and the pipe wrench is 500 polygons. These assets will help you develop your mobile FPS, zombie shooter or any kind of military style game. They use 512x512 PSD textures which are also optimized for mobile purposes.

 

Some visual ideas for the Civilian Pack.

These visuals are only for clothing texture ideas and are not my own final concepts or 3d models. These are images from the work of artist tom_drin. I only include them to give a general idea of the type of look the civilians may have. The animations for the civilians will include the standard, walk, run, jump, death, being struck/hit, hiding/taking cover and two types of panic animations.

 

I think this campaign can open up a world of funding the creation of high quality assets and delivering those to people at a very low cost. This is possible due to the nature of crowdfunding. The more folks participating, the more it helps everyone!

If you can't contribute financially, please find the social sharing tools at the top of the page and share this campaign. Feel free to share this on your social networks or even better amongst the fellow game development communities.

story:
Overview

We at TECHeGO are excited to call ourselves Podio Preferred Partners. We are 1 of 3 Technical Integration Partners in the United States and 1 of 10 worldwide. We love helping Podio customers throughout the world achieve smoother workflows while experiencing less time suck.

As a Podio Partner we have recieved many requests from customers asking for an extension that allows them to create their own Printing templates within Podio. Currently one can only print the data found within an app, however, its formatting cannot be altered in any way.

The purpose of this Browser Extension will grant Podio Users the ability to easily print an App Items content into a custom template of your own creation.

Extension Features

  1. Works on both Chrome & Firefox Browsers (2 Seperate Browser Plugins)
  2. User selects their desired Workspace and the App containing the items they would like printed.
  3. User proceeds to the browser plugin and upon clicking a drop down menu appears where you are presented with an Account Login Field.
    1. The users enters their Podio Username & Password.
    2. The user authorizes the Extension to access their account, workspaces and the app contents.
  4. Once Authenticated, the menu changes from "Account Login" to "Create New Template". Clicking this opens a modal window where a new printing template can be created using Drag and Drop Functionality.
    1. Customer names the custom printing template.
    2. The available fields found to the right of the window will be taken from the items found within the App including app referenced fields. F.ex. App A is a training manual that contains a Title and a company Logo. App B contains a table of contents. App C contains the sections and content of the training manual. Both Apps B & C reference App A and as a result the printing template creator will pull in all data contained in App A, B & C for build out of the printing template.
    3. Using the drag & drop functionality, the user can build the printing template they wish using the available fields from the App and any app references.
    4. The template is then saved.
  5. The user can now manually print the template created for these app items.
    1. Selecting the print button provides a print preview of the app contents before printing has been completed.
    2. Upon printing the template is turned into a PDF and attached to that Apps Item. The user can then do what they wish with the PDF.
  6. Invoice Creation Scheduling Options
    1. Upon Selection a slide-out window appears to the left where the template can be scheduled to auto-generate and attach itself to the App Item instance.
    2. Invoice Schedule is saved and is then entered into the user’s global Podio calendar.

Why Indiegogo?

Custom development can be an expensive proposition for a company to outlay all on their own. With Podio's massive growth and loyal customer base we wanted to create a campaign that provides users with the opportunity to vote with their wallets. Each donation lets us know the amount of demand that is out there for specific extension and also helps us to guage its final selling price. 

Any funds raised above this campains goal will roll into and fund future Podio Development Projects. Slated Development Projects include...

  1. FedEx & DHL Shipping Integration
  2. Tableau Analytics Server Integration
  3. Wordpress & Joomla Integration for Publishing Podio Content
  4. Quickbooks Integration
  5. An Much, Much More!

What Is Podio?

Podio is a website and mobile app that helps people work together by removing the two main pains of collaboration – namely too many emails and keeping documents all over the place. It has private group activity streams that act a bit like Facebook, but, in this case, those streams are for sharing messages and files and making decisions with your colleagues – without messy email threads. Podio also has it’s own kind of apps for managing project work, sales leads, recruiting or any other type of work. This is the kind of stuff that would usually be handled in documents and spreadsheets that are hard to keep track of or have discussions about without starting more email threads. You can even build your own apps on Podio with no technical work at all, so you can really work the way you want to. You get all your tasks, discussions, files and content in one simple place that makes working together a lot easier and more efficient.

On Podio, teams with 5 or less users are FREE!

Begin Your Podio Trial Today!

story:
About Traveller Hephaestus

Traveller Hephaestus is an adventure compatible with Mongoose Traveller. The German version spreads across 24 pages and contains 20 images.

The color-hardcover can be removed and uses as referee screen. The inside of the cover contains all deckplans making it even simpler for the referee.

Interior art is black/white.

So what is the story about?

A gigantic star ship has stranded nearby a gas giant of a populated system, sending out an automated distress signal. The type of vessel is unknown, so is the language used in the distress signal. However, the ship appears to be very advanced, maybe even beyond Imperial maximum.

All communications with the ship have failed so far and suddenly a race for the apparently abbandoned ship begins. Imperials, Pirates and Travellers make strange bedfellows. Who will be the first to claim its treasures..and survive?

This adventure can be set anywhere in known space but densly populated systems on the frontier work the best.

 

What critics say about Traveller Hephaestus

"Great stuff! The story works well and it is fun to walk around the ship and discover it's mysteries." 4.2 out of 5 stars! (translated from German on DnD Gate)

 

About 13Mann

13Mann Verlag is the publisher holding the German license to Mongoose Traveller.

Besides translation of Mongoose material we also produced our own Traveller material which so far has been only accessible to our German audience. Now we want to bring it to the international audience as well.

You may have already experienced the quality and fine detail work we put in

  • 13Mann's ROBOTS
  • Traveller Spinward Marches - Excellent Maps for Explorers and Merchants

Traveller Hephaestus will be our third international product.

 

Why do we need the money?

We need to translate the German text into English and have it checked by a copyeditor. Afterwards we will have it layouted and a PDF created. This is the minimum version we aim for.

If we are able to reach our stretch goal for printing, we bring you the printed version as well (hardcover, around 24 pages, b/w artwork).

 

When will you be getting your perks?

If we reach funding by September, we intend to bring you the watermarked PDF before Christmas and the printed version (funding provided) in Q1 2014.

 

Stretch Goals


Stretch Goal 0 EUR 1200: Everyone of Marine level and above will receive a Battlemap of the Elevators as PDF and CC3 drawing.

Stretch Goal 0a EUR 1600: Everyone of Marine level and above will receive a Battlemap of the Airlock as PDF and CC3 drawing.

Stretch Goal 0b EUR 2000: Everyone of Marine level and above will receive a Battlemap of the Astrometric Lab as PDF and CC3 drawing.

Stretch Goal 0c EUR 2400: Everyone of Marine level and above will receive a Battlemap of the Genetics Lab as PDF and CC3 drawing.

Stretch Goal 0d EUR 2800: Everyone of Marine level and above will receive a Battlemap of the Botany Lab as PDF and CC3 drawing.

Stretch Goal 0e EUR 3200: Everyone of Marine level and above will receive a Battlemap of the State Rooms as PDF and CC3 drawing.

Stretch Goal 0f EUR 3600: Everyone of Marine level and above will receive a Battlemap of the Quantum Mechanics Lab as PDF and CC3 drawing.

Stretch Goal 1 EUR 4000: We will print the adventure, and everyone at Marine level and above will be getting a printed version as well.

Stretch Goal 1a EUR 5000: Everyone of Marine level and above will receive a Battlemap of the ExoGenetics Lab as PDF and CC3 drawing.

Stretch Goal 1b EUR 6000: Everyone of Marine level and above will receive a Battlemap of the Artificial Intelligence Segment as PDF and CC3 drawing.

Stretch Goal 2 EUR 8000: More decks and a 4-sided cover.

story:
A Mob of Mutate Ratkins and goblins, that's what we are offering. Twisted, Mean and Disgusting players for your funny games

The Green Ratz Fantasy Football team can be used as Underworld team or complement for your Chaos Pact, Skaven or Goblin teams

Funders will get an exclusive resin marker with their teams.




Next stretch Goal> Prone/Stunned markers for RatTroll at 19500

Add ons

(You can choose them, if you have got another perk)



Green Ratz already sculpted

Da Beast, The RaTroll

Long Tail Thrower ratskin


Big Hand Goblin

The Goatblin


Linegob1

Disturbing presence Goblin


Two head goblin


Concepts

Ratkins(Blitzers,Tail-Thrower,ExtraArm Thrower, Linerat and Disturbing Linerat)


Goblins(Big hand, Disturbing, TwoHeads, Linegoblin. Horns, ExtraArm)

RatTroll

Who are we?

We are the Goblinguild, a miniature club. We are making miniatures for more than a year. You can check our works in our Facebook page
Our last releases have been mutated goblins miniatures for Underworld/Chaos pact teams and a guildpartner suggested to speed up the releases through crowdfunding. So we bring you our concept for a team mixing mutated goblins and ratkins and if you help to fund it, we will cast it for you. We count with Pedro Ramos to sculpt this team because he is the best sculptor in Fantasy Football scene. 

Risk and challenges. 

We have only one miniature sculpted of the team and we want to make a full team. this takes time. As soon as campaign is funded, Poncho will start sculpting but we dont know how long he will take to complete the team. WE WONT RUSH HIM. We want the best miniatures possible so he will take as long as he needs. He is a professional sculptor and can work with other projects meanwhile. Take in mind delaying is a possibility but you will have a great team.   

 

If You like our Idea, please Share with your friends.
If you dont like anything about campaign, comment.

 

Estimate Shipping Date Autumn 2016 


Frequent Questions

Why is estimate shipping date is so long if FF companies ship faster?
This project isn't a preorder. We have to make all production process after campaign funds. We estimate that we will need that time to be sure we can make a quality team. We will try to shorten this time without dismishing the Team  quality.

Can I purchase a single model?
Not during the campaign, After we sent all pledges we will have them available.

How do the team will be cast?
Regular players will be cast on white metal. We are thinking in casting the Big RatTroll in Resin, so it can be lighter, So if you like Resin Bigguys please comment it ;)

And that's all, Folks.

We estimate that we will need that time to be sure we can make a quality team. We will try to shorten this time without dismishing the Team  quality. Can I purchase a single model?Not during the campaign, After we sent all pledges we will have them available.How do the team will be cast?Regular players will be cast on white metal. We are thinking in casting the Big RatTroll in Resin, so it can be lighter, So if you like Resin Bigguys please comment it ;)And that's all, Folks.

story:
I have been playing Heroes of Newerth since closed beta, and have been addicted ever since. Ever since I started playing, I've longed to improve. Recently, there has been no motivation to get better as the game is lacking of a competitive aspect. Well, this is a way for that to change. This tournament has been an idea of mine for a while, and I'm now working to bring it to fruition. The hope is to create a platform for people to form teams, or join up with preexisting ones to have a fun, challenging, and rewarding tournament for Heroes of Newerth, a game long lacking a competitive scene. This tournament will serve as something to look forward to, train for, enjoy,  inspire future events to take place, along with allow people with strong love for the game in a competitive format (like myself) to support it directly. The tournament will be hosted on a platform known as Toornament, and will most likely be held in Double Elimination Bracket Group fashion, or plain old Double Elimination. 

We need both spectators and players who are willing to donate, to do so. Myself, along with my friends, are going to make generous contributions to the cause of having proper motivation to create a tournament worth watching. Spectators/those who donate will have recognition for supporting the game they love, along with the ability to watch the game at a level that hasn't been seen for far to long. Players will have the chance to provide this entertainment, along with donating to back the cause if they so choose. Casters, such as BreakyCPK and Matthewmatical, have been kind enough to offer to help out and bring the highest level of entertainment possible. The money will go directly to the prizepool, and if FrostBurn decides to get involved, perhaps there will be an in-game reward for those who have been verified as donators. EDIT: Frostburn indeed decided to get involved, and allowed us some perks to give our donators! 

 

This tournament will be moderated by trusted community members. Your money will go directly to allowing this tournament to take place. There will be an active list keeping track of those who donated, along with the size of the prizepool. 

 

If there are any concerns about monetary safety, please know I have no desire to steal, or disrespect your generosity. I only want to see this game that I am  addicted to and love playing, played in the format it deserves to be played in--- COMPETITIVE. All of my information is tied to this campaign, where I will be held accountable for the funds (with all of my personal information at stake), along with Matthewmatical who was kind enough to accept responsibility as fund manager. Any questions you have may be directed to us.
