story:
From Doodles to Game Idea

One day at work, I was drawing on the back of my business cards out of boredom. Hey, it was my lunch break! The doodles began to evolve into a character I called Chompy. He's got big teeth and a big appetite. I showed the drawings to a few friends and they suggested I make a game out of it. I began writing together the basic rules of what I thought would be a unique and entertaining game. Here's the story.
 

Backstory

A fat, greedy monarch named King Chomp is in charge and has been for a while. He's got the biggest appetite and eats over a ton of food every day. Everyone thinks he can use a diet. One day, the King's counselor delivers a report that even more crops have been destroyed due to the disease. The King believes this is the work of an enemy force in order to weaken his defenses for a takeover. The King decides to slowly hoard food for himself and his inner circle of influence leaving the residents exiled, starving, and many resorting to cannibalism to survive. You are Chompy and your mission is to prevent a war, eradicate the disease, and save your species from extinction. No pressure!
 

How to Play


Your character will move forward automatically one block at a time, but you must swipe to change direction. Your health indicator in the top right is decreasing the entire time you are playing and once depleted, you instantly starve to death. To delay starvation, you can eat fruit for a small bump in health. You can eat other bots to fully restore your health, but that can only be done in attack mode. Enter/exit attack mode by double tapping the screen and this will double your movement speed. In attack mode, your health is going down twice as fast!
You die when you run out of health, get eaten by another chomp, or when you fall off the map. Be careful out there! Collect coins during gameplay so that you can respawn. You can play the prototype for iOS here and for Android here.
 

Funds Will be Used for:
 

  • Developing online multiplayer
  • Allow players to spend their coins on simple player customization and to unlock other characters [popular request from early testing]
  • Powerups including but limited to
    • True Sight: See which Chomps you are guaranteed to eat no matter how much health they have for 60 seconds. Must eat three Chomps in a row to activate this powerup. [high priority: extremely popular request from early testing]
    • Rampage: Stay in attack mode and lose no health for 60 seconds. Must eat six chomps in a row to activate this powerup. [low priority]
    • Radioactive: Glow green and instantly kill all Chomps that you touch for the next 15 seconds. Must eat 10 chomps in a row to activate this powerup. [low priority]

We've assembled a great lineup of perks for contributors including designing custom powerups, traps, maps, characters and more. 

 

STRETCH GOAL 1: $20,000

Good Samaritans are still welcomed to continue their contributions to the game. Every $45 gets an extra hour of development time. More time means more improvements, features, and more. If the campaign reaches $20,000 in funding, we will work on developing leaderboards, screenshot sharing, and other social features for the game.

 

Development Team

 

Chomp of War's prototype has been developed by the awesome folks at the Knights of Unity and we plan to continue working with them to develop the next few versions of the game. Their team is more than qualified to complete the technical goals of this campaign.

story:
Chose your own plot of land as the play area, be it in a park, a field, a pitch or even your own garden.

Based on what was previously my final year project in college, I have been developing this game in my spare time during evengings and weekends. I already have the experience and knowledge to complete this game, but I still need funding to fill in the gaps and hire graphical designers, musical composers, fund advertising campaigns and persue my dream in my very own career in game development.

To do this, I humbly ask for your help to do so.

 

My current funding goal for this project is $8000. This will cover my personal expenses for aproximatly 4-6 months and allow me to work on this game full time and see that I can pay for the help needed above which are outside of my expertise, as well as commit weekly updates and videos, and produce aplayable beta for those who decide to contribute. I am also taking into account the percentage that 8bitfinding take aswell.

If the funding exceeds the goal, I will pay forward my monthly expenses so that I may continue to support ongoing work on this project and add extra features post-development.

Further funding will be used to secure music licenses and add to existing ones due to the fact the they limit the number of copies that I will be allowed to sell.

If I am so fortunate that funds exceed this amount, I will also let them flow over into my next game project.

story:
Gaia Campaigns is a green initiative. It features an engaging mobile game with theme revolving around Climate Change. Its tagline is “One Common Voice for Global Health”. We are trying to rally the help of our supporters to build this game to raise public awareness on Global Warming.

To make sure that its reach is far and wide, the completed game will be FREE for all to play!

We guarantee that we can do a good job in its development. Well, we have been doing software development of all forms for a decade now; give us that credit, will you? We want you to be part of this voice. We also want your friends and family to be part of this voice. In Gaia Campaigns, we will be integrating social media and will harness the viral nature of social media to invite friends and families to play this fun and enriching game. Besides, this is for a good cause. Why not?


Game Concept & In-App Campaigns

In brief, the concept of the game uses the addictive nature of a simple puzzle game, coupled with social media and stunning graphics/music/sound effects to engage players in a competitive(ladder) social game environment. Besides addictive puzzle game play, the concept of the game is centered around in-app campaigns which players can take part to support a global environmental cause.


Key Features List

Gaia Campaigns has these key features:

  • Addictive puzzle game play (numerous stages with increasing difficulty and complexity
  • Eco Social ladder – See your friends rank up the game ladder, invite/share with facebook friends to unlock next game phase or get rewards
  • Campaigns – Enroll in a regional / global in-game campaign to support a cause. (For E.g. Save the sharks campaign to garner support of 1000 gamers’ support – each player to contribute about 1000 game points to a grand total of 1 million campaign support points). Possible tie up with merchants / brands for sponsorship.


Game Play Description

How To Play?

  • Player is presented with a puzzle for each stage
  • Puzzle board is a 8 x 7 puzzle grid filled with “blocks” represented by “environmental-related” icons
  • The objective of the puzzle game is to achieve a target score set for each puzzle stage, sometimes within a time frame.
  • Player can score points by:
    - Aligning 3 similar blocks in a row (vertical or diagonal)
    - Align 4 blocks
    - Align 5 blocks
    - Form special patterns like a “diamond-of-4”, “benzene” ring or “asterix” formation for more points
  • When a puzzle is completed, player moves up an ECO Ladder, showing where their Facebook friends are on the ECO Ladder.
  • Environmental Campaigns are announced using push notification. Player can switch to the Campaigns’ Global Map to see an Eco Campaign available in their country and participate.


Why join our cause?

  • Average Temperatures Rise Around The World And Accelerated Rate of Warming Observed
  • Arctic Ice Disappearing and Glaciers Rapidly Melting
  • Extreme Weather Events And More Occurrences of Strong Hurricanes, Droughts and Other Disasters
  • Expected Rise In Sea Level And Some Hundred Million People Could be Affected
  • Expected Shortage Of Fresh Water In Some Regions / Food Shortages in many places.
  • Projected Extinction For More Than A Million Species
  • Ocean’s Circulation System Could Be Permanently Altered


Earth Under Water - National Geographic


Climate Change - Green College Online



Project Schedule (Estimate)

5 Weeks: Resource gathering and story board development.

10 Weeks: Development (artwork, sound production and coding)

7 Weeks: Debugging and game play tuning.

3 Weeks: Deployment to Game Platform.


Project Cost (Estimate)


Join In Our Cause by Donating And Help Us to Share With Your Friends

Gaia Campaigns was designed to be “Viral” in nature in its outreach to people. This will help us to spread this message to more people and a fun and engaging game definitely helps the message to stay in the minds of people more frequently and longer. The game development life cycle involves the various stages of conceptualization, design, planning, implementation, testing and deployment.

After releasing the game, we will require a marketing fund to spread word about the game and development servers to store your precious game data. Your donation, no matter in small amount or big, will definitely go a long way in helping us in our game development and see Gaia Campaigns’ messages proliferate.


Support Our Cause Now to enjoy limited edition GIFTs!

In return for you and your friends/families’ support, we have limited edition perks to give out to our supporters. Here is a list of the perks:

$3 Contribution - Exclusive digital wallpaper pack.

$8 Contribution - 2 Exclusive Gaia Campaigns Eco-Friendly Shopping Bags for your shopping trips. Reduce the usage of plastic and paper bags now.

$16 Contribution - Exclusive Gaia Campaigns 4GB USB Storage Card. This Eco-Friendly card is made from recycled paper.

$30 Contribution - Exclusive Gaia Campaigns 8GB USB Storage Card. This Eco-Friendly card is made from recycled paper.

$45 Contribution - Exclusive Gaia Campaigns Animal-Shaped USB block with 16GB Storage.

$100 Contribution - Exclusive Gaia Campaigns Hybrid LED Lamp powered by both solar or dynamo for your emergency household lighting or outdoor camping trip.

$180 Contribution - mPowerpad Solar Charger capable of charging your mobile phone / devices using solar power.

$210 Contribution - Tickets to Gardens by the Bay (Singapore)

$600 Contribution - Tickets to Noah's Ark (Hong Kong)

$2,500 Contribution - Elm Wildlife Tour (New Zealand)

$5,300 Contribution - Coral Sea Dreaming Sailing Trip - Great Barrier Reef (Australia)

$6800 Contribution - G Lodge Amazon (Brazil)

$60,100 Contribution - Arctic Highlights & Polar Bears (Greenland)

$130,100 Contribution - The Ultimate Arctic Adventure - 50 Years of Victory (Arctic)

*Note: Air Fare is not included in our perks.
story_txt:
Gaia Campaigns is a green initiative. It features an engaging mobile game
with theme revolving around Climate Change. Its tagline is “One Common Voice
for Global Health”. We are trying to rally the help of our supporters to build this game to raise public awareness on Global
Warming.To make sure that its reach is far and wide, the completed game will be FREE for all to play!
We guarantee that we can do a good job in its development. Well, we have
been doing software development of all forms for a decade now; give us that
credit, will you? We want you to be part of this voice. We also want your
friends and family to be part of this voice. In Gaia Campaigns, we will be
integrating social media and will harness the viral nature of social media to
invite friends and families to play this fun and enriching game. Besides, this is
for a good cause. Why not?Game Concept & In-App Campaigns

In brief, the concept of the game uses
the addictive nature of a simple puzzle game, coupled with social media and
stunning graphics/music/sound effects to engage players in a competitive(ladder)
social game environment. Besides addictive puzzle game play, the concept of the
game is centered around in-app campaigns which players can take part
to support a global environmental cause.
Key Features List
Gaia Campaigns has these key features:

Addictive puzzle game play
     (numerous stages with increasing difficulty and complexity
Eco Social ladder – See your
     friends rank up the game ladder, invite/share with facebook friends to
     unlock next game phase or get rewards
Campaigns – Enroll in a regional / global in-game campaign to support a
cause. (For E.g. Save the sharks campaign to garner support of 1000 gamers’
support – each player to contribute about 1000 game points to a grand total of
1 million campaign support points). Possible tie up with merchants / brands for
sponsorship.



Game Play Description
How To Play?

Player is presented with a
     puzzle for each stage
Puzzle board is a 8 x 7 puzzle
     grid filled with “blocks” represented by “environmental-related” icons
The objective of the puzzle
     game is to achieve a target score set for each puzzle stage, sometimes
     within a time frame.
Player can score points by:
     - Aligning 3 similar blocks in a row (vertical or diagonal)
     - Align 4 blocks
     - Align 5 blocks
     - Form special patterns like a “diamond-of-4”, “benzene” ring or “asterix”
     formation for more points
When a puzzle is completed,
     player moves up an ECO Ladder, showing where their Facebook friends are on the ECO Ladder.
Environmental Campaigns are
     announced using push notification. Player can switch to the Campaigns’
     Global Map to see an Eco Campaign available in their country and
     participate.


Why join our cause?

Average Temperatures Rise Around The
     World And Accelerated Rate of Warming Observed
Arctic Ice Disappearing and Glaciers
     Rapidly Melting
Extreme Weather Events And More
     Occurrences of Strong Hurricanes, Droughts and Other Disasters
Expected Rise In Sea Level And Some
     Hundred Million People Could be Affected
Expected Shortage Of Fresh Water In Some
     Regions / Food Shortages in many places.
Projected Extinction For More Than A
     Million Species
Ocean’s Circulation System Could Be
Permanently Altered

Earth Under Water - National Geographic
Clim
Climate Change - Green College OnlineProject Schedule (Estimate)

5 Weeks: Resource gathering and story board development.
10 Weeks: Development (artwork, sound production and coding)
7 Weeks: Debugging and game play tuning.
3 Weeks: Deployment to Game Platform.
Project Cost (Estimate)

Join In Our
Cause by Donating And Help Us to Share With Your Friends
Gaia Campaigns was designed to be
“Viral” in nature in its outreach to people. This will help us to spread this
message to more people and a fun and engaging game definitely helps the message
to stay in the minds of people more frequently and longer. The game development
life cycle involves the various stages of conceptualization, design, planning,
implementation, testing and deployment.After releasing the game, we will
require a marketing fund to spread word about the game and development servers
to store your precious game data. Your donation, no matter in small amount or
big, will definitely go a long way in helping us in our game development and
see Gaia Campaigns’ messages proliferate.
Support Our Cause Now to enjoy limited edition GIFTs!
In return for you and your
friends/families’ support, we have limited edition perks to
give out to our supporters. Here is a list of the perks:$3 Contribution - Exclusive digital wallpaper pack.$8 Contribution - 2 Exclusive Gaia Campaigns Eco-Friendly Shopping Bags for your shopping trips. Reduce the usage of plastic and paper bags now.$16 Contribution - Exclusive Gaia Campaigns 4GB USB Storage Card. This Eco-Friendly card is made from recycled paper.$30 Contribution - Exclusive Gaia Campaigns 8GB USB Storage Card.  This Eco-Friendly card is made from recycled paper.$45 Contribution - Exclusive Gaia Campaigns Animal-Shaped USB block with 16GB Storage.$100 Contribution - Exclusive Gaia Campaigns Hybrid LED Lamp powered by both solar or dynamo for your emergency household lighting or outdoor camping trip.$180 Contribution - mPowerpad Solar Charger capable of charging your mobile phone / devices using solar power.$210 Contribution - Tickets to Gardens by the Bay (Singapore)$600 Contribution - Tickets to Noah's Ark (Hong Kong)$2,500 Contribution - Elm Wildlife Tour (New Zealand)$5,300 Contribution - Coral Sea Dreaming Sailing Trip - Great Barrier Reef (Australia)$6800 Contribution - G Lodge Amazon (Brazil)$60,100 Contribution - Arctic Highlights & Polar Bears (Greenland)$130,100 Contribution - The Ultimate Arctic Adventure - 50 Years of Victory (Arctic)*Note: Air Fare is not included in our perks.

story: The American Rescue Workers in Canton, Ohio is in desperate need of updating its major appliances for the homeless shelter that it operates. These need to be commercial grade, energy efficient appliances to comply with all the governmental regulations.Please consider supporting this effort for us.

story:
HELLO!

 Let me tell you a little about myself, and this project. I'm Dave Vogt; I run operations at Gaming World Wide; a gaming group and website that focuses on charity, information, and entertainment. Beyond that, I hold several gaming world records, and have dabbled in independent game design for years. So, I'm bringing it all together. This title, The Bounty, is a unique, retro styled, high score based RPG. A roguelike with a classic arcade edge. It's meant to challenge the player, and inspire them to push their limits further. You start your game, and delve into the dungeon; everything you do rewards you with points. But there are no shops, no inns, no safehouses. Once you die, you die. You're awarded your score, and return to the title screen. Next time you might do better. Of course, you might end up in different levels this time.  Above all that? The game is being released for free. Featuring custom sprite work by Mike "NESQuester" Wright, we have the highest expectations of this game to bring you back to the old days, in a new way.

   This is the second leg of the funding campaign. (the initial page can be found here) While we fell far short of our goals, the funds acquired allowed us to purchase some of the equipment and software needed. We have made great progress; despite funding and technical hiccups, approximately 25%  of the primary game is finished. The amount of work still to be done is staggering, but it is transforming into an incredible game that will stand tall next to the best RPGs of the 16 bit generation, while maintaining it's own unique personality. This is only possible with YOUR help.

     Care to try it now? I've assembled a pre-alpha demo. This is proof of concept only; just enough to get the object of the game across, using all stock middleware RTP assets. YOU CAN FIND AND DOWNLOAD THE DEMO HERE.

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

So, how much are we looking for? The lower end is $2500. This will cover a bare minimum of development costs such as hardware, software, and staff. Going up to a more desirable $5000 and beyond will get us custom chiptune music, more artwork, and more specialized hardware. Basically, a more awesome final product, and a framework to deliver new level packs and sequels in the future. 

  The perks really involve you in the development. Your contributions will have you designing levels in the dungeons, helping create items, and even becoming a playable character! I'll personally work with you to ensure maximum balancing and playability, so it's a fun and easy way to make a real creative contribution; a personal touch beyond a standard financial funding-for a perk. If you prefer promotional items, those are options as well, of course; including custom t-shirts and posters.

  A little something else to say thank you to our backers; included in every perk is not only a timed early release of The Bounty, but also an exclusive level pack. This collection of fun special levels will be only released to indiegogo backers; though you can share if you want to. ;)

    We're aiming for an updated release date of February 1st, 2014. This could be delayed; whether there is a huge influx of fan created content, technical issues, or if additional debugging/QA testing is required. February 1st is the goal however, and video diaries will be recorded frequently, keeping you up to date on the progress.

     What if we don't reach our goal? A basic version of the game will be built. The art/music assets will be weaker, QA/bug testing will be limited; but there will be a well playing, quality game to be found!

THE IMPACT

As AAA games get bigger and bigger, players are turning to independent games for those classic experiences the big studios don't bother with anymore. The Bounty is the real deal, with every detail painstakingly built and fine tuned by a world class competitor. To be able to present this experience to the world, free of charge... is beyond explanation. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can't contribute financially, there's still plenty you can do to help make this a reality! Beyond indiegogo's sharing tools, you can hype up this project, pass it around to the people you know. Get creative! Feel free to contact me directly on this page, or via email at da3vevogt@gwwentertainment.com Anything you can do is most appreciated.

story:
WHO ARE WE?

Military gaming 501(c)(3) Operation Supply Drop is designed to build video game care packages (called "supply drops") and send them to soldiers deployed to combat zones and recovering in military hospitals. 

WHAT ARE WE DOING? 

Operation Supply Drop just launched their annual fundraising drive, the "8-Bit Salute to Veterans", trying to raise as much money and physical donations for the troops as possible to clean out the number of wish lists the charity gets in from men and women of the Armed Forces overseas. Last year, we raised $58,000 in games and gear and definitely made a whole bunch of soldiers feel a lot better about being deployed during the Holiday season! This year, we're hoping to break our current "high score"!

http://www.operationsupplydrop.org/2013/09/28/the-second-annual-8-bit-salute-to-veterans-helping-troops-on-veterans-day/

THE INDIEGOGO MISSION!

This year, we are going to be attending Holiday parties at the recovery wards of both Walter Reed National Military Hospital and Fort Belvoir Community Hospital, where injured soldiers are arriving every day from the fighting still going on in Afghanistan. We plan on making sure that they know that America takes care of its heroes by outfitting their day rooms with fully equipped Xbox One and Playstation 4 consoles with 20 launch titles.  

A large portion of the donations Operation Supply Drop gets every year are physical donations from gaming developers and publishers, but there is no way that Microsoft or Sony are going to just donate next generation consoles this close to their launch. So we're here on IndieGogo specifically to manually raise the funds to get the cutting edge gear these guys want, and with your help, we can make the time these men and women are hospitalized a little less painful.

If you have any questions about how you can get involved with Operation Supply Drop, feel free to reach out to admin@operationsupplydrop.org and we'll get you the answers you're looking for!

story:
About Me

Who exactly am I, and what is this campaign all about :

  • My name is Alexander Patten, and I am the Founder/President of the Nicole Marie Organization. Nicole Marie, LLC. is a non-profit organization that hosts adult basketball tournaments across the country for any good cause.
  • This particular campaign is one for the ICan Shine Organization. This is a non-profit organization that provides quality learning opportunities in recreational activities for individuals with disabilities.  
  • The money that is raised through this campaign will help pay for some of the bikes that ICan Shine uses, and 3 students athletes from Fairborn High School will receive a scholarship that will allow them to pay for one sport of their choice.

What We Need & Where is it going?

The most important thing for a campaign like this is to let you know how much we need to raise, and where exactly your money is going.

  • .This campaign for the ICan Shine Organization and Fairborn City Schools needs to raise $3,000 by Wednnesday, April 30th.
  • All the money will go to ICan Shine, the Fairborn student athletes, and it will also pay for the operational fees.
  • Some kids can't afford to play sports, some kids can't afford to not have someone by their side helping them, and some simply can't afford both. This campaign will help with both.
  • If this campaign does not raise $3,000 by April 30th, there will be a 9% loss on the total amount of money that was actually raised. 

ICan Shine, Inc.

iCan Shine (formerly, Lose The Training Wheels) is a national charitable nonprofit organization.  We collaborate with local organizations and individuals, we refer to as our program ‘hosts’, to conduct almost 100 iCan Bike programs in 32 States and 3 Provinces in Canada serving nearly 3,000 people with disabilities each year.  The impact of learning to ride a bicycle independently, and our high level of success in helping people with disabilities accomplish this feat, continues to drive demand for our programs and fuel our growth.

Approximately 80% of the people who participate in our iCan Bike program ride a two-wheel bicycle independently by the end of our five-day program while attending for only 75 minutes each day!  The remaining 20% make tremendous progress towards this goal and leave our programs accompanied by parents and/or siblings trained as ‘spotters’ to pick up where we leave off!

For more information about this amazing organization please visit www.icanshine.org

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that does not mean you can't help:

  • Spread the word about this campaign and the ICan Shine Alumni Games on Saturday, April 19th at Baker Memorial Fieldhouse in Fairborn, Ohio
  • You can be a volunteer for this event. If you are interested to help out this great cause, please contact Alexander Patten at (937) 830-9754. 

ANY KIND DONATION WILL HELP! Please take the time to support this great cause.

story:
Chapters of Fortuna is well on its way to becoming a very charming, humourous, and stimulating story-driven role playing game in the spirit of games for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System with a modern twist of flavour. The RPG genre has always been one of the top styles of video games I've always been very passionate about and I am very excited to be finally making one of my own.

Crowdfunding is the perfect way for aspiring developers to have their game ideas not only heard, but funded by fellow gamers who would love to play those games without a publisher interfering. I'm not a fan of some ominous power looming over the project's development, picking it apart and overshadowing the developer's creation in order to make it as mainstream as possible. Chapters of Fortuna is more than just a video game to me. It's about creating a video game that evokes nostalgia in the hearts of gamers with it's graphics and gameplay, while adding a very fresh and enjoyable story and setting that hasn't been done before. The two things I am going to guarantee everyone right here and now are that all money raised for this project is going to be spent on this project (so that if I exceed the $10,000, any additional money will be entirely spent on designing additional content to the final game) and you will enjoy the final product if you're a fan of SNES era RPGs.

Chapters of Fortuna stars a cast of characters with individual goals and backstories that intertwine with one another, creating a gameplay experience themed around growth and evolution. The story includes making tough moral decisions at key points in the game, leading to multiple endings which will seal the fate of all of humanity. What the player decides to do, fails to accomplish, and how much of Fortuna is explored will effect the entire story and which ending(s) they will see.

Chapters of Fortuna focuses immensely on a sense of scale. The main city that Chapters of Fortuna takes place in is going to be nearly as large as an actual real life city, with gigantic buildings, long streets, and condensed living sectors. The player is going to feel like they are truly living in a metropolis, one that even the main characters themselves haven't entirely seen yet.

Time travel is also an important aspect of the game. Depending on whether you are in the past, present, or future, the graphics of the game would change to reflect that. The past has a more stylized 8-bit appearance to it and the future is more 32-bit, while the present is 16-bit, as shown above.

Chapters of Fortuna will only be available for Windows platforms at this time.

Make sure to visit the Official Facebook Page for the latest updates, polls, and fun ways to interact with the development of Chapters of Fortuna!

story:
It's About Time Someone Made This!

Favourite After Party moment? When someone breaks out Cards Against Humanity! Roller Derby, aside from being the most epic sport on the planet, is also one of the most colourful, weird and wonderful; full of weird and wonderful people. People who also love Cards Against Humanity. People like you.

I can't remember a game with anyone associated with Derby that hasn't included the comment "Roller Derby cards need to be a thing, make it a thing!".  And so, I am.
My name's V from Liverpool Men's Roller Derby. In my other life my name's Simon and together with my dog, I run a small, indy print company.


The Deck

Cards Against Roller Derby will be a full 90 (at the moment) expansion deck consisting of 20 Black Cards and 70 White Cards, all drawn from the wonderful thing that is Derby.  From the simple 'Outside Pack Ref' to the more bizarre 'Bruise that looks like Marilyn Monroe's face' (True story, I saw that bruise). 
Making a full deck of this size isn't especially cheap. I use specialised playing card stock and laminate when I print playing cards, it's one of the most expensive card stocks I ever buy (in fact it's only outpriced by the crazy 600gsm card I use for letterpressing). Cards Against Roller Derby will actually be better quality cards than the official Cards Against Humanity. Go Derby!!
Rather than just producing them and selling them as 'my product' I've opted to use IndieGoGo to crowdfund the project and make it 'our product', something you can be proud (and maybe a little bit ashamed) of helping to create - not only by funding and sharing this project but literally contributing your own ideas too if you choose to.

Help Create the Deck

Want to have some input into the content for Cards Against Roller Derby? There's a few perks that might interest you!

Write a Card

There's two limited availability perks which not only get you your deck but also give you the opportunity to write the content for the card.  Your card will be part of all editions of the deck as well as your name (real or skater) and optionally, your twitter id appearing on the card as a credit to you.  Ya know, so everyone knows who to blame.
You can be as horrible or bizarre as you like, this is Cards Against Humanity after all. However, I won't allow names of individuals or organisations.  You'll be asked to submit up to three ideas just in case your best idea is already in use.  If you're particularly twisted I might even use more than one!!

The League Expansion (aka After Party Special)

Add a custom expansion to the expansion! On top of the regular Cards Against Roller Derby deck, you'll also receive a bonus expansion of up to 30 White Cards which will include your league, intraleague team names and skater names from your league's roster.


Stretch Goals!

£1,000 : Sticker packs and kit patches added to all perk rewards.
£1,500 : Increase deck size to 105 cards.


Timeline

February: the cards' content will be finalised except for those being written by you guys.  Those supporters who've selected to write cards or order The After Party Special will be contacted to get their submissions.
March: IndieGogo release funds and final numbers can be sorted, card stock and laminate ordered direct from the paper mill. 
April: Card stock will arrive (it will probably arrive in March but I'm allowing for any delays here!).  Any contributors who've not completed their submissions by this point will miss out, two months is plenty and I won't hold up a print run. All supporters will also get their early access to the PDF version of the deck at this point.
May: Decks will ship!
story_txt:
It's About Time Someone Made This!
Favourite After Party moment? When someone breaks out Cards Against Humanity! Roller Derby, aside from being the most epic sport on the planet, is also one of the most colourful, weird and wonderful; full of weird and wonderful people. People who also love Cards Against Humanity. People like you.
I can't remember a game with anyone associated with Derby that hasn't included the comment "Roller Derby cards need to be a thing, make it a thing!".  And so, I am.
My name's V from Liverpool Men's Roller Derby. In my other life my name's Simon and together with my dog, I run a small, indy print company.

The Deck
 Cards Against Roller Derby will be a full 90 (at the moment) expansion deck consisting of 20 Black Cards and 70 White Cards, all drawn from the wonderful thing that is Derby.  From the simple 'Outside Pack Ref' to the more bizarre 'Bruise that looks like Marilyn Monroe's face' (True story, I saw that bruise). Making a full deck of this size isn't especially cheap. I use specialised playing card stock and laminate when I print playing cards, it's one of the most expensive card stocks I ever buy (in fact it's only outpriced by the crazy 600gsm card I use for letterpressing). Cards Against Roller Derby will actually be better quality cards than the official Cards Against Humanity. Go Derby!!Rather than just producing them and selling them as 'my product' I've opted to use IndieGoGo to crowdfund the project and make it 'our product', something you can be proud (and maybe a little bit ashamed) of helping to create - not only by funding and sharing this project but literally contributing your own ideas too if you choose to.
Help Create the Deck
Want to have some input into the content for Cards Against Roller Derby? There's a few perks that might interest you!Write a CardThere's two limited availability perks which not only get you your deck but also give you the opportunity to write the content for the card.  Your card will be part of all editions of the deck as well as your name (real or skater) and optionally, your twitter id appearing on the card as a credit to you.  Ya know, so everyone knows who to blame.You can be as horrible or bizarre as you like, this is Cards Against Humanity after all. However, I won't allow names of individuals or organisations.  You'll be asked to submit up to three ideas just in case your best idea is already in use.  If you're particularly twisted I might even use more than one!!The League Expansion (aka After Party Special)Add a custom expansion to the expansion! On top of the regular Cards Against Roller Derby deck, you'll also receive a bonus expansion of up to 30 White Cards which will include your league, intraleague team names and skater names from your league's roster.
Stretch Goals!
£1,000 : Sticker packs and kit patches added to all perk rewards.

£1,500 : Increase deck size to 105 cards.  
Timeline

February: the cards' content will be finalised except for those being written by you guys.  Those supporters who've selected to write cards or order The After Party Special will be contacted to get their submissions.

March: IndieGogo release funds and final numbers can be sorted, card stock and laminate ordered direct from the paper mill. 

April: Card stock will arrive (it will probably arrive in March but I'm allowing for any delays here!).  Any contributors who've not completed their submissions by this point will miss out, two months is plenty and I won't hold up a print run. All supporters will also get their early access to the PDF version of the deck at this point.

May: Decks will ship!

story:
Hello!

Here at Dystopia Rising North, we have been tirelessly and devoutly at work bringing the zombie apocalypse to Toronto. 

Dystopia Rising is a weekend gaming experience, set in the aftermath of the zombie apocalypse. Dystopia Rising North is set to be one of several Dystopia Rising chapters in a networked community of gamers / LARPers. We are all over North America, together amassing a player base already thousands strong, spanning from Toronto to Hawaii.

Likely having both a summer and a winter site, and no possibility for onsite storage, we desperately need our Ops to be mobile. After tax, (Canadian tax is 15%) we are looking at 3500, and once indiegogo takes its 8% fee we would just be able to do this if we get our funding goal.

 What we get above and beyond will be used to supplement the costs/ inevitable deficit of starting a small business, so please,  every penny helps! Every shout out helps!

We can offer some awesome perks and prizes... 

Maybe you would like to become a historical figure in the apocalypse? Perhaps the way you survived the fall of man was unusual or clever? Or perhaps you would like to have mention of something epic your character did (or didn't do). We also have patches to add to costuming or for every day wear, chances to enter contests, mugs and hugs! (Zombie gnaw free! ... this time) All donations come with our undying gratitude for any support and / or promotion of our campaign that we receive.

As gamers we thank you for helping us bring the game we love to our home gaming community, so that we can play it with our friends and spread the love of live action gaming in the zombie apocalypse. 

You can learn more about DR North and see pictures of Dystopia Rising events, and view the rule book on our website www.dystopiarisingnorth.com

story:
Click here to subscribe to our newsletter and to get Antidote free!

 

The problem we have is a lack of interest in STEM subjects - that is, Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics. Without an interest, a lot of people don't know much about what science really is - how it works and why we use it. It's just used as a word that means "lab coats and flasks" when it should really mean "an everyday way to find out about the world around us".

This is a particularly big problem right now with politicians basing their campaigns and policies on the mutterings of sensationalist conspiracy theorists when thousands of scientists say otherwise. The sensationalists are appealing : they offer an easy route, but when the scientists are silently screaming "the world will change soon and your kids will die as a direct result of it", we need people to know who to listen to.

We want to play a huge part in revolutionizing the gaming industry. We believe that Antidote will set new standards for science entertainment games and inspire people toward learning more about science.

Learning isn’t something we need to make fun. We learn instruments, we learn programming, we learn to drive, we learn to play games, we learn to love. And they’re all intuitively fun. Rewarding people for doing boring things isn’t going to work – not now, not ever. We are inspired by other games, like Kerbal Space Program, Infinifactory, and Cities: Skylines – entertainment games packed with learning that is useful in the real world, deep, rewarding learning that helps us to grow and create.

This is what Antidote is all about!

Antidote: Battle of the stem cell is a casual free to play game played under the microscope. Battle of the stem cell is set under the microscope. You get to take control of the body’s defenses and protect the precious stem cell from hordes of bacteria and viruses. 

What makes Antidote special is the fact that it’s inspired by science, which means it’s full of fresh new ideas. Combined with a beautiful and unique art style, handcrafted levels, delightfully interesting characters (both friend and foe!) and Antidote clearly stands out from the crowd.

Built on real science? That's right! Every unit in Antidote is built on real science - inspired by, or directly copying the way your body's immune system works. Not everything is 100% accurate -there's science fiction, and some plain falsifications to make the game work, but you can read more about them in the game. For an example, in Antidote, you can build B cells and T Helper cells that will make your macrophages (big eaters!) more effective when fighting enemies - just like in your body.

Meet some of our amazing characters. Defend against advancing bacteria and viruses with your steadfast friendly units, complete with upgradable forms and specific advantages and disadvantages.

Antidote is set in a cool high-tech lab, with a state of the art microscope that lets you control your body's natural defenses. Bring the exciting characters of the game to bear against hordes of surprisingly cute bacteria and viruses and help us to really save the world. 

We have created a wide range of exciting perks for gamers and non-gamers alike. See the list below and on the right side of the page.

All backers will receive an exclusive invite to become a beta-tester for Antidote and be notified when the finished  game is released (included in all tiers).   

Our team is a group of talented, driven individuals, united by a set of core values. The design, production, and marketing of successful games, takes a diverse team, and we have world-class talent from each field to ensure we deliver what we promise.We at Psyon Games are guided by a strong set of values. We want to share these values one by one with all of you, so that you can understand our decisions and actions better.

If you are interested in featuring our story, you can find everything you need in this LINK, including a media kit, press release, and photos. 

For media inquiries, please contact: hello@psyongames.com

You're probably wondering "How does crowdfunding work for a free to play game?". Well, it's actually fairly simple. Antidote will be free for everyone to download and play, and if you never pay anything you'll have a pretty good time. But it will have a set of fair in-app purchases - a limited number to ensure you can play as much as you want whenever you want (and free a hamster from slavery), a limited number to unlock the amazing possibility of the mutator system, and a final set of unrestricted aesthetic purchases... which directly benefit players around you and help you to make science accessible to other people. And there's the fact that we need some assistance with finishing the game and that's where YOU come in!

LIKE us on Facebook

FOLLOW us on Twitter 

SHARE on Social Media.

REFER YOUR FRIENDS by sharing our campaign link by email or on Social Media by using the Indiegogo share tools or by sharing this short link: www.bit.ly/AntidoteGO 

WRITE A BLOG

GET CREATIVE Do you have another idea, go for it!

The official hashtag for ANTIDOTE is #antidote #makesciencegreatagain

Check out our official site: psyongames.com/antidote

Feel free to include us in your posts, tweets and stories.

When will the game be released?

The game will be ready for launch early 2017 and it will be free for all. We will let you know as soon as it's available. In the meantime, you can enjoy your beta-version!

What platforms is Antidote available on?

Antidote is available for Android and iOS.

When will I receive my perk?

We will deliver the beta version of the game to you right after purchase! For all the other perks. please check the estimated delivery times from the perk descriptions on the right side of the Indiegogo page. If any of the delivery times change we will contact you.

Will there be more perks launched?

Yes, there will so stay tuned ;) Also we want to improve our campaign constantly so please let us know if you feel something is missing from our list or if you have a good idea for a perk. We would love to hear your ideas!

What sizes does the exclusive backers t-shirt come in? 

The t-shirt for men comes in XS, S, M, L, XL, XXL & XXXL. 

The t-shirt for women comes in XS, S, M, L & XL

You can choose your preferred size at the checkout. But note, if you want a men’s XXL or XXXL size or woman's XS, S, M, L or XL size, let us know at hello@psyongames.com because Indiegogo allows us to input only five size options to the perk.

What sizes does the exclusive backers hoodie come in? 

The hoodie for men comes in XS, S, M, L, XL, XXL & XXXL. 

The hoodie for women comes in XS, S, M, L & XL

You can choose your preferred size at the checkout. But note, if you want a men’s XXL or XXXL size, let us know at hello@psyongames.com because Indiegogo allows us to input only five size options to the perk.

For any other question please contact: hello@psyongames.com

story:
Short Summary

Arcology is a first-person survival game, set in a distant future.  The player takes on the role of Roger Bishop, guiding his actions in a desperate attempt to escape from the arcology which has been his home.  Working in concert with your friends, the choices that you make, will determine his survival.  Escape is life.  

Who is the main character?

You are Roger Bishop, a lawyer and bureaucrat in the government of the arcology.  Born to privilege in an upper-middle class family, your life was preordained.  You went to some of the best schools in the building, and your ascent through the bureaucracy was expected.  In your early 30s and engaged to be married, Bishop (as he prefers to be called by his friends) is one of only a handful of individuals thought to be immune to the plague in the building.  To survive, you'll need to lean on the expertise of friends and acquaintances through your personal communicator, using your credential as a bureaucrat to bypass any security systems you might come across.  Nothing in your background ever trained you for this moment, but with your connections throughout the building, you just might survive.

Who are we?

Accordion Games Inc is a small independent game development studio in Omaha, Nebraska.  Prior to working on Arcology, we released several small ad-supported Flash games, and became licensed as a developer for the Nintendo Wii U console.  Arcology is not the only game that is in development at Accordion Games, but it is our current flagship product in development for PC. 

All of the systems design and construction, as well as the relevant level design work will be done by Joshua Yates (me), in-house at Accordion Games.  Prior to Arcology, I wrote all of our Flash games and have experience in Unity 4, Unreal Engine 3 and 4, and with Actionscript 3, C#, and C/C++.  I have a degree in history, and went to graduate school for history, political science, and economics.

For anything beyond what I cannot script myself, I will rely on contractor expertise.  That is already factored into the amount we are asking for, ensuring there is enough money to cover needed contractors (especially for art assets).

This game will be exciting and terrifying, with the survival element crossed with certain horror themes.  There are no zombies, no monsters, and no weapons. You are not a fighter, you are a lawyer, a bureaucrat.  Besides, in a building that is meant to be self-contained and never be exposed to the outside, the last thing you want is a gun.  Survival is up to you, if you can unlock the puzzles to find your way out.  Take too long and  you may not survive.  Go too fast and you might miss something important.  The path and how you get there is entirely in your hands.

Why crowdfund the game?

Accordion Games is a small studio, but we also need to be able to pay people for their hard work on Arcology.  Contractors, like all of us, need to eat too.  To make a professional quality game, we need professional artists, sound designers, and voice actors.  While we go out of our way to try and include students and give them a way to build their portfolios, it's only right that everyone is compensated.  Your support makes that possible.

What Platforms will Arcology be on?

Arcology is slated for release on PC in 2015.  Depending on licensing, a release on the Playstation 4 or Xbox One would be feasible as well.  At this time, however, the game is PC only.


What We Need & What You Get

What We Need 

To make Arcology the best quality game it can be, our budget is $40,000, which is broken down as follows:

Equipment, Dev Kits, Licenses, Fees, Staff: $22,500

Contractors (Artists, Sound Designers, Voice Actors): $17,500

If we don't reach the entire goal, any funds received will go to covering the cost of Dev Kits, Licenses, Fees, and whatever is left will pay for any necessary contractors. 

What You Get 

By contributing to our campaign, you can get any number of different perks, from a thank you in the credits, to a copy of the game, to your likeness on pictures in the game, or even a character named after you.  We want you to make your mark on Arcology, to be a part of the world we are making.


The Impact

Arcology will not be like many first-person games, in that there are no weapons. Your job is not to shoot at a constant onslaught of enemies, battling hordes of zombies, or to save the world.  The entire story is personal.  If you fail, your character dies.  By backing this game, you will be helping us to make a survival/horror game that does not rely on the supernatural, the undead, or on a character who somehow is an expert at every weapon available and can fire a submachine gun perfectly without any practice at all.  

Your character is the most unlikely of heroes in Arcology.  Nothing in his background prepared him for this.  With Arcology, we will break the mold and give you a game which stands apart from others in the genre, with characters and story that are both real enough and complex enough for you to be able to feel for them as they struggle and feel victory with them when they find success. 

 

    Risks & Challenges

    With any crowdfunding campaign, there is always risk.  We all have many stories of campaigns that we contributed to that went into the ether.  We never got our money back and we never saw a finished product either.

    Let me just be plain when I say that is not the case here.  Even if the campaign is not fully funded, Arcology will be made.  Will it be a lesser game as a result? Certainly, but it will launch all the same.  This campaign is in support of the investment that Accordion Games is already making in this game, both in time and money.  If we don't meet the goal, know that we'll be frank and honest about what we will do with the money it has raised so far, how it will be spent, and what timeline we're looking at moving forward to launch.  We'll cross that bridge if and when it occurs.  The budget we posted may appear vague, but that is not intentional.  Some of the costs included (such as dev kits) had to be lumped together with other expenses due to NDA requirements (for example), but know that every dollar that is listed in that budget (aside from the amount for contractors, which is estimated), is exact.  

    On the other side of the coin, what if we exceed the goal?  In that case, we'll look for ways to add extra value to the game without going overboard and expanding the game in ways that were never intended.  What I mean by that is that I would rather we spend the money for additional new art or perhaps a DLC than to expand the game and add in extra features such as multiplayer (for example).  However, if and when we reach that point, we can look at what to do with the money then.  I'd rather we cross that bridge when we get there as well.


      Other Ways You Can Help

      Can't contribute right now, but want to help?  Point your friends, co-workers, family to this page.  You can even use the indiegogo share tools!  Post about it to your facebook page, your twitter feed, or talk about it at work (for example)!

      Already contributed and want to know how you can do more?  Point your friends here and tell them why they should back our campaign!  Together, we will make Arcology the best game possible, creating a game which adds depth and flavor to the survival and horror genres!
story_txt: Short SummaryArcology is a first-person survival game, set in a distant future.  The player takes on the role of Roger Bishop, guiding his actions in a desperate attempt to escape from the arcology which has been his home.  Working in concert with your friends, the choices that you make, will determine his survival.  Escape is life.  Who is the main character?You are Roger Bishop, a lawyer and bureaucrat in the government of the arcology.  Born to privilege in an upper-middle class family, your life was preordained.  You went to some of the best schools in the building, and your ascent through the bureaucracy was expected.  In your early 30s and engaged to be married, Bishop (as he prefers to be called by his friends) is one of only a handful of individuals thought to be immune to the plague in the building.  To survive, you'll need to lean on the expertise of friends and acquaintances through your personal communicator, using your credential as a bureaucrat to bypass any security systems you might come across.  Nothing in your background ever trained you for this moment, but with your connections throughout the building, you just might survive.Who are we? Accordion Games Inc is a small independent game development studio in Omaha, Nebraska.  Prior to working on Arcology, we released several small ad-supported Flash games, and became licensed as a developer for the Nintendo Wii U console.  Arcology is not the only game that is in development at Accordion Games, but it is our current flagship product in development for PC. All of the systems design and construction, as well as the relevant level design work will be done by Joshua Yates (me), in-house at Accordion Games.  Prior to Arcology, I wrote all of our Flash games and have experience in Unity 4, Unreal Engine 3 and 4, and with Actionscript 3, C#, and C/C++.  I have a degree in history, and went to graduate school for history, political science, and economics.For anything beyond what I cannot script myself, I will rely on contractor expertise.  That is already factored into the amount we are asking for, ensuring there is enough money to cover needed contractors (especially for art assets).This game will be exciting and terrifying, with the survival element crossed with certain horror themes.  There are no zombies, no monsters, and no weapons. You are not a fighter, you are a lawyer, a bureaucrat.  Besides, in a building that is meant to be self-contained and never be exposed to the outside, the last thing you want is a gun.  Survival is up to you, if you can unlock the puzzles to find your way out.  Take too long and  you may not survive.  Go too fast and you might miss something important.  The path and how you get there is entirely in your hands.Why crowdfund the game?Accordion Games is a small studio, but we also need to be able to pay people for their hard work on Arcology.  Contractors, like all of us, need to eat too.  To make a professional quality game, we need professional artists, sound designers, and voice actors.  While we go out of our way to try and include students and give them a way to build their portfolios, it's only right that everyone is compensated.  Your support makes that possible.What Platforms will Arcology be on?Arcology is slated for release on PC in 2015.  Depending on licensing, a release on the Playstation 4 or Xbox One would be feasible as well.  At this time, however, the game is PC only.What We Need & What You Get What We Need To make Arcology the best quality game it can be, our budget is $40,000, which is broken down as follows:Equipment, Dev Kits, Licenses, Fees, Staff: $22,500Contractors (Artists, Sound Designers, Voice Actors): $17,500If we don't reach the entire goal, any funds received will go to covering the cost of Dev Kits, Licenses, Fees, and whatever is left will pay for any necessary contractors. What You Get By contributing to our campaign, you can get any number of different perks, from a thank you in the credits, to a copy of the game, to your likeness on pictures in the game, or even a character named after you.  We want you to make your mark on Arcology, to be a part of the world we are making.The Impact Arcology will not be like many first-person games, in that there are no weapons. Your job is not to shoot at a constant onslaught of enemies, battling hordes of zombies, or to save the world.  The entire story is personal.  If you fail, your character dies.  By backing this game, you will be helping us to make a survival/horror game that does not rely on the supernatural, the undead, or on a character who somehow is an expert at every weapon available and can fire a submachine gun perfectly without any practice at all.  Your character is the most unlikely of heroes in Arcology.  Nothing in his background prepared him for this.  With Arcology, we will break the mold and give you a game which stands apart from others in the genre, with characters and story that are both real enough and complex enough for you to be able to feel for them as they struggle and feel victory with them when they find success.    Risks & Challenges With any crowdfunding campaign, there is always risk.  We all have many stories of campaigns that we contributed to that went into the ether.  We never got our money back and we never saw a finished product either.Let me just be plain when I say that is not the case here.  Even if the campaign is not fully funded, Arcology will be made.  Will it be a lesser game as a result? Certainly, but it will launch all the same.  This campaign is in support of the investment that Accordion Games is already making in this game, both in time and money.  If we don't meet the goal, know that we'll be frank and honest about what we will do with the money it has raised so far, how it will be spent, and what timeline we're looking at moving forward to launch.  We'll cross that bridge if and when it occurs.  The budget we posted may appear vague, but that is not intentional.  Some of the costs included (such as dev kits) had to be lumped together with other expenses due to NDA requirements (for example), but know that every dollar that is listed in that budget (aside from the amount for contractors, which is estimated), is exact.  On the other side of the coin, what if we exceed the goal?  In that case, we'll look for ways to add extra value to the game without going overboard and expanding the game in ways that were never intended.  What I mean by that is that I would rather we spend the money for additional new art or perhaps a DLC than to expand the game and add in extra features such as multiplayer (for example).  However, if and when we reach that point, we can look at what to do with the money then.  I'd rather we cross that bridge when we get there as well.  Other Ways You Can Help Can't contribute right now, but want to help?  Point your friends, co-workers, family to this page.  You can even use the indiegogo share tools!  Post about it to your facebook page, your twitter feed, or talk about it at work (for example)!Already contributed and want to know how you can do more?  Point your friends here and tell them why they should back our campaign!  Together, we will make Arcology the best game possible, creating a game which adds depth and flavor to the survival and horror genres!

story:
Help Nikolarn buy a streaming/gaming PC to stream from home!

This is basicaly made for all of my fans/followers to help me achieve my dream of being a full-time gaming streamer.

For all of you guys who are just seeing my name for the first time, before you think of donating check me out some times: www.twitch.tv/Nikolarntv

All of my viewers/fans/followers know that i've been streaming 3-4 days a week with stream sessions lasting over 9 hours sometimes, i started a month ago and i already have almost 5000 followers on my Twitch channel and also over 2000 members in my Steam group, which (as much as i know) has never been done so far on Twitch. I've gotten the support of ScreaM (Professional CS:GO player, playing for Team Titan), Bobonei (A partnered Twitch streamer and my dear friend), we3_gaming (A partnered Twitch streamer), TheOriginalWeed (A partnered Twitch streamer), Wootystyle (A partnered Twitch streamer) which are regularly on my channel when i'm streaming. I've had item donations of a sum up to 2000$.

The main problem for me is that i was streaming from a PC playground (kind of like an internet cafe, you come and pay to play) which is really exhausting because it always has to be at night being that the 'gaming cafe' works full-time during the day.

You know how much i love streaming for you guys so this is where i need your help... I need to raise enough money for a gaming PC so i can finaly start streaming from home and doing this as a full-time thing. I can't accept Paypal donations because of how Paypal works in Serbia (basicaly, it doesn't) so this is the only way of you guys donating and helping me out of achieving my goals right now.


The specification of the PC i've had in mind:

Motherboard: 1150 GIGABYTE GA-Z97-HD3 rev1.0
Processor: INTEL Core i7-4770K 4-Core 3.5GHz (3.9GHz) Box
Memory: KINGSTON DIMM DDR3 16GB (2x8GB kit) 2133MHz KHX21C11T2K2/16X HyperX XMP Predator
SSD: KINGSTON 120GB 2.5" SATA III SH103S3/120G HyperX 3K series
HDD: SEAGATE 1TB 3.5" SATA III 64MB ST1000DM003 Barracuda
Optical device: DRW-24F1ST DVD± RW Black
Graphics Card: ASUS R9270-DC2OC-2GD5
Midi Tower LC POWER Pro-Line 925B 600W-12 USB3.0 Black
Cooler solution: COOLER MASTER Seidon 120V water cooler (RL-S12V-24PK-R1)
Price in my country: $1400

You're probably wondering why i'm hoping to get $1500, the extra $100 will go towards making my internet speed as high as possible so i can deliver a full-hd resolution with maximum quality.

If i reach my goal, i'll be giving out a ★ Karambit | Boreal Forest or ★ Butterfly Knife | Safari Mesh. It will happen when i get started with streaming from home ofcourse with the help of you guys.

story:
Zombie Kill of the Week is a sidescrolling platformer survival game taking place in middle of a zombie apocalypse.

We are estimating the release of the multiplayer version to be 1st September 2013.

UPDATED LIST OF PLATFORMS FOR THE GAME
- iOS
- Android
- Windows Phone
- Windows 8
- PC
- Ubuntu (Linux)
- MAC

Zombie Kill of the Week is a retro style 16-bit zombie shooter. In the game you try to survive rounds of zombies, opening doors and activating bouncers to jump on higher ground. You can pick up weapons, upgrade them and hunt for the magic fridge which gives you a random weapon when opened.

You can unlock new weaponry into the fridge, customize your character and bots by changing name and clothing.




This is how we want the multiplayer to look




Who are we?

We are a small group of indies working games for mostly mobile platforms. We decided to put up a campaign here so we can fund the development of multiplayer for our game, and add alot more awesome content to it!

Elias Viglione is the CEO and Founder of Panic Art Studios. Elias manages cosmetic programming, all the graphics, marketing, designing and overall multitasking!

Santeri Relander is our main programmer, he does all the technical stuff and is also going to handle the multiplayer side of programming.

Roland La Goy is our music composer and sound fx guy.

Why do we need your moolah?

Because we are poor indie developers. I need to work on freelancing art for clients to fund the company and our programmer cannot work fulltime on the game, so the progress is very slow.

If we can hit our goal we will be able to develop the game and hire a web expert to help us with the multiplayer aspect. We could all work fulltime on this and create something awesome!

 

New zombie concepts


What do you get if you fund?

You are going to get some awesome perks! As we go on, we want to develop this game with you! You can be part of the team on the design board! Check out the perks from the tab on the right side!

Low on money? Cant fund? Dont worry! You can also help in other ways!

Share the love! Tell people about the game, share in twitter or facebook! Make a gaming video on youtube! Any way you help us to spread even to 1 person we are truly grateful for it!

 

Want to try out the Single Player version? Well here are the links for the beta!

Android: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.panicartstudios.zkotw

PC / Linux: http://gamejolt.com/games/action/zombie-kill-of-the-week/14407/

story:
This video is the presentation of the artificial intelligence, we created it with RAIN but it's not so simple as we thought xD.

However now the enemies follow you and they don't walk across the walls and the game objects, they also do a waypoint path or go in random movement and if you are in a certain distance they attack you with punch, if you run behind an house they don't see you so they stop to follow you and turn back to their path.

This is a little video to show you the fluidy of the animations, that are in continuous improvement!


Here some screenshots:

 

About Us:

  • Hello, I'm Agnese, an italian girl, i love play survival pc games than i would develope a new survival game with my team.
  • This campaign is for all the people who love survival game like me.
  • With you're help we want to achieve a more beautiful game with more features, weapon, environmental, landscape, building and a more expansive gameplay with a lot of animations and more. 

Why 1.000€

  • At the moment we're working with Unity free version and free assets, so with the money we'll buy buildings, textures, a site, servers online and unity pro version for obtain a better quality of the game in general.
  • We also hope to reach the goal to pay Steam Greenlight.
  • For all donations over 20€ we'll give 20 keys when the game will be released.
  • If we don't reach the goal we'll invest the money consistently in the game.

What the project needs:

  • Rifle Animset Pro for 46.36€;
  • Weapon HQ #1 for €27.82;
  • Weapon HQ #2 for €9.27;
  • Weapon HQ #3 for €27.82;
  • Weapon HQ #5 for €23.18;
  • Weapon HQ #6 for €27.82;
  • Weapon HQ #7 for €23.18;
  • Apocalyptic City Pack for €69.54 (or something like that) as Human destroyed city;
  • Dark City for €69.54 (or something like that) as City of robots;
  • Industrial Factory Abandoned Military Base Set for €37.09;
  • Industrial Environment Pack Vol 1 for €115.90;
  • Sawmill Buildings Pack Volume1 for €18.54;
  • Production Buildings for €9.27;
  • Modular Military Environment Pack Volume1 for €92.72;
  • Robotic Space Lab for €13.91;
  • SF Industrial Colony for €41.72;
  • Lush Forest Pack for €32.45;
  • Mountain Forest Pack for €23.18;
  • 22 Tropical Vegetation Pack for €23.18;
  • Huge RealTrees Forest Pack for €23.18;
  • Nature Pack for €60.27;

About the Project

Software:

  • Unity3D 4.6 free version for make the game;
  • The Gimp 2 for icons.
Gameplay:
  • Third person.
  • Multiplayer, the game will be released as a multiplayer version cause pvp and coop will be important parts of our game!
  • 9 kinds of weapons: P2000, Glock19, MAC-10 and Knuckles as primary weapons and UMP-45, M4A1, AK-47, R-870, M39-EMR as secondary weapons; and these will be only a start because with the development will put others weapons!
  • 3 kinds of enemies: Low robot with low skills that drops low armors; Mid robot with mid skills that drops mid armors and high robot with high skills that drops high armors.
Scripts:
  • Done: Shot and reload system; Inventory system; Storage system; Player health; Player energy; Player respawn; Player animation controller; Pause system (when the inventory is open); Bleeding; Weapons equip; Enemy AI; Enemy Health; Enemy AI Damage; Enemy respawn; Consumable items; Spawn random objects.
  • To do: Clothing (only to write); HeadShot; Enemy drop (already thought); Online system. 

Map:
  • Size: 4500x4500
  • 3 main sites, 4 smaller places and 2 protected areas.
  • Environments: a desert, a canyon, a big pine forest, a lake and a rocky area.

Distribution (coming soon):

  • Steam;
  • Game site.

Other Ways To Help Us

You can also help us sharing our campaign on the sucial networks like facebook, twitter and what you want.

Who/Where We Are

Him: Ross Wilson, Dundee, Scotland (x)

Her: Chloe Helm, Heywood, England (x)

284 miles apart.

 

Our Story

July 2012. Two completely seperate roleplayers on Tumblr meet through a chance message to each other.

Our first conversation wasn't particularly grand in any way, it was just a normal chat about games, The Avengers, and lots of other random things.
Little did either of us know at that point what it would lead to.

We were talking for about 3 weeks before we started officially 'going out' (and I use that term as loosely as possible when near-on 300 miles seperate you).

Ever since then, the love and adoration we have for each other has grown considerably and is showing no signs of stopping.

 

What Chloe Has To Say

This will be the first time we meet in person, and I want it to be awesome.

I've always dreamt of the day when we finally meet, and this may be our only chance for a long time. We talk most of the time, either via text, Skype, Facebook, phone calls or Tumblr. There isn't a day that goes by where I don't talk to him (or talk about him) and it would mean the world to me if you guys could help us out!

Why We Need You (And Your Money)

Naturally, as long-distance lovers do, we have a very strong desire to meet each other in real life. And believe me, being hardcore gamers, 'real life' isn't something that we experience all too often.
 
Funds at both ends are very tight, so realising this goal could be a difficult task if it were not for you. We would like you to help our dreams come true. Bring us together, even if for a short while. Close the distance.
 

The Impact You Would Have

Your contribution to this project would mean more than the world to the both of us. Never before have I, Ross, felt this way about anyone in my entire life. Never before have I wanted to meet someone so much. (Tom Hiddleston is a close second.)
 
The love I have for Chloe isn't something that happens every day. Sure, people are falling in and out of love all over the place, but what we have is so much more special than that. We connect on every level, and to not make this dream come true would be more like a nightmare for us.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, (and I really hope that you can), you can still do something to help us!
Use the share tools on this page to get the word out! Spread our story. I know that it would mean the world to both of us.

story:
LAST CHANCE TO BUY PRE-ALPHA!

LAST CHANCE TO GET THE LAST SONG OF VÃ„INÃ„MÃ–NEN!

ALPHA WILL BE RELEASED TODAY!


Teaser trailer for The Last Song of VÃ¤inÃ¤mÃ¶inen:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vpGP4YiavWw 


Support AirBuccaneers HD!

Where else can you get a game that is an insane mix of Multiplayer Team-FPS, Hot Air Balloons, tactical "maritime" warfare and Ancient Northern Mythologies?

Help the fearsome warriors in their battle. The cannonballs and hot air are very expensive.


AirBuccaneers HD is an unique game concept: A Multiplayer First Person Squad Battle Game with Heavy Emphasis on Team Work and MMO-like Elements (or MFPSBGHETWMMO if you like). You can also use the term "ITEBG" meaning "Immersive Team Experience Battle Game."


AirBuccaneers HD highlights:

  • Multiplayer Squad Battle Game with very heavy emphasis on team work which creates a proper social gaming experience
  • Has slower pace than its competitors which makes it a perfect game for the gamers of the average age
  • MMO-like elements bring extra depth and personal objectives to the player
  • Multiple diverse character customization and development options
  • The biggest, most bad-ass weapon of mass destruction ever seen in video gaming history - The Last Song of VÃ¤inÃ¤mÃ¶inen
  • Unique style & theme that takes heavy influence from Kalevala and Viking mythos
  • Made with Unity for Windows and Mac platforms


Official Alpha Trailer

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iHqmejXJC9w


Teaser trailer for The Last Song of VÃ¤inÃ¤mÃ¶inen:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vpGP4YiavWw 


A Honest Plea of Help from the Vikings:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=edEXuDEb700 


Let me tell ye a story! The story of AirBuccaneers!

A long time ago, on the ungodly year of two thousand and four to be exact, a bunch of crazy Finns embarked on a journey to create a multiplayer game like none have seen before. And so the AirBuccaneers was born - an Unreal Tournament 2004 Mod which battled its way into the third place on Make Something Unreal Contest of 2004. As the crazy Finns concentrated their efforts on overtaking new challenges on the field of serious games, the AirBuccaneers fell under the veil of history and was forgottenâ€¦


BUT NOW - ON THE YEAR 2012 - THE BUCCANEERS RISE FROM THE ASHES OF OBLIVION AND TAKE THE SKIES BACK!


With new engine (Unity), new visuals, new features, new faces and new enemies the Buccaneering has embarked on a new era, the era of AirBuccaneers HD!


AirBuccaneers HD takes the players into a huge world engulfed in never-ending war between the Buccaneers and the Vikings. Players command heavily armed hot air balloons in fearsome battles. Flawless co-operation and nerves of steel are the keys to success. Course of war is determined by individual battles until one side is victorious. As the winning side is clear, the highest acclaimed warrior from their ranks takes over the throne, and bestows his name upon the next era in the world of AirBuccaneers.


The Impact

We've been funding this project from our own pockets thus far and we got to the point where our wallets are running thin. Now we need the help of you fans to make this game happen! The starving Buccaneers and Vikings truly appreciate your help.


What We Need & What You Get

Normally games of this magnitude cost millions to make. And they have marketing budgets that are as big or even bigger as the development budget. We are a small game studio courageously sailing in the stormy seas of game business and we haven't yet got a publisher backing us up. But we have one ace up our sleeves - We can make a game of this level happen with a fraction of the normal cost. Our initial development budget was only 1.2 Million Euros but we've already cut it down to 500 000 Euros. And we still were able to expand the game from the original plans.

This is the first funding phase which ends on 28th of February as we release the Alpha version of the AirBuccaneers HD. This also drops some of the stuff off from the game packs and bumps their prices up. And most importantly, the legendary Last Song of VÃ¤inÃ¤mÃ¶inen won't be available anymore. So get into buccaneering fast and receive legendary amounts of booty before it is too late.

We need the money to keep our programmers, artists and 3D modelers fed and paid. If we can't reach the target, we have to start cutting stuff from the game. Starting from in game items, skills and other game experience expanding features that'll be added later on. Then we have to start dropping characters and maps and so on. In the end, there's a risk that the project never gets into full completion.

You can also help us by buying one of the first five perk levels from our own shop in the AirBuccaneers HD website at http://www.airbuccaneers.com

Okay, then to the fun part. What do you get to yourself by investing in AirBuccaneers:

You always get the game as it is at the moment. And trust us, it's already lots of fun. Naturally you'll also get all future development versions and the finished game once it is released.


You can also unlock various amounts of extra content for the game and extra swag for yourself by backing us up more than the minimum amount.


Here's a descriptive table on the contents of different Tiers:



Disclaimer:

* The Soundtrack isn't finished yet. Digital versions will come available as soon as it's done.

** We will start the delivery of the gifts (e.g. Soundtrack album, Poster, T-Shirt, Hoodie etc.) once the game reaches Beta phase.

*** The portraits will be made from photographs. The client is responsible for delivering the needed photos to us in good enough detail.

**** We will solely decide when and how the weekend trip to our HQ can be organized. Of course we'll be in contact with you in order to organize a weekend that best suits us all.

***** You will receive the AirBuccaneers HD Source code as it is at the moment this campaign ends. This is subject to separate agreement between You and us.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help us tremendously by telling your friends about this game and getting them to play it. If you have the skills and the will, all kinds of videos and unofficial trailers are very much welcome. You can also ask your favorite gaming news magazine, site or alike to look into our game and make a story about it. Oh and remember to follow us in Facebook, Twitter, Google+ and Steam. And remember to get your friends to join too.
