If we manage to sell at least 50 000 game accounts before the release of the Beta version - which will happen on E3 2012 - we'll give all who purchased before the Beta release following extra in-game content:
  • Exclusive Beard that will give a special boost to your character
  • Exclusive Peg leg that will give a special boost to your character
  • Exclusive Crow that will sit on your character's shoulder and give a special boost to your character
  • Exclusive Grog Mug which you can consume once per round and which will give your character a special boost
  • Hidden Extra Super Bonus to be revealed later on

But remember, you will only get these if we sell at least 50 000 game accounts before the E3 of 2012. So remember to tell your friends!
story_txt:
LAST CHANCE TO BUY PRE-ALPHA!
LAST CHANCE TO GET THE LAST SONG OF VÃ„INÃ„MÃ–NEN!
ALPHA WILL BE RELEASED TODAY!



Teaser trailer for The Last Song of VÃ¤inÃ¤mÃ¶inen:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vpGP4YiavWw 

Support AirBuccaneers HD!
Where else can you get a game that is an insane mix of Multiplayer Team-FPS, Hot Air Balloons, tactical "maritime" warfare and Ancient Northern Mythologies?
Help the fearsome warriors in their battle. The cannonballs and hot air are very expensive.

AirBuccaneers HD is an unique game concept: A Multiplayer First Person Squad Battle Game with Heavy Emphasis on Team Work and MMO-like Elements (or MFPSBGHETWMMO if you like). You can also use the term "ITEBG" meaning "Immersive Team Experience Battle Game."


AirBuccaneers
HD highlights:



Multiplayer
Squad Battle Game with very heavy emphasis on team work which creates a proper
social gaming experience


Has
slower pace than its competitors which makes it a perfect game for the gamers of the average
age


MMO-like
elements bring extra depth and personal objectives to the player


Multiple
diverse character customization and development options

The
biggest, most bad-ass weapon of mass destruction ever seen in video gaming
history - The Last Song of VÃ¤inÃ¤mÃ¶inen

Unique
style & theme that takes heavy influence from Kalevala and Viking mythos

Made
with Unity for Windows and Mac platforms




Official Alpha Trailer
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iHqmejXJC9w

Teaser trailer for The Last Song of VÃ¤inÃ¤mÃ¶inen:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vpGP4YiavWw 

A Honest Plea of Help from the Vikings:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=edEXuDEb700 

Let me tell
ye a story! The story of AirBuccaneers!

A long time
ago, on the ungodly year of two thousand and four to be exact, a bunch of crazy
Finns embarked on a journey to create a multiplayer game like none have seen
before. And so the AirBuccaneers was born - an Unreal Tournament 2004 Mod which
battled its way into the third place on Make Something Unreal Contest of 2004.
As the crazy Finns concentrated their efforts on overtaking new challenges on
the field of serious games, the AirBuccaneers fell under the veil of history
and was forgottenâ€¦



BUT NOW -
ON THE YEAR 2012 - THE BUCCANEERS RISE FROM THE ASHES OF OBLIVION AND TAKE THE
SKIES BACK!


With new
engine (Unity), new visuals, new features, new faces and new enemies the
Buccaneering has embarked on a new era, the era of AirBuccaneers HD!

AirBuccaneers
HD takes the players into a huge world engulfed in never-ending war between the
Buccaneers and the Vikings. Players command heavily armed hot air balloons in
fearsome battles. Flawless co-operation and nerves of steel are the keys to
success. Course of war is determined by individual battles until one side is
victorious. As the winning side is clear, the highest acclaimed warrior from
their ranks takes over the throne, and bestows his name upon the next era in
the world of AirBuccaneers.




The Impact
We've been funding this project from our own pockets thus far and we got to the point where our wallets are running thin. Now we need the help of you fans to make this game happen! The starving Buccaneers and Vikings truly appreciate your help.


What We Need & What You Get
Normally games of this magnitude cost millions to make. And they have marketing budgets that are as big or even bigger as the development budget. We are a small game studio courageously sailing in the stormy seas of game business and we haven't yet got a publisher backing us up. But we have one ace up our sleeves - We can make a game of this level happen with a fraction of the normal cost. Our initial development budget was only 1.2 Million Euros but we've already cut it down to 500 000 Euros. And we still were able to expand the game from the original plans.

This is the first funding phase which ends on 28th of February as we release the Alpha version of the AirBuccaneers HD. This also drops some of the stuff off from the game packs and bumps their prices up. And most importantly, the legendary Last Song of VÃ¤inÃ¤mÃ¶inen won't be available anymore. So get into buccaneering fast and receive legendary amounts of booty before it is too late.

We need the money to keep our programmers, artists and 3D modelers fed and paid. If we can't reach the target, we have to start cutting stuff from the game. Starting from in game items, skills and other game experience expanding features that'll be added later on. Then we have to start dropping characters and maps and so on. In the end, there's a risk that the project never gets into full completion.

You can also help us by buying one of the first five perk levels from our own shop in the AirBuccaneers HD website at http://www.airbuccaneers.com


Okay, then to the fun part. What do you get to yourself by investing in AirBuccaneers:

**** We will solely decide when and how the weekend trip to our HQ can be organized. Of course we'll be in contact with you in order to organize a weekend that best suits us all.
***** You will receive the AirBuccaneers HD Source code as it is at the moment this campaign ends. This is subject to separate agreement between You and us.


Other Ways You Can Help
You can also help us tremendously by telling your friends about this game and getting them to play it. If you have the skills and the will, all kinds of videos and unofficial trailers are very much welcome. You can also ask your favorite gaming news magazine, site or alike to look into our game and make a story about it. Oh and remember to follow us in Facebook, Twitter, Google+ and Steam. story:
Come, let us tell a story. Let it be rich in the details, full of color and sound and texture. Let there be intrigue and magic, danger and passion. Let animals talk and people fly. We shall have sweet fruit and spiced almonds, dark coffee and golden tea. The gems of the Sultan will tumble through our fingers, shaping our fate. Come join me in a game of A Thousand and One Nights.

Telling stories is innate to humans. We have always told stories and we always will. One of the things I am very proud of in this game is the way it supports storytelling. In this game, there are specific, mechanical incentives for telling a good story. 
 
Intrique, envy and ambition are also very human. We all have stories about times we had to be careful of how we acted, or things we wanted, or working to reach a goal. You play a Courtier with very human ambitions, trying to balance your desires against your safety within the Sultan's Court.
 
The way the layers of the game connect creates a level of inventiveness and expressiveness in role-playing that I really love. In the course of the game, each Courtier is called on to portray a character in a Story. The Story level is where the tales of magic lamps and flying carpets and clever servant maids who outsmart bandit chieftans all come to life. And because of this characters-within-characters approach, amazing things can happen in the Story.
 
I'm ready to print the second edition of A Thousand and One Nights: a game of enticing stories. The writing, the art, the layout, the editing - it's all finished. The next step is getting it printed, and shipping it out. Funds from this campaign go to making that happen.

The details

I'm hoping to raise 1,001 dollars in order to cover a first print run large enough to keep costs down for you and for me. I've set this campaign for flexible funding, which means everything you pledge I can use. All levels of support are great, but I want to share a bit more about these three:
 
Visiting Scholar

I love story-telling, I love role-playing games, and I love books. When I was doing playtesting for the 1st edition, way back in 2005, I ran sessions of the game at various local libraries as part of their summer teen activities. This reward is in gratitude for the openness and enthusiasm of those librarians, and the imagination of the players. I'm looking forward to sending copies of A Thousand and One Nights to public libraries across the country, to support and encourage gaming and reading and libraries full of stories! 

Jeweler to the Court

In A Thousand and One Nights, dice are the gems of the Sultan. It does not matter what size dice they are, only that they are beautiful and remind you of gems and precious stones. Making the game more about the flow of the story and less about the numbers is a real design goal of mine, successfully reached. The antique brass bowls are inscribed on the outside with Arabic-style caligraphy and designs.

 

 

The Sultan's Own Chef

A Thousand and One Nights is a sensual game. As the Sultan's Own Chef, you have a unique opportunity to make your game night into an occasion to remember. This reward includes a booklet of fitting recipes, collected and adapted by Vincent Baker, to create several delightful feasts or one true extravaganza. Shown here: Persian rice with saffron, pistachios and sultanas; butter beans with herbs and golden tomatoes; butternut squash with caramelized small onions and almonds; and a salad of artichokes, oranges and black olives.

Connect with Vincent to customize your own selection; he'll include meat dishes at your request. For a preview: Persian Rice.

Also included in this reward: The candle is local orgainc beeswax, which releases the scent of honey as it burns. The sweets are fitting to the setting, tasty, and texturally different. The candle's flame, the setting cloth, the sweets and your dice and dishes all provide visual support. In the coming weeks, I intend to have a list of suggested background music up on the Night Sky Games website.

     

If you have played A Thousand and One Nights, or enjoyed a podcast that mentioned it, or read a review you liked, tell your friends about the game, and about this project! Use the links below to spread the word as wide as the night sky.

story:
Short description

To develop the project need a good 3D printers for prototyping. Currently owned 3d printer is too small for the larger models. Some words about Me:

  • For 10 years I lead technology projects for companies around the world. I was involved in designing solutions CNC, 3D Printing, Wearable technology, Augumented reality. Schemed successfully cardboard models of aircraft and vehicles. It operates in 3 CAD (Rhino 3D Fusion 360, Solidworks) and 2 3D applications such as 3DS Max and Blender.

  • The campaign aims to bring together the necessary resources for prototyping designed parts, With your help I can greatly accelerate the development of the project.

     

 

What You Get

  • Main perk is 3d printed 737 Yoke. ActuallyI finishing its design to make it so close to real as possible.
  • Early access for beta 737 Yoke model( Open Sourced After Campaign)
  • Access to resource files via shared Fusion 360 Folder that gives possibility to make parts on CNC machines and make modification.
  • An Open Source Cockpit Wallpaper.
  • A A320 and 737 Throttles for saitek 3d models ( Open Sourced After Campaign)

What I Need

Some details about project:

  • I need to gather about 1500 usd to buy almost new 3d printer Zortrax M200. Why such a printer. Becouse its just print I've seen it live and its reliable printer that no need of tune or anything its just print that will help focus on designing not servicing.
  • Check on the right as You can to support the project. I think You will find something for Yourself.
  • Earned funds will be used to buy a 3D printer, making the ordered part in the campaign.

 

Why support the project?

This is the first comprehensive design parts for simulators. Its development will let wszytskim build dashboards in their homes. Significantly lowering their price.:

  • Files on the platform Thingiverse have been downloaded more than 4000 times.
  • Project is alive over 8 months.
  • You can speed up testing of developed parts.

Risks & Challenges

So far I collected funds through voluntary donations, but only had enough material to print. Today, I need your help. I met with a huge amount of positive news from you. Today she needs material support.

  • For 7 years of experience in technology prototyping I believe that the items that you will receive will be fully useful and meet your expectations.
  • I will make my best to continue project.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If You can share my campaign.

story:
Newport City Gaming: has decided to do a 25 hour live gaming stream in aid of a local charity, the local charity we have chosen is The Olive Branch based in Newport, as they do such amazing work providing a safe refuge, food and loads more for the homeless of Newport.

It takes only £5 to feed two homeless or vulnerable for a week. 

What are we doing to help

Aside from donating money our selves, we will be doing all of the awesome stuff below.

From now until the 9th of February we will be using this page plus face to face donations to raise money The Olive Branch, this will help them continue to do the great work that they do now and hopefully we can also help out by drawing more attention and getting them more help in the future.

Although the fundraising will take place over a couple of weeks, it will all be based around one specific event which is our 25 live gaming stream, this will take place starting from Saturday the 25th at 12pm and finishing on Sunday the 26th at 1pm.

The stream you will all be able to watch from our normal streaming website www.youtube.com/thenewportcitygaming and chat to us through out the stream using the streams built in chat or our twitter @newportgaming.

Face to Face donations can be made by first of all mesaging us on twitter @newportgaming , facebook www.facebook.com/newportcitygaming or email studio@ncg.me.uk , once you have messaged us we will give you the details of where to do drop off the donations. (But please if possible try and do it through this webpage as that makes life allot easier)

During the live stream we may also have representatives from The Olive Branch in for a chat about what they do and how you can all help out (maybe become a volunteer)

Also there will be opportunities for you all to come in and have a gaming session with us in person during the live stream, but you will have to donate first (See perks section below).

About The Olive Branch and Bethel Community Church (Charity Number 1088725)

To provide a quality non discriminatory advice, advocacy and support service to those who are homeless or vulnerably housed in Newport Gwent, promoting social inclusion to those on the margins of society.  

The Olive Branch Day Centre exists for this very purpose.  We are run by a group of volunteers from Bethel Community Church and residents from the local area.

In order to meet the needs of our guests we offer an Advocacy service to support those who lack self esteem to access local services. 

We also make referrals to the local council for rehousing, Doctors, Dentist, drug and alcohol agencies.

Our Aims – to offer 

    1. Café facilities on a daily basis to provide cheap affordable meals.
    2. Individuals with the opportunity to build self-esteem through social interaction, i.e. games such as pool, table tennis, table football. 
    3. Art therapy group, Plus referrals to other agencies for counselling 
    4. Referrals to dentists, doctors and other medical professionals. 
    5. Referral system to other agencies.
    6. The use of IT suite to search for jobs and complete CV’s.  
    7. Help homeless find accommodation.

    The Olive Branch Day Centre is the only one of it’s kind in Newport Gwent, we see on average 25 - 40 guests each day.   

    Our ultimate aim is to see broken people healed and fully restored.

    For more information please visit their website http://www.bethelnewport.co.uk/olivebranch/

    About Newport City Gaming

    Newport City Gaming is a community project based in around Newport South Wales, for gamers who want to go further with gaming than just playing.

    At this moment there are only 4 of us and we a dedicated to this project, the plan for the very near future is to expand and allow more dedicated gamers and media creators/ fans into our slowly expanding project.

    Although there is a gaming community in Newport and plenty of other projects based around other forms of art and entertainment, for example music, there is no project out there to help the gamers of Newport get away from just playing the games.

story:
Our Story

Blackwyrm Books And Games is a publisher of experimental fiction and quality roleplaying games. In conjunction with Hero Games' release of the Star Hero 6th Edition roleplaying game at GenCon 2011, we are attempting to simultaneously release seven science fiction settings that can be played using the Star Hero rules.  

 

We're calling this entire undertaking Project WyrmStar. 

The Impact

Hero Games isn't planning on releasing any settings for Star Hero: only the core rulebook and some equipment books. We are hoping to "fill the gap" that leaves by releasing unique and interesting setting books that can be used to play the game immediately, rather than forcing Game Masters to take the time to create their own setting. 

 

The Wreck of Alpha Central for HERO System 6th Edition is one of these settings. 


What We Need & What You Get

Ecumenopolis.

 

It means "world city", and science fiction is full of them -- Isaac Asimov's Trantor and the Star Wars series' Coruscant are two of the most well known, but there are plenty more. Depending on your view of city living, such visions can be invigorating or terrifying. Or both. It is hard to imagine the scale of such places; many times, writers give population figures that "sound big" but are ludicrously small. If we assume that only the land area of an Earth-sized world can be built on, and we assume that only 75% of that can be used, and we give it a population density comparable to the most densely populated modern regions, we end up with 2-4 trillion people, depending on which numbers we pick. However, even the most densely populated modern cities don't include mile-high apartment complexes or a hundred sublevels below the surface -- based on the visual and written descriptions, a typical science-fiction ecumenopolis could easily have ten times that many people and still offer most residents tolerable living quarters, with room for open areas, parks, stadiums, and plazas.

 

So what happens to a world of 40 trillion people when the food shipments stop and the lights go out?

 

That's what Ian Harac’s setting The Wreck of Alpha Central is all about: what happens when after the catastrophic collapse of a once-proud ecumenpolis, leaving it a husk filled with high-tech ruins, mutants, monsters, and forgotten wonders. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Tell other gamers about Blackwyrm and Project WyrmStar!
story_txt:
Our Story

Blackwyrm Books And Games is a publisher of experimental fiction and quality roleplaying games. In conjunction with Hero Games' release of the Star Hero 6th Edition roleplaying game at GenCon 2011, we are attempting to simultaneously release seven science fiction settings that can be played using the Star Hero rules.  
 
We're calling this entire undertaking Project WyrmStar. 



The Impact

Hero Games isn't planning on releasing any settings for Star Hero: only the core rulebook and some equipment books. We are hoping to "fill the gap" that leaves by releasing unique and interesting setting books that can be used to play the game immediately, rather than forcing Game Masters to take the time to create their own setting. 
 
The Wreck of Alpha Central for HERO System 6th Edition is one of these settings. 




What We Need & What You Get

Ecumenopolis. 
 
It means "world city", and science fiction is full of them -- Isaac Asimov's Trantor and the Star Wars series' Coruscant are two of the most well known, but there are plenty more. Depending on your view of city living, such visions can be invigorating or terrifying. Or both. However, even the most densely populated modern cities don't include mile-high apartment complexes or a hundred sublevels below the surface -- based on the visual and written descriptions, a typical science-fiction ecumenopolis could easily have ten times that many people and still offer most residents tolerable living quarters, with room for open areas, parks, stadiums, and plazas. 
 
So what happens to a world of 40 trillion people when the food shipments stop and the lights go out?
 
That's what Ian Harac’s setting The Wreck of Alpha Central is all about: what happens when after the catastrophic collapse of a once-proud ecumenpolis, leaving it a husk filled with high-tech ruins, mutants, monsters, and forgotten wonders.

story:
The Sunside team has worked on indie hits like Desert Combat and Crow, and AAA hits including Battlefield 2 and Borderlands 1 & 2.


Abducted is a game in which you play an ordinary person thrust into extraordinary circumstances. Abducted by aliens and taken thousands of light years from home, you have one ultimate goal: Escape. But you have so many unanswered questions... How did you get here? What is this place? Who took you and why?

There are a few things you learn right away.  You're clearly somewhere in deep space, one look at the starfield and asteroids drifting by outside the window makes that pretty clear.  And then there's this device implanted in your arm, how did it get there?  Who put it there?  You can have conversations with it, explore its functionality, it can even help you fight hostile aliens and control the environment.

If you want to survive and get away from this place, you'll have to solve these mysteries and others.

The best way to understand Abducted is to watch the Introduction video at the top of this page.  You'll get to see actual game footage running on Windows and get a sneak peek at the development in progress.


We're looking for what is essentially 'micro-funding' in order to more effectively continue the development of Abducted, and create a proper release for it on Steam.  The Steam release will be parts 1 & 2 of a four part game.  This will make the Steam PC and Mac releases very meaty, a good lengthy adventure. 

We are already approved for a Steam release, with your help we can have parts 1 & 2 released this year as a single release.  Parts 3 and 4 will be released separately early next year.

Abducted is an atmospheric, realistically paced adventure game.  And its our goal to constantly improve it, and with your help and involvement we can make it better.  With your help it can be a great game.  And that's what we want, a great adventure story!


Indiegogo gives us a way to raise funds flexibly and meet a partial target.  Partial amounts will still work, we'll budget accordingly.  Our #1 expense is paying the team and contractors we bring on.  Available funds just makes everything we do that much easier.  Ideally we make all of what we're asking, but say we only made half- we would still ship on Steam and have a good release, it will just take longer than we planned.

Meeting our funding goal will allow us to guarantee a release date this year by paying the key people we need to deliver their work on time.  So for these reasons partial funding is ok, but full funding is ideal.

You'll be rewarded with all kinds of goodies so you won't be empty handed no matter what!  This is going to be a lot of fun.  It's fun for us to be indie developers, fun to share our process and great to be making things we can give you!  Check out the perks some of them are pretty unique.


  • $12,500 - CHOOSE YOUR GENDER

At this stretch goal we'll add a male option when creating your character.  $2500 will cover the costs of making the character art, professionally recording the voice acting and doing the coding needed to make it work.  You'll be able to customize his appearance and name much like the main character in the game right now, and we may be able to throw in a few new customization options for both male and female if this goal is achieved.  And thank you!  This is a choice we would love to give you when playing the game!

  • $15,000 - BONUS PART 5

Continue the adventure!  For this goal we will make and release a Bonus Part 5 of Abducted.  There's some material we have right now that could be a part of it, it would just need to be finished (essentially this is cut material, not cut for quality purposes, but cut right now to make the game tight and producable).  For a small amount we can work it back in to the story and have it released by the end of the game.  And if we manage to reach this goal, thank you very much!  This will allow us to make the end of the game much stronger!


If we are funded at least partially through Indiegogo, it will give us additional freedom and resources to expand the game and make it better immediately.

We released Crow on iOS and Mac platforms in 2012. As an indie developer's first title, we did reasonably well. Crow has over 200,000 players on Game Center and we attracted a small but loyal following of gamers. Crow has a PC version too, and is about to be released on Steam.

The micro-funding we're seeking on Indiegogo is very low risk.  Abducted Part 1 has already shipped on iOS and can be downloaded and played today.


If you can't contribute that's ok!  We tried to keep the perks very low priced so anyone can do this, but you can still help us in many ways!

  • Give us a like on Facebook, follow us on Twitter, and subscribe to our Youtube channel.  We promise to keep it interesting!
  • Tell your friends about us!  Did you play Crow or Abducted and enjoy the hell out of them?  Tell people you know!  Blog about it, tweet about it!  Take the time to write us a positive review!
  • Of course spread the word on our Indiegogo campaign!  Let everyone know about it and maybe if you can't contribute, someone you know can.

Thank you so much!  You read this far, you've seen what we're up to.  Thank you for helping us and we'll see you in the game.

story:
Welcome to the campaign!

Good day to you all out there and thank you very much in advance for all your support and helping us to fulfil our biggest dream: A plastic box full of Lansknechts!

Since we started this business venture, we always had such a big project like a plastic box in mind but never had the chance, contacts and most important the financial resources to bring this thought to life. As we grew bigger and eventually find a company to produce and a sculptor to make the figures we finally decided to start this project and give it a go.

We made some bad experience and learned that things don't come easy and good things do take their time (a long one to be sure!) but after all the hard work, we are finally here for the last, big step.

As you may have already seen, most of the sculpting work is already done but "only" the big steel plastic-injection mould is missing which is by far the most expensive part of this big-ticket project. And for that reason we need all you hobbyists, painters, collectors and gamers out there to support us.

With this Indiegogo-Campaign we want to produce a full plastic-set filled with wargamer goodness and eventually many other lead miniatures plus more plastic if our funding-goal is exceeded by far!

When will the miniatures be released?

I get many questions about the shipping of the products. It is really difficult to tell. Once we have all the financial resources we ship all parts to Renedra Ltd who cast our miniatures and make the plastic injection mould.
However, this progress of making a mould takes long - very long! And you have to add our waiting time as Renedra won't immediately start with making the mold once our master miniatures are with them. An exact date can't be given, but don't expect them before summer 2015!

So what do I get and how does it work?

This crowdfunding campaign is quite simple: you do donate a certain amount of money (mostly by choosing one of the so called "perks" to the right) and in exchange you will get the to-be-funded product plus some extra perk-goodies once the product is available and the financial-goal is reached.
If we do not reach our financial-goal you will get your spent money immediately back in full amount.

We do have 9 perks in total (Perk 2-9 are called level 1-8. With any level you will receive miniatures and extra stuff) for which you pay a fix cost. All pledged perks together are shown in the above right corner next to the financial-goal or below with illustrations.
Once the financial-goal is reached, we will update this Indiegogo-site with plans for more miniatures to be released (further called stretch goals) with the excess money.

While you are paying for one perk/level you can even increase the money you want to be pledged. This can either be because of an additional donation from your side or that you want to buy some extra stretch goals (Add-Ons) once they are reached or all always available as single Add-On's.
Simply write in your pledge comments which extra Add-on you like.
Please take note that we do have some deals that include "all reached goals" and that buying the goals seperately may causes a higher price in total.

What is in the Plastic Box?

In this box will be 24 hard plastic 28mm (1/56) miniatures that come with a leaflet (approximately 16-18 pages full with historical background, assembling tips, painting shemes etc) and a single sheet with six different flags.

The box will hold 4 frames in total. Two core Landsknecht frames plus two extra command frames.
The core frame will contain 10 different bodies plus 20 different heads as well as enough arms to have yours  Landsknechts in advancing and marching poses with weapon options for halberds, spears and pikes. The frame will also hold extra swords, pouches and other nice extras.
The command frame will include 2 bodies plus a huge selection of extra heads, enough parts for musicians and banner bearers.

Here is a pre-view for the miniatures. Please note that these only represent a very small part of what is in the box. We can't show you many more sculpts due the WIP-status of the project. So what's missing on the picture? All upright arms, many more heads, command options, little extra (pouches, hats, etc).
For some detail shots, please scroll until the very bottom of this campaign! As soon as I get photos of completly new parts of the figures, I will immediately update the gallery section.
(Update: Some with with the marching arm added)

All plastic miniatures have been sculpted by the very talented Michael Anderson!

Step-by-Step!

1. Choose one of the perks to the right.

2.1 Increase your donation if you want to purchase some extra Add-Ons (Scroll down for Add-Ons information)

2.2 Name your Add-Ons Codes! Otherwise you will receive random add-ons...

2.3 Share this Indiegogo Page via Facebook, Wargaming Forum etc and receive an extra goody (scroll down for more information)

3. Check this Indiegogo Page or our Facebook Page every day for new updates and other news!

Final words!

For any questions regarding this Indiegogo-Campaign or Pro Gloria Miniatures in particular, please feel free to drop us a line under info@progloria.com or right here in the comment section - your questions might help other people, too!

For any updates on the campaign, please see the update section from this crowdfunder or check out and like our Facebook Page: Link.

What else to say than thank you all guys, we do appreciate all your support over the time and enjoy your euphoria that we do feel the same! 

But enough of my babbling - up to the Perks!



Stretch Goals

As mentioned above, if we gain more than our initial goal, we can release extra miniatures. They will be available later as Add-Ons once they are achieved or you can buy level-perks where the goals are all included.


More to come later!!

Sharing Extra!

If you share this Indiegogo Site via Facebook or any other wargaming related Forum, you will receive this extra poster. Simply name us the link to your sharing post in the purchase comments or send it directly to us info@progloria.com



Add-On!

Here all current extra Add-On's you can get. Simply add the cost of the add-on to your pledge. (when you are checking out you can increase the amount that you pay).
Once you paid, send me an e-mail to info@progloria.com with your e-mail and indiegogo name plus the codes for your add-ons. Very simple, you see :)

If you already have pledged/bought any level but you want some add-ons later on, simply donate the cost of your add-ons via this indiegogo site (right above corner, you can donate money without buying any perks/levels) and write me an e-mail with all the detail.

Current Add-Ons:



Some Detail shots (as mentioned above, these pictures only show the parts which are finished until now. Picture do not show extra heads, puches, marching arms, other weapons etc.):

story:
We are a team of two indie developers creating our vision of what retro 2D platforming games should be. Matthew and Declan both met as a result of a earlier project Matthew had worked on, 4Space. 4Space was a minecraft mod that allowed players to visit any planet in the solar system, Declan had made videos on the mod and became a follower of it. Both Declan and Matthew had talked frequently about various topics, one was becoming a indie developer team, so in mid 2015 they became a team and Equlibrium Games was born. Right now we are making a game called DarkNote and that is probably why you are here, read about it below!

DarkNote is a 2D platformer game that uses a Perlin generator to create infinite assortments of music and levels to explore. We use a difficulty level on players to determine how hard each level should be, as the player goes throughout each level they will pick up experience, lives, health, points and attacks. When a player goes to a new level they will take experience, lives and attacks there health and points will be saved to a scoreboard but will be reset in the new level. If you fail to complete a level your difficulty rate will drop, but if you succeed and advance to a new level the difficulty rate you play will increase. Your final level points and health will help determine how much difficulty you will gain. Enemy's are also scored under a difficulty rating, its not often that you will fight higher level enemy's. Please remember that DarkNote is early in development, some features, textures and game systems may change.


  • Infinite randomly generated music
  • Infinite randomly generated levels
  • Multiplayer
  • Player has a difficulty level
  • Achievements
  • Scoreboard
  • Checkpoints system
  • Health, lives & points
  • Selectable attacks (found in levels)
  • Low system requirements 
  • Dynamic and static lighting
  • Full API for modders 
  • Save & load system
  • Inventory system for keys and attacks
  • Settings and pause screens
Not everything on that list is fully complete, we plan on adding all of them during the campaign or shortly after.

DarkNote was conceived as an adaptation of Matthew’s side project FMusic which was never intended to be released. It was a very basic program that had a primitive GUI used to produce random music. During a Skype call Declan was surprised that the music was actually coherent, later while playing a dungeon crawler game he became annoyed with the repetitive music of the game he was playing and instead used FMusic to play music over it. After realising the potential use of this Declan pitched the idea of a dungeon crawler with infinite music and generation and difficulty based on the music to Matthew and development began that day using an old engine Matthew created dubbed “Flounder 2D” Later the name DarkNote was chosen due to its the games, at the time, dark aesthetic and relation to music. Equilibrium Games was also chosen by Declan as “I always liked the word equilibrium, it just sounds cool".

Creating a game can costs money and distributing/ selling it takes even more. Your money will be put to great use keeping our website and forum up and running. And some will help launch our Steam Greenlight.



Out game is very low risk, we have a solid game engine and solid game mechanics already coded, implemented, and working, but we have a few things that could go wrong as listed below.

  • Random level generation may not work as planed.
  • Multiplayer servers may take longer than planed.
We will work hard to overcome these obstacles and complete DarkNote with our promised features! The last risk is if you select a high level perk with lower level perks included that have been filled you will not receive them.

To run DarkNote these are the minimum system requirements:
  • 500 megabytes (MB's) of free system ram
  • 100 megabytes (MB's) of free hard drive space
  • Java 1.5 and above
  • Windows XP, Ubuntu 10.04 (Most linux releases will work), Mac OS X 10.4
  • Internet access (for multiplayer)
  • 1080 x 720 resolution monitor or larger for good gameplay
(These requirements are subject to change as DarkNote grows it may require more / less.)


We understand not everyone can contribute to our IndieGoGo campaign, but you will still be able to purchase our game on Steam and on our website. You can also email ideas to Matthew at mattparks5855@gmail.com


** A better video will come very soon, this is currently a preview video.

** After the campaign contributers will get a email containing there perk's information.

When a player goes to a new level they will take experience, lives and attacks there health and points will be saved to a scoreboard but will be reset in the new level. If you fail to complete a level your difficulty rate will drop, but if you succeed and advance to a new level the difficulty rate you play will increase. Your final level points and health will help determine how much difficulty you will gain. Enemy's are also scored under a difficulty rating, its not often that you will fight higher level enemy's. Please remember that DarkNote is early in development, some features, textures and game systems may change.











Infinite randomly generated music
Infinite randomly generated levels
Multiplayer
Player has a difficulty level
Achievements
Scoreboard
Checkpoints system
Health, lives & points
Selectable attacks (found in levels)
Low system requirements 
Dynamic and static lighting

Full API for modders 

Save & load system
Inventory system for keys and attacks
Settings and pause screens

Not everything on that list is fully complete, we plan on adding all of them during the campaign or shortly after.


   


DarkNote was conceived as an adaptation of Matthew’s side project FMusic which was never intended to be released. It was a very basic program that had a primitive GUI used to produce random music. During a Skype call Declan was surprised that the music was actually coherent, later while playing a dungeon crawler game he became annoyed with the repetitive music of the game he was playing and instead used FMusic to play music over it. After realising the potential use of this Declan pitched the idea of a dungeon crawler with infinite music and generation and difficulty based on the music to Matthew and development began that day using an old engine Matthew created dubbed “Flounder 2D” Later the name DarkNote was chosen due to its the games, at the time, dark aesthetic and relation to music. Equilibrium Games was also chosen by Declan as “I always liked the word equilibrium, it just sounds cool".






Creating a game can costs money and distributing/ selling it takes even more. Your money will be put to great use keeping our website and forum up and running. And some will help launch our Steam Greenlight.





















  Out game is very low risk, we have a solid game engine and solid game mechanics already coded, implemented, and working, but we have a few things that could go wrong as listed below.  Random level generation may not work as planed. Multiplayer servers may take longer than planed. 
We will work hard to overcome these obstacles and complete DarkNote with our promised features! The last risk is if you select a high level perk with lower level perks included that have been filled you will not receive them.







To run DarkNote these are the minimum system requirements:


500 megabytes (MB's) of free system ram
100 megabytes (MB's) of free hard drive space
Java 1.5 and above
Windows XP, Ubuntu 10.04 (Most linux releases will work), Mac OS X 10.4
Internet access (for multiplayer)
1080 x 720 resolution monitor or larger for good gameplay


(These requirements are subject to change as DarkNote grows it may require more / less.)







 We understand not everyone can contribute to our IndieGoGo campaign, but you will still be able to purchase our game on Steam and on our website. You can also email ideas to Matthew at mattparks5855@gmail.com

** A better video will come very soon, this is currently a preview video.
** After the campaign contributers will get a email containing there perk's information.

story:
Life on Alfie's home island was never exactly thrilling. A day always consisted of either fishing or working at the silo, breathing in all kinds of dust and smelling of fish, much to Alfie's discontent.

 

Then one day, the wildlings came and gone, taking with themselves the village's blue crystal.

The instant the crystal was taken from the village shrine, a mysterious portal started forming in its place. The villagers don't know what it is exactly, but it looks much too ominous not to worry about it.

Now it's up to Alfie and his pet, Vincenzo, to take back the crystal from the King of Wildlings... Since grandpa's back can't handle it.

 

  • Alfie - a dreamer both day and night, he is sent on an unexpected adventure (has a special ability)
  • Grandpa - Alfie's grumpy grandfather; probably knows more than Alfie thinks (has back problems)
  • Vincenzo - Alfie's pet, who never leaves his owner's side (can glide in the air)
  • Walter - A mysterious knight who Alfie encounters during his adventure (probably bathes in armor)
  • ??? - One of the wildlings; not much is known about him (has glorious hair)

 

 

The game mostly revolves around Alfie, who has the ability to break up or assemble glowing objects, depending on their current state.

At times, Alfie will come across places that he can't reach. That's where Vincenzo comes in, who can jump higher and glide in the air.

During his journeys, Alfie will have to deal with common enemies that will try to crush him, shoot him down and run him over, among other things.

At the end of most levels, Alfie will encounter a difficult to beat boss. Can't beat these unless you stay on top of your game!

All the sound and music for the game is composed by the Bencsik brothers. Here's a little taste of what it's going to sound like:

We are planning to release the game in September for Windows, Linux and Mac on Steam and itch.io (whichever you like more). An Xbox One release is also planned.

However, the game on Steam is still in the Greenlight phase; you can help by voting for it by clicking the button below:

Brute Drop is a small team, from a small town, in a small country.  We went to the same IT college, where we dreamed up the game that would be King of Wildlings.


Mark Marcikić - Programming

Loves indie games and has been working on games for quite some time. Used to work alone, then realized he has no talent for art. Most well-mannered person on Earth. Has a beard.


Favorite games: Super Meat Boy, Stardew Valley, Fez, Fallout series, Grand Theft Auto series


Noel Tímár - Art

Has a knack for design - from photography and pixel art to desktop customization, he is  always dabbling in art, in some shape or form. Often flustered about something. Has a beard.

Favorite games: Half-Life series, Diablo 3, Nuclear Throne, Team Fortress 2, Super Meat Boy, Borderlands 2, Dirt 3

Roland Torma - Animations
Zsombor Bencsik - sound effects
Levente Bencsik - music
Trexyca Artworks - cover art

We've been working on King of Wildlings for quite a few months now, and we pretty much used up all our reserved funds (which wasn't much). The reason we want to collect funds now, is so that we can keep working on the game full time and divert our full attention to it in the coming months. If we manage to hit the goal, we'll be able to create additional levels, develop the story more and refine the art.


How we'll spend it:

  • Game dev: 50%
  • Mac & Linux support: 10%
  • Rewards Production: 10%
  • Taxes: 30%

Here is a breakdown of all the perks and what you get with them. The higher priced perks all come with every previous item.

  • $5 - Early bird
    • Get a digital copy of the game upon release (limited)
  • $7 - Digital Copy
    • Get a digital copy of the game upon release
  • $15 - Contributor
    • Get a digital copy and a King of Wildlings themed wallpaper pack + your name goes in the credits as a Contributor
  • $25 - Sticker Pack
    • Get a King of Wildlings themed sticker pack
  • $35 - Digital Art Book
    • Get a digital book containing the game's art with sketches
  • $65 - Soundtrack
    • Get the soundtrack once the game is released
  • $100 - Beta Access
    • You'll get access to the game before release and you can help with the final phase of development
  • $150 - Major Contributor
    • Appear in the game as an NPC on Alfie's home island
    • Have your name on the list of major contributors in the credits

Finally, we'd like to thank anyone who contributes to the funds, and we hope you all like the game.

If you don't have the dolla, dolla to spend, spreading the word also helps greatly!

Find us on social media:

Facebook

Instagram

Twitter

The Brute Drop website

story:
Since 2006, Otherworld Miniatures has been producing 28mm fantasy miniatures for gamers, painters and collectors, inspired by the iconic imagery of the early roleplaying games.  So far, we have just made the monsters, and with a range of nearly 400 creatures in our catalogue, we think that the time has come to introduce some player character models.

We could grow the range slowly, making a couple of figures a month for a few years, but we’d really like to be able to release a substantial range into the marketplace from the start.  Unfortunately, the costs of such a project are significant, so we’re asking for your help.  With the aid of our backers, we plan to release this range, initially with a boxed set of 12 Human adventurers, quickly followed by sets of demi-humans, female adventurers and hirelings and henchmen, over the course of the next few months.  The range of boxed sets will be complemented by individual blister-packs featuring variant models with different armour, weapon and equipment options.

The figures will be sculpted by a variety of talented sculptors, including Kevin Adams and Patrick Keith, with others joining the project later.  The miniatures will depict archetypal fantasy adventurers, human and demi-human, male and female, wearing practical clothing and armour and carrying realistic weapons and equipment. They will be posed for exploration, not combat.  And these characters won’t be muscle-bound superheroes waving Vorpal Swords in the air - they’ll be grim-faced dungeoneers, a little bit down on their luck, and ready for action on your table-top!

The 4 initial boxed sets will be:

DAB1 – Dungeon Adventurers I – Human Male Characters (planned release – January 2013)

  • Fighter in Plate Mail, with Bastard Sword & Torch
  • Cleric in Chainmail, with Mace & Cross
  • Magic User in Robes, with Staff & Lantern
  • Thief in Leather Armour, with Shortsword & Sack
  • Druid in Leather Armour, with Scimitar
  • Ranger in Leather Armour, with Bow
  • Monk in Robes, with Quarterstaff
  • Barbarian in Studded Leather, with Spear & Shield
  • Illusionist in Robes, with Scroll
  • Assassin in Studded Leather, with Blade Venom
  • Paladin in Plate Armour, with Longsword & Shield
  • Bard in Chainmail, with Longsword & Lute

 

DAB2 – Dungeon Adventurers II – Demi-human Male Characters (planned release – March 2013)

  • Dwarf Fighter in Plate Mail, with Battleaxe
  • Dwarf Cleric in Chainmail, with Warhammer & Shield
  • Dwarf Thief in Leather Armour, with Shortsword
  • Gnome Illusionist/Thief in Leather Armour, with Shortsword & Sack
  • Gnome Fighter in Plate Mail, with Polearm
  • Half-orc Fighter/Cleric in Banded Mail, Warhammer & Shield
  • Half-orc Assassin in Studded Leather, with Heavy Crossbow
  • Half-elf Fighter/Thief in Leather Armour, with Shortbow
  • Halfling Fighter in Plate Armour, with Axe & Shield
  • Halfling Thief in Leather Armour, with Shortsword & Sling
  • Elf Fighter/Magic User in Chainmail, with Longsword & Wand
  • Elf Thief in Leather Armour, with Shortsword & Rope

 

 

DAB3 – Dungeon Adventurers III – Female Characters (planned release – June 2013)                                                                                                                                                                    

  • Human Fighter in Plate Mail, with Longsword & Shield
  • Human Cleric in Chainmail, with Flail & Holy Symbol
  • Human Thief in Leather Armour, with Rope & Grappling Hook
  • Human Magic User in Robes, with Dagger & Torch
  • Dwarf Fighter in Plate Mail, with Warhammer
  • Gnome Fighter in Chainmail, with Light Crossbow
  • Human Ranger in Leather Armour, with Shortsword & Dagger
  • Half-elf Druid in Leather Armour, with Spear & Torch
  • Elf Magic User in Robes, with Dagger & Scroll
  • Half-orc Assassin in Studded Leather, with Longsword & Hand-axe
  • Human Barbarian in Leather and Furs, with Spear and Torch
  • Human Monk in Robes, with Bardiche & Lantern

 DAB4 – Dungeon Adventurers IV – Hirelings & Henchmen (planned release – June 2013) 

  • Mercenary Swordsman
  • Mercenary Crossbowman
  • Mercenary Spearman
  • Pack Bearer I
  • Pack Bearer II
  • Lantern Bearer
  • Torch Bearer
  • Squire
  • Scribe/Mapper
  • Mule Handler
  • Expedition Mule
  • Expedition Equipment

 Each set of 12 miniatures will include 12 metal scenic dungeon bases, and  will be supplied packed into a foam-lined carry case made by FeldHerr in Germany.  All of these figures will be cast in pewter.  Some will require minor assembly, such as a seperate shield or weapon arm.  They are all supplied unpainted.

Stretch Goals

  • If we reach our initial target of $5000, all levels of support will receive a bonus gift of a 'Weapons & Equipment Pack', designed for converting your characters to suit your precise needs.  ACHIEVED!
  • If we reach $10,000, all contributors at Level 4 and above will receive a free 'Treasure Items Pack'.  ACHIEVED!
  • Reaching a goal of $15,000 will see all backers of Level 5 and above granted a bonus pack called 'Adventurers' Campsite', featuring bed-rolls, a campfire & cooking pots, and other paraphernalia.  ACHIEVED!
  • At $20,000, all backers of Levels 6 & 7 will receive an 'Adventurers' Cart Set', pulled by an expedition mule and piled with adventuring gear, looted treasure, and a fallen comrade.  ACHIEVED!
  • At $25,000, all backers of Level 4 and above will receive a pair of War/Guard Dogs – 1 sitting, 1 standing, wearing studded leather collars & harness.  ACHIEVED!
  • At $30,000, for Level 7 only – a set of 'Adventurers’ Stores' – crates, boxes, chests, sacks, barrels.  ACHIEVED!
  • At $35,000, for Level 5 and beyond, a pack of Magic Users’ Familiars (standard) – cat, crow, hawk, owl, toad, weasel.  ACHIEVED!
  • At $40,000, again for Level 5+ a pack of Magic Users’ Familiars (special) – quasit, pseudo-dragon, brownie, imp, homonculus.  ACHIEVED!
  • At $45,000, for Level 4 and above, a Dwarf Mercenary Warrior, lightly armoured but heavily armed!  Designed and sculpted by the multi-talented Des Hanley.  ACHIEVED!
  • At $50,000, for Level 7 only, a pack of 4 Slain Adventurers - the gruesome remains of the Fighter, Cleric, Magic User and Thief from DAB1.  ACHIEVED!
  • If we reach $55,000, all backers of Levels 6 and 7 will receive a seated Magic-user model - a variant of the DA1 Magic-user, remodelled to drive the 'Adventurers' Cart from the $20k bonus.  ACHIEVED!
  • All stretch goals now achieved. No further bonuses will be added.

Timescales

Our planned availability dates are:

  • DA1 - Magic User, Cleric, Fighter & Thief - October 2012
  • DA2 - Monk, Ranger, Druid & Barbarian - November 2012
  • DA3 - Assassin, Paladin, Bard, Illusionist - December 2012
  • DAB1 - Dungeon Adventurers I Boxed Set (Human Male Characters) - January 2013
  • DAB2 - Dungeon Adventurers II Boxed Set (Demi-human Characters) - March 2013
  • Hireling Bonus Packs (Pack-bearer, Lantern-bearer, Mule-handler) - January 2013
  • Stretch Goal Bonuses (Weapons & Equipment, Treasure Items, Adventurers' Campsite, Adventurers' Cart, War Dogs) - December 2012 to March 2013
  • DAB3 - Dungeon Adventurers III Boxed Set (Female Characters) - June 2013
  • DAB4 - Dungeon Adventurers IV Boxed Set (Hirelings & Henchmen) - June 2013

Items will be shipped out as and when they become available, unless backers specifically request to combine a shipment.  For example, a Level 5 backer who selects DAB1 & DAB2, will get their DAB1 set (plus any stretch bonuses achieved, if available) in January 2013, and the DAB2 set (with any remaining bonus packs) in March 2013.

Shipping

Worldwide shipping costs are included in all pledge levels.  Shipments will be sent by first class or airmail parcel post.

Progress

Regular progress reports, including photos of sculptors' master models as they are completed, will be sent out to all backers at regular intervals.

story:
Hi everyone. We’re Laia and Ian, founders of Sukubus Studio. We’re delighted to show you the second miniatures range we’ve developed on 3D for our studio.
Thanks to this platform we are glad to show you our creations and would like to know your thoughts on them. We hope you like them as much as we’ve enjoyed developing them.

Valkyries Team is made up by a group of nordic female warriors. In it there are diverse kinds of Valkyries that represent the diverse roles in a Fantasy Football match. We’ve prepared several stretch goals that will add to the team as the campaign develops.

The idea came to us when Sukubus Team campaign finished. The feedback from backers was amazing and thanks for their support, encourage us to continue producing Fantasy Football Teams. For this occasion we decided to do something different again, and continue to offer alternative quality miniatures. We would like to point out that miniatures of the Valkyries Team will be slightly higher than the Sukubus Team.

Production will be made in high quality resin on a 32mm scale. We’re certain of the finishing of each miniature, as they will be made by our friends at RN Estudio, great professionals that have a lot of experience in this kind of campaigns.

This counter is an exclusive gift for this campaign. Each backer will receive only one counter per package or one per each complete team in case that you order more than one.

We want to offer the best quality for our backers. That's why we have managed to make the production of Valkyries Dices with Chessex. A great customized dices company that get the best results. 

Hungry Troll has made these awesome bases to complete the Valkyries Team. These magnificent art works fit perfectly with your miniatures.





Thanks to your support we’ll be able to carry out production and all costs that it implies:
  1. Production of master models (3D printing).
  2. Serial manufacturing of your miniatures (resin copies).
  3. Packing, shipping and taxes costs.

Thank you beforehand for your support!
We’d like to thank particularly to all campaign collaborators and all those who have shared our links or send us funny comments.

RN Estudio - 3D print, cast and production of copies.
Hungry Troll - Customized bases.
Forja y Desván - Promotion and raffles.

Chessex - Customized dices.

We expect to be able to deliver the product by November 2015. Thus, once the campaign is over, we’ll need 5 months to be able to send you your miniatures. In case of rewards such as painted or customized miniatures, delivery date may vary.
story_txt:
Hi everyone. We’re Laia and Ian, founders of Sukubus Studio.
 We’re delighted to show you the second miniatures range we’ve developed 
on 3D for our studio. Thanks to this platform we are glad to show you 
our creations and would like to know your thoughts on them. We hope you 
like them as much as we’ve enjoyed developing them.Valkyries Team is made up by a group of nordic female warriors. In it there are diverse kinds of Valkyries that represent the diverse roles in a Fantasy Football match. We’ve prepared several stretch goals that will add to the team as the campaign develops.The idea came to us when Sukubus Team campaign finished. The feedback from backers was amazing and thanks for their support, encourage us to continue producing Fantasy Football Teams. For this occasion we decided to do something different again, and continue to offer alternative quality miniatures. We would like to point out that miniatures of the Valkyries Team will be slightly higher than the Sukubus Team.Production will be made in high quality resin on a 32mm scale. We’re certain of the finishing of each miniature, as they will be made by our friends at RN Estudio, great professionals that have a lot of experience in this kind of campaigns.This counter is an exclusive gift for this campaign. Each backer will 
receive only one counter per package or one per each complete team in 
case that you order more than one.We want to offer the best quality for our backers. That's why we have managed to make the production of Valkyries Dices with Chessex. A great customized dices company that get the best results. Hungry Troll has made these awesome bases to complete the Valkyries

story:
History

Hey, everyone, I am Sergey Lipskiy. Fans of game console emulation know me as “Gonetz”, the main developer of “Glide64”, an open-source graphics plugin for N64 emulators. The Glide64 project was created in 2001 and was initially designed for exclusive use on 3dfx graphics hardware through its proprietary graphics API “Glide3X”, thus the plugin’s name. It was not until later when it got OpenGL support and became available to all PC users. I worked on that project for 10 years. The plugin became very popular thanks to its high compatibility and good support of high-resolution textures. I released the final official version in 2012, but thanks to its open-source nature the project is still not dead. It is included as main or secondary graphics plugin in distributions of many N64 emulators. Thus, if you are familiar with N64 emulation, you should know about Glide64’s capabilities.

The emulation level achieved by Glide64 is very high, but still far from complete. I could not push it forward due to primordial limitations of its architecture. In 2013 I started a new graphics plugin project. The goal of that experimental project is to convert Glide64 features using the power of modern OpenGL and to support features which were impossible to emulate before. The project has no intersection with Glide64 by source code, but it is not made from scratch either. Old open source OpenGL graphics plugin named “glN64” designed by developer with the nickname of “Orkin” was chosen as the basis for my new project. I named the project “GLideN64” to underline its origin and to emphasize the spiritual link with my previous project. Please visit my blog http://gliden64.blogspot.ru/ dedicated to the project. Here you will find technical details as well as screenshots and videos made with this new plugin.

The GLideN64 project started as a hobby. I spent my free time on it and achieved results unreachable with other similar plugins. However, the project remains in alpha stage, unusable for end users. To bring it to the new level I need to spend much more time on it. I call you to support me and fund several months of full-time work on this project. The project aims to provide to the public free of charge the most advanced N64 graphics plugin, with the full source code available under GPL. This is purely a non-commercial, non-profit project. This crowdfunding will just allow me to spend the time to finish it.

Working prototype

GLideN64 is currently compatible with all emulators which support Zilmar’s plugins specification, that is present in all top N64 emulators. GLideN64 is also compatible with Mupen64Plus 2.0, which has its own plugin specification. Supported OSes are: MS Windows 7-8, Linux 32 and 64 bit. System requirements are: graphics card with support of OpenGL 4.2 or better. GLideN64 is also being ported to the Android OS, however the Android version is less functional. System requirements for Android: OS version 4.0 or above, OpenGL ES 2.0 support, fast CPU. The demo video shows desktop version of the plugin in action.

Visual examples

As I said, the plugin is in alpha stage and is inappropriate for public release. In this section I will show you some high-res screenshots, so you will be able to estimate its potential.

“Mario Tennis”. A lot of frame buffer effects are used here, e.g. dynamic shadows for all characters, score board, ball’s trace etc.

“Mario Tennis”. Beautiful replay with motion blur effect.

“Beetle Adventure Racing!” Slide film effect.

“Beetle Adventure Racing!”. Depth buffer based fog implemented using capabilities of modern hardware. Environmental reflection on the car: frame buffer effect.

“The Legend of Zelda, Majora's Mask” Correct emulation of Lens Of Truth, with snowflakes not cut outside the lens. Frame buffer and depth buffer emulation.

“Perfect Dark”. Frame buffer effect: CamSpy.

“Extreme-G”. Complex depth compare mode emulated.

“Banjo-Tooie” Frame buffer effects: dynamic shadow, reflection in the bubble.

Plan for Project Completion

If you love emulation you know how that an ideal graphics plugin must be:

  • Stable

  • Fast

  • Support all games

  • Provide perfect picture

  • Have little-to-none settings

  • Free to use

The goal is to bring GLideN64 as close to ideal as possible. I see the project ready for public release if the following conditions are met:

  • It works as stable as the emulators which use it

  • It has no performance problems

  • It has a functional and easy-to-use user interface

  • It has a compatibility level similar to the top N64 Graphics plugins

  • It supports texture enhancement mechanisms, like SAE

  • It supports load of high-resolution textures

  • It supports Windows and Linux

  • Plugin’s unique features are well polished

  • Source code is clean, free and open-source, licensed under the GPL

All of this needs to be implemented. Due to my experience in graphics plugins development I can quite precisely estimate the amount of time necessary to fulfill the requirements listed above. Three months of full-time (8-10 hours/day) work is the bare minimum.

The basic time-line for this process:

October 2014:

  • Fix stability issues

  • Implement missing functionality to achieve compatibility equivalent to Glide64. glN64 was released 10 years ago and even then it was not the most compatible plugin. Lots of work here.


November 2014:

  • Add texture enhancement and hi-res texture load.

  • I plan to rewrite the GlideHQ submodule from the Glide64 project to add OpenGL texture formats.

  • Lots of work need to be done in the plugin to support all the features of GlideHQ.

December 2014:

  • Portable user interface

  • Support for game specific profiles

  • Establish a bug-list

  • Rearrange support forum

  • Bug fixes

  • Writing docs


January 2015:

  • Establish a GitHub repository for the source code.

  • Go live!


Everything mentioned above can be accomplished if necessary fund is collected. What if more is collected? In this case I will be able to continue the project with full efforts:

  • If 8,000 USD are collected I will be able to complete the Android port. The current Android build works quite slow and has many glitches which desktop builds have not. Android debugging is a tedious process, plus some investment in Android devices with different graphics chips may be necessary.

  • 10,000+ USD will allow me to spend time on experimental and user-demanded features like port to Apple Mac OS X, advanced Anti-aliasing, widescreen hack, rendering in native resolution and other nice features which I never had enough time to implement.


Risks & Challenges

Of course, there is always the possibility for snags with any creative project. Things can go wrong, take longer to complete than expected, etc. But I promise that even if I get out of schedule and funds run out before I complete everything I planned the plugin will be released in functional state, because I will focus on the critical for release features first. The project will be released with sources and I will continue to work on it as on my favorite hobby. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, additional donations may prolong the period of rapid development.

story:
At last! Say hello to an absolutely beautiful illustration made exclusively for Pawtergeist. Not only will it be featured front and center in the game, it's available as an exclusive wallpaper to all contributors!

The original is 2048 x 1536 which, as you might know, is the resolution of retina display iPads. It looks incredible.

A massive thanks to Sundance for this special piece.

http://chillysundance.deviantart.com/

Trailer 2 is LIVE! It's a little bit different from our first trailer, but I think you'll like it. If you want to see pure gameplay, check out our first trailer HERE!

Android from the Start!

We heard you loud and clear! I know this has been holding a lot of great people from pledging, so let's break down the wall. If we hit our initial goal, Pawtergeist will come to Android shortly after its iOS release.

In addition, contributors current and new will get a promo code for both platforms on release. Nifty!

Make it happen. Get us to our initial goal, pledge now, and break stuff with your friends regardless of your favorite smartphone. Let's do this!

 

Ah, straight to the point!

 

A Full Game. 

I believe in making games that do not milk the money from player's pockets. I want this to be a polished, complete experience that can be enjoyed without having to shell out for the other half of the game.

With your help, we can give you an amazing game from the first time you launch it, not twenty dollars down the road. Give what you can and we'll do the rest. 

 

Bills and Dues.

I've paid for every penny of development out of my own pocket thus far, but I cannot in good conscience continue without paying my coders and artists, most of which have been dutifully volunteering their time to the game. 

Read our profiles below. We have solid talent on our team, but we need help to make this happen. 

 

And if you can't donate...

Just the same, if you can't contribute financially, word of mouth never hurts. Tell your friends, family, coworkers, neighbor, or strangers on the street  about us! Just avoid the scary ones. Check out our FREE BONUS WALLPAPER, too! 

 

Breakdown:

We will also be using your funds for the following if we meet our intial goal:

  • An additional level.
  • Additional animations for Pawl.
  • A beautiful 2D GUI. 
  • A fully illustrated title screen. 
  • QA testing across a wide range of Apple's latest devices.
  • Web development fees.
  • Coffee. Black. 

 

iOS and Android to start, with support for iPhone 4 and Up, iPad 2 and Up, iPod Touch 4th Gen and Up, and iPad Mini. We're also aiming for select Android devices, namely ones with gyroscopes to take advantage of our control scheme.

 

If we meet one or more of our funding goals, we plan to expand to a variety of other devices! You can make it happen, we'll do all we can. 

 

I'm Peter, one of four founders of JambleBerry LLC. This is our debut game. We believe in making things a little out of the ordinary. Here's the rest of the team in their own words!

 

Joshua

Coming from a small town in Arizona, he got his start making maps almost 10 years ago and went on to make the 'ever popular' arena_watchtower for TF2. He now spends his days making models for jerks.

 

David 

When David was four, he asked his mother how to make video games. She told him he needed to learn how to program, so he asked how to program. She told him he needed to learn how to read first. Hailing from the mysterious lands of New Jersey, David currently lives in Redmond, Washington.

 

Franco

Franco is a nonfictional member of the team that contributes where he can in hopes of escaping the roofie cycle that is corporate IT. Having already been fortunate enough to escape Florida without ending up on Fark, he’s wandered his way into Houston, Texas, where he has been stranded for over two years.



 

A 360° gyroscopic arcade shooter for iOS and Android that has the player defending their house from a ghost cat by whipping their prized possessions at his face.

 

 

Meter (1)

The player has to fill a constantly decreasing meter to prevent Pawl from possessing your house. When you push the meter over the top by throwing things and combining various potions, you level up, combos are worth more, and Pawl becomes a whole lot more of a handful! Good luck, you'll need it! 

 

Grabbing (2)


Tapping a prop will place it in the player's left or right hand. Tapping the corresponding part of the screen will send that prop flying.  Tapping them both at once can have... interesting effects. (see: EXPLOSIVE POTIONS!) 

 

Delicious Flavor Text (3) 

Whenever a prop breaks, it leaves a small message to the player in memorium, often in the form of a terrible pun. Check out our tiers for the option to grab your own personalized flavor text. We'll have a lot more props in the final game as well. 

 

Affectionately named ‘Pawl’ for short, he’s the ectoplasm hairball here to haunt you. He leaves interdimensional hairballs on the carpet. He leaves rifts in the furniture. And if you don't get rid of him, he'll possess your stuff quicker than a bad foreclosure.

 

GAME FEATURES

 

Extremely dangerous, highly explosive potions that you promised to clean up but never did. Especially the ones teetering dangerously close to the edge of tables. Picking up two of a like color has a combo effect.

 

Red + Red = Set Pawl ablaze!

Causes damage continuously in addition to props for five seconds. 

 

Yellow + Yellow = 2X Damage!

Props count for double for the next five seconds! 

 

Blue + Blue = Slow Motion!

Makes you feel awake, makes Pawl feel max pain, slows the entire world down for five seconds. 

 

We're working on a few more combinations and possibly a fourth color, stay tuned! 

 

 

Using your device's gyroscope, your screen becomes a window into the game environment. Utilizing the iPhone and iPad to the fullest, Pawtergeist’s controls are entirely gyroscopically driven, with options to increase or decrease sensitivity for the best possible experience. Yes, you can play while sitting down! You won't even have to fight for the arm rest. 

 

 

Oh yes, there's hats!

Pawl will wear a random item each time the game is played. Some are there from the beginning, some are unlocked. All are fashionable.

 

Click HERE for full size!

 

---

Credits:

Music - KUBBI w/ permission

iPhone Templates - Pixelbin

http://jambleberry.com

---

[Facebook] [Twitter] [Tumblr] [Email]
