story:
Zhelter is about surviving a Zombie apocalypse, saving survivors, building shelter. How long do you think you can stay alive in this nightmare?

 

Welcome to Zombie Apocalypse

 

Thanks to all backers for 350% funds!

We'll do our best for over your expectation. 

Once again, thanks to all backers.

 

 

 

 

 

By unknown causes, the Zombie apocalypse has arrived. They’ve burned cities, and you’ve lost your family, friends.

But, you've been saved by a group – people who have accepted you as a new family member. The world is now filled with these furious Zombie creatures, but your new family is saving people without losing hope.

 

 

After the end of world, you built a new civilization and society with these people. It’s not the same as before, but eventually you adapt to a new life with them.

But not for long.

A large scale Zombie horde crushes your shelter. You fight, but it’s not enough.

 

 

You’re alone once again.

Do you think you can still find new hope?

Do you think you can still fight, this time alone, against an endless Zombie horde?

 

 

The core of Zhelter is 'Intense survival', 'Huge action', 'Shelter', 'Open-world'. You explore ruined cities, fight back Zombies, build your own shelter.

 

It’s not easy staying alive in a city of Zombies. Gather resources for survival from within the ruins 

 

24-hours and weather systems

  • Experience beautifully changing day-cycle and a variety of weather.

24hr system

 

Weather system

 

Living in the city with these furious creatures, filled with hatred, is not easy.

  • Gather/loot various resources from the ruined city to live for another day.

Item looting

 

Various type of items

 

Crafts

  • You can craft items using collected resources for  many useful purposes

Item crafting

 

Item recipe

 

How long can you  run and hide. You can shoot these twisted, abominated creatures. Of course,  you might not always have enough bullets.

 

Intense action

  • Pull the trigger, experience the coolest action

Shooting to Zombies

 

Various weapons

  • Weapons are ready for you

Weapon list

 

Various Zombies

  • Many different types of Zombies are ready to (re)die

Ready to Die!

 

Overwhelming Boss

  • Defeat those beyond your knowledge who possess overwhelming hatred. And get a special reward.

Big, Strong and Unique

 

Two, or three survivors joining forces are better than one. Save other survivors hiding in cities and build a shelter with them. Strong shelters and more companions will increase your chance to survive.

 

Companions & Shelter

  • Save other survivors in danger and make them companions. Companions will contribute to making a stronger shelter
  • Make your shelter more efficient for convenience and to be stronger and attractive.

Shelter and Companions

 

Farm

  • If you tire of combat, explore. Or set up a farm. You need lots time and effort, but you'll be reasonably rewarded

Growing plants

 

Each gameplay will be unique - explore open-world. Try many different ways. It is not the strong one survive, survivor is only the strong.

 

 

We're using very experimental pixel-art graphics to present a unique style. We're also trying as much as we can to make this a unique and charming experience for the player.

Realtime shadow

 

Building structure

 

Concept sketch

 

 

Creative sound designer Syadeu is directing our project. As a sound designer, he’s participated in many projects, including 'Trick Art Dungeon', 'Battle Sorcerer.' And now he preparing high-quality sound effects and an original soundtracks for project Zhelter.

 

Listen to the first soundtrack. Focus to the lights by Syadeu

 You can check out more of his work at Instagram, or Soundcloud

 

 

We are small game studio, whose motto is "Make unforgettable game"

Our previous game 'Trick Art Dungeon' was nominated for awards in several festivals and contests.   

 

Trick art dungeon

 

While we don’t have a large crew or budget, but we do have the ability to produce a creative and remarkable in-game experience. We want to present all that in this project - Zhelter.

 

 

Zhelter was started March 2019.

The first step was to build a prototype, proving the basics of the game style and art style. The prototype was greatly and positively received at a recent game festival, with actual players very excited about this project. That was motivation enough to continue developing this project. However, we need more time and resources for the 1.0 build stage. We need your help.  

 

2019 G-Star

 

 

 

 

You can meet Zhelter at Steam Early Access first. 

We are currently focused to running smoothly on Windows. We're a small team. We want to fully focus on Windows(Steam), instead of multiple platforms at once and being unfocused.

 

 

 

Steam Early Access enables you to sell a game on Steam while it is still being developed and provides context to customers that a product should be considered "unfinished." Early Access is a place for games that are in a playable alpha or beta state, are worth the current value of the playable build, and that you plan to continue to develop for release.

Releasing a game in Early Access helps set context for prospective customers and provides them with information about your plans and goals before a "final" release.

 

 

For those of you who do decide to support our project, it would means a lot to us. We want to thank you with these rewards.

 

 

 

* Design patches, stickers, and Zippo lighter designs will be released soon.

* The design of merchandise rewards has not been finalized yet. Please note that it is subject to be changed. 

 

  • March 2020: Beta release (*It was postponed to May 1 because of the corona virus. We`re really sorry)
  • June 2020: Steam Early Access Release & Begin Shipping Rewards (*It was postponed to September because of the game polish. We`re really sorry)
  • June 2021: Steam 1.0 Release

Beta access will be available to all supporters (privately). We will send “Zhelter” Steam Key and Digital Soundtracks to your email when releases on Steam Early Access (September 2020). Digital Rewards can be claimed only once per one person. Physical Rewards will begin shipping September 1, 2020 (GMT +9). Inside the “Zombie Kit”, “Companion Kit” and “Conqueror Kit” there will be Design Tickets and everyone will be able to closely communicate with our development team.

Why Indiegogo?

This project was developed using our own funding and labor only. Since the start of development for "Zhelter", the more time and effort we put in, the more we are deeply fascinated by this game. For our entire team, this project became an obsession! We believe our hard work has been rewarded as the basis for an amazing game is now set.

However, development costs went way over the budget we initially created. We had secured some loans to keep development going. It is very important to us that we make the game we originally set out to build, without compromising on content or quality for the purposes of saving money. At this point, we have exhausted our loan funding and need some help to keep going…that’s where Indiegogo comes in!

Please help us to keep going by supporting our campaign. You'll soon get an absolutely unforgettable game!

If we can succeed with our Indiegogo fund raising goal, we will be able to utilize ALL of our creative resources fully on “Zhelter” going forward. Through Indiegogo, we want to get the word out on “Zhelter” in the gaming community and secure the funding needed to see it through. We are very confident that this game will be something that will wow the gaming community and provide hours upon hours of fun for all of our backers!

 

A. Team Salary

  • During these final development stages, we want to use the funds to focus our team on “Zhelter” completely. This will ensure the best game we can make and an expedited final development process.

B. Rewards and Shipping

  • We want to make the highest quality product we can. We aren’t interested in making some toy or half-hearted effort. This is our passion and we want to deliver the rewards you deserve!

C. Localization

  • “Zhelter” will support 6 languages at first launch. We plan to outsource localization to ensure the highest quality possible. (English, Deutsch, Français, 한국어, 日本語, 中文（简体/繁體）

 

You can check on our current development using these social networks 

e-mail : g1playground2018@gmail.com

Questions are always welcome!

This project is being promoted by KicksGoGo, an online advertising and campaign management agency specializing in crowdfunding campaigns.

 

Thanks for viewing our Kickstarter campaign. It doesn’t matter if you decide not to back us, we are very grateful for your interest and for taking the time to check us out!

Sharing our project with your friends, family and social network would be huge for us; truly, thank you for taking the time to check out “Zhelter”!
story_txt:
Zhelter is about surviving a Zombie apocalypse, saving survivors, building shelter. How long do you think you can stay alive in this nightmare? Welcome to Zombie Apocalypse Thanks to all backers for 350% funds!We'll do our best for over your expectation. Once again, thanks to all backers.     By unknown causes, the Zombie apocalypse has arrived. They’ve burned cities, and you’ve lost your family, friends.But, you've been saved by a group – people who have accepted you as a new family member. The world is now filled with these furious Zombie creatures, but your new family is saving people without losing hope.  After the end of world, you built a new civilization and society with these people. It’s not the same as before, but eventually you adapt to a new life with them.But not for long.A large scale Zombie horde crushes your shelter. You fight, but it’s not enough.  You’re alone once again.Do you think you can still find new hope?Do you think you can still fight, this time alone, against an endless Zombie horde?  The core of Zhelter is 'Intense survival', 'Huge action', 'Shelter', 'Open-world'. You explore ruined cities, fight back Zombies, build your own shelter. It’s not easy staying alive in a city of Zombies. story:
Imagine you living in a RPG world. Fighting Trolls while you are going to work, trading a Fire Sword with your friend from the gym. Improving your weapon with a Dwarf Blacksmith, or buying new items with a strange merchant in front of your house. Now it is possible, welcome to Dungeon Fellowship. 

Dungeon Fellowship is an RPG location based mobile game where your location will be used to take you into a totally new world. Inspired by many famous RPGs, we brought a huge amount features into this game. In Dungeon Fellowship, you can: 

  • Choose your race: Orc, Human, Dwarf, Forest Elf, High Elf, Dark Elf and Draconid(Extra Goal).
  • Fight lots of Monsters.
  • Use a War Horn to attract monsters to you.
  • Enter in Dungeons and Crypts.
  • Fight other players in Arena.
  • Trade items with your Friends.
  • Create and Airship Guild(Extra Goal).
  • Conquer Airships in a Guild War(Extra Goal).
  • Have hundreds of items and Equipments.
  • Improve your items and craft with a Dwarf Blacksmith.
  • Buy items with Merchants. 
  • Have Mounts and Skins.
  • Manage your inventory and create builds using the Skill Tree.
  • And much more.

Barrel, the Dwarf, is a tough guy that can make great improvements on your items, transform your waste equipments into materials and create amazing new items.

Merkur, the merchant, might look strange at first glance, but who knows what he might be offering...

You can update the NPCs to unlock new functionalities.

If you are luck you can find a Crypt or a Dungeon. Dungeons provide many monsters in the same place. You can smash those monsters to go deep inside the dungeon, where treasures are waiting for you. 

 

In Dungeon Fellowship you can play with different races: Dwarves, Humans, Orcs, Elves(Forest, High and Dark), Draconids(Fire Immunity).

Each race provides different attributes and bonus. For example, Dwarf has very good health points but not so much Agility and an additional bonus: +15% Magic Resistance and +15% Blacksmith discount.

If you contribute with this crowdfunding, you can change the race for 3 months FREE.

A huge number of Monsters are invading the world, improve your items, call your friends and fight them!

Some monsters come in a form of Elite. Elite monsters are way more challenging, you will need more players to Raid them and their loots are amazing!

In the Dungeon Fellowship world, there are hundreds of items, divided in 6 rarities. Celestial items are almost impossible to find, but are extremely powerful. If you're lucky, maybe you can find a Celestial item or buy it from a friend.

That is your chance to support us and get your Celestial item!! Check it in our PERKS.

 

That is your chance to unlock the mounts: War Wolf, Horse or Dragon.

A mount increases your range of action and improves your strength:

  • War Wolf: +10% All attributes, +10% Magic. Increase your range.
  • Horse: +10% All attributes, +10% Magic. Increase your range.
  • Dragon: +20% All attributes, +15% Magic Increase your range.

 

Dungeon Fellowship you can fight other players in our Arena. League tiers are waiting for you:

Leather, Wood, Bronze, Silver, Gold and Diamond. Moreover, we are planing an Ambush(Extra Goal) system. Since Dungeon Fellowship has a multi-class system, to have a success in the arena you will need to create a build with a good synergy with your items and strategy.

 

You asked and we did it. In Dungeon Fellowship you can sell or buy items from your friends or even give a hand to our newcomers at no cost. Relics were created for the most strong heroes. Pretty hard to find or craft, Relics does not use spaces in your inventory, they are unique and tied with your char.

 

Dungeon Fellowship is currently in alpha testing with about 1000 active players. We want to continue working hard, improving and releasing new features.

Community feedbacks are very important do decide the next steps of Dungeon Fellowship

$4500: Party System with 5 friends.

$5000: Guild and Guild War.

$5500: Ambush and steal other players near to you.

$6000: Item slots and gems.

$6500 and Others: LOCKED

Crowdfunding Campaign: From May 22nd to July 22nd.

Delivery Rewards(Loots): July 24nd.

Delivery Mounts and Skins: July 30th.

Pre-release iOS: August 15th.

Marcos Agostta: Founder and Developer (https://www.linkedin.com/in/marcos-agostta/)

Felipe Amorim: Illustrator/Concept (https://www.behance.net/felipeamorimilustra)

Bruno Belvedere: Developer (https://www.linkedin.com/in/bruno-henrique-belv...)

story:
May 2017 Update: Pelgrane Press has picked up #Feminism and is publishing a second edition, PLUS a PDF of six excellent new games. You can pre-order here: Pre-order from Pelgrane here: http://hashtagfeminism.games

Update: Here's an unformatted preview of one of the games in the collection: Restrictions by Frida Karlsson Lindgren and Sofia Stenler. You can download it here: https://www.dropbox.com/s/jfzqb73olok0q2m/Restrictions_Final.docx?dl=0

Julia Ellingboe also wrote an great essay about her experiences writing her entry, You've Come a Long Way, Baby here: http://leavingmundania.com/2015/12/29/julia-ellingboe-on-youve-come-a-long-way-baby/

Update: Our "News Stand" pickup options now include GeekGirlCon and Camp Nerdly (VA), in addition to Solmukohta, Fastaval, Big Bad Con, Gen Con, Origins, DEXCON, and Living Games Austin! If you live in London, you can also select this option if you're willing to visit a pickup spot at one of our contributor's offices in Central London.

Update: Stretch goals!

If we reach 5500 we will upgrade the photography and print more copies, some of which will be donated to academics and underserved gaming communities.

If we reach 7000 we can upgrade the paper and afford to reward our writers, copy editors, and editors with something special. They’ve been doing everything out of the kindness of their hearts, and we’d like to thank them more properly.

Welcome to #Feminism, an anthology of 30+ feminist nano-games produced by a collective of feminists from 10 countries. 

There are so many feminist games to write, and so little time. This collection is our solution to the problem--we're writing them shorter, sweeter, and sometimes funnier than we'd be able to if we wrote longer games. 

We're running this campaign to help us pay for the cost of printing the book and shipping it to various gaming conventions around the world. If we're able to exceed our financial goals, we will improve the print quality. And if we REALLY exceed them, we will use surplus funds to help some of our participants travel to conventions.

What's a nanogame?

For our purposes, a nanogame is an analog roleplaying game that lasts less than an hour. Our games are for 3 to 5 players, and are playable with simple tools like paper, pens, paperclips, timers, or other things you can find in the bottom of your bag. 

All of the games deal with contemporary feminist issues important to our participants.

What sort of games can I find in the collection?

We've got 33 games written by participants from about ten countries. 

Agata Świstak/Poland/Flirt

"Flirt" is an attempt to deconstruct the game almost everyone is playing - game of hook-ups, crushes and scoring!

Ann Eriksen/Denmark/Tropes vs. Women

Explore well-known movie clichés and tropes about women in a fun and not to serious way.

Anna Westerling/Sweden/Willful Disregard

A love story.

Cathriona Tobin/Ireland/First Joyful Mystery

Players examine the impact Ireland's prohibitive abortion laws have on people who find themselves pregnant.

Dominika Kováčová/UK/Stripped

A game about stripping off the stigma.

Elin Nilsen/Norway/6016

In 6016 the only historical source of the 21st century is a collection of clips from the soap opera "Love, lust and lack of trust."

Elsa Helin/Sweden/My Sister, Malala

A game about freedom of thoughts and ideas for girls in Pakistan.

Emily Care Boss/US/Ma, Can I Help You with That?

A game about family, age and the gendered nature of care-giving.

Evan Torner/US/Something to Drink with That, Sir?

A woman flight attendant performs emotional labor to serve three different male passengers.

Frederik Berg, Rebecka Eriksson, and Tobias Wrigstad/Sweden/Flesh

A physical game about the objectification of women or how women’s bodies are butchered into parts.

Jason Morningstar/US/Shoutdown to Launch

In this game about gendered interruption, a bunch of engineers need to fix a problem with a rocket engine in the dwindling time before launch. It won't go well.

Julia Ellingboe/US/You’ve Come a Long Way, Baby

A game about gender, cultural, and ethnic representation in the movies. 

Kaisa Kangas/Finland/Lipstick

Sofia is hesitating about whether to wear lipstick for a TV debate on feminism.

Kaisa Kangas/Finland/President

The war-waging Akhaian empire has elected its first female president, a very successful lady general, and feminists with conflicting agendas are trying to draft a press statement together.

Kajsa Greger/Sweden/Three Games About the Body

Dances with Vulvas: A silly warm-up game about the taboos around women's anatomy.

Dying for a Cup of Coffee: A playful scene about the terror of being deprived of coffee at your workplace.

Just Put Some Salt on It: A story about what happens when you put period stains on your mother in law’s white sofa.

Karin Edman/Sweden/Spin the Goddesses

A kissing game of lesbian witches.

Kat Jones/US/Glitzy Nails

Glitzy Nails is a freeform scenario about intersectional feminism, interactions between women, and nail salons.

Katrin Førde/Norway/First Date

A game about a date gone wrong and a rant about the orgasm gap.

Kira Magrann/US/Selfie

An intimate game about feelings in images.

Laura Simpson/US/Driving to the Reunion

An intergenerational game about four Black women trying to understand each other, as they drive back for college reunion.

Leïla Teteau-Surel and Baptiste Cazes with Laura Guedes/France/Family Planning Clinic

A game about women’s health where players will play short scenes from the daily life of a French family planning clinic (inspired by real stories).

Livia von Sucro/Brazil/GIRL: A Game for Boys

A small exercise about empathy, designed for cis gendered men to take a glimpse of what it feels like to be a victim of violence against women.

Lizzie Stark/US/Manic Pixie Dream Girl Commandos

A military unit undertakes its last whimsical mission before retiring to civilian life.

Moyra Turkington/Canada/Tour of Duty

A freeform nano-scenario about the what it’s like to serve and defend as a woman in the US Military. ﻿

Muriel Algayres/France/A Friend in Need

A nano-game about street harassment, victim-blaming and friendship. After a bad encounter on the street, can Ella get over victim-blaming with the help of her friends?

Rowan Cota/US/Her Last Tweet

A microgame exploring being a potential victim of a campus shooting event.

Sarah Bowman/US/Curtain Call

A larp about the experiences of a woman in the music industry over the course of four decades.

Siri Sandquist/Sweden/The Grey Zone

A larp about the grey zone between rape and consensual sex in a relationship.

Sofia Stenler and Frida Karlsson Lindgren/Sweden/Restrictions

A non-verbal game on how we are and aren't allowed to move together, as two genders.

Susanne Vejdemo/Sweden/So Mom I Made This Sex Tape

Different generations of feminists argue it out about sex, porn, and what the main point of feminism really is.

Tora de Boer/Denmark/Catcalling

A catcalling situation feels different depending on whether bystanders support the target or the cat caller.

Who are the organizers?

The project managers are Anna Westerling, Misha Bushyager, and Lizzie Stark. Our designer is Shuo Meng. Our publisher is the Swedish nonprofit Fëa Livia. 

Lizzie Stark is the author of two nonfiction books, Pandora's DNA (Chicago Review Press, 2014), about the so-called "breast cancer genes," and Leaving Mundania (Chicago Review Press, 2012), about live action roleplay, or larp. She designs freeform games and blogs about larp on her community-supported blog LeavingMundania.com.

Previously, she served as an editor of the successful Indiegogo book project Larps from the Factory, a collection of 20+ Norwegian larpscripts, and has published a monograph Pocket Guide to American Freeform, about the emerging format. 

Misha Bushyager plays, runs, and writes games. She's a database analyst, mom of two, award-winning baker, and former Jeopardy! contestant. When not working, parenting, or gaming, she finds time to quilt, crochet, sew, design clothing, edit, craft, and code.

Anna Westerling is the main organizer of the Stockholm Scenario Festival, a convention of freeform games held in Sweden. She was the designer and producer of the larp A Nice Evening With the Family (2007). A member of the Vi åker jeep collective, she designs freeform games. She also produced the Diana-Jones award-winning Nordic Larp book, as well as Knutpunkt 2006 and Knutpunkt 2010.

Shuo Meng is an art director with over ten years of experience in print design, branding, marketing, illustration, and user experience design. She loves playing and playtesting roleplaying games, assembling tiny foods, and making terrible / wonderful puns.

Fëa Livia is a Swedish roleplaying nonprofit that published a larp magazine between 2000 and 2005, along with the Nordic Larp book.
story_txt: May 2017 Update: Pelgrane Press has picked up #Feminism and is publishing a second edition, PLUS a PDF of six excellent new games. You can pre-order here: Pre-order from Pelgrane here: http://hashtagfeminism.gamesUpdate: Here's an unformatted preview of one of the games in the collection: Restrictions by Frida Karlsson Lindgren and Sofia Stenler. You can download it here: https://www.dropbox.com/s/jfzqb73olok0q2m/Restrictions_Final.docx?dl=0Julia Ellingboe also wrote an great essay about her experiences writing her entry, You've Come a Long Way, Baby here: http://leavingmundania.com/2015/12/29/julia-ellingboe-on-youve-come-a-long-way-baby/Update: Our "News Stand" pickup options now include GeekGirlCon and Camp Nerdly (VA), in addition to Solmukohta, Fastaval, Big Bad Con, Gen Con, Origins, DEXCON, and Living Games Austin! If you live in London, you can also select this option if you're willing to visit a pickup spot at one of our contributor's offices in Central London.Update: Stretch goals!If we reach 5500 we will upgrade the photography and print more copies, some of which will be donated to academics and underserved gaming communities.If we reach 7000 we can upgrade the paper and afford to reward our writers, copy editors, and editors with something special. They’ve been doing everything out of the kindness of their hearts, and we’d like to thank them more properly.Welcome to #Feminism, an anthology of 30+ feminist nano-games produced by a collective of feminists from 10 countries. There are so many feminist games to write, and so little time. This collection is our solution to the problem--we're writing them shorter, sweeter, and sometimes funnier than we'd be able to if we wrote longer games. We're running this campaign to help us pay for the cost of printing the book and shipping it to various gaming conventions around the world. If we're able to exceed our financial goals, we will improve the print quality. And if we REALLY exceed them, we will use surplus funds to help some of our participants travel to conventions.What's a nanogame?For our purposes, a nanogame is an analog roleplaying game that lasts less than an hour. Our games are for 3 to 5 players, and are playable with simple tools like paper, pens, paperclips, timers, or other things you can find in the bottom of your bag. All of the games deal with contemporary feminist issues important to our participants.What sort of games can I find in the collection?We've got 33 games written by participants from about ten countries. Agata Świstak/Poland/Flirt"Flirt" is an attempt to deconstruct the game almost everyone is playing - game of hook-ups, crushes and scoring!Ann Eriksen/Denmark/Tropes vs. WomenExplore well-known movie clichés and tropes about women in a fun and not to serious way.Anna Westerling/Sweden/Willful DisregardA love story.Cathriona Tobin/Ireland/First Joyful MysteryPlayers examine the impact Ireland's prohibitive abortion laws have on people who find themselves pregnant.Dominika Kováčová/UK/StrippedA game about stripping off the stigma.Elin Nilsen/Norway/6016In 6016 the only historical source of the 21st century is a collection of clips from the soap opera "Love, lust and lack of trust."Elsa Helin/Sweden/My Sister, MalalaA game about freedom of thoughts and ideas for girls in Pakistan.Emily Care Boss/US/Ma, Can I Help You with That?A game about family, age and the gendered nature of care-giving.Evan Torner/US/Something to Drink with That, Sir?A woman flight attendant performs emotional labor to serve three different male passengers.Frederik Berg, Rebecka Eriksson, and Tobias Wrigstad/Sweden/FleshA physical game about the objectification of women or how women’s bodies are butchered into parts.Jason Morningstar/US/Shoutdown to LaunchIn this game about gendered interruption, a bunch of engineers need to fix a problem with a rocket engine in the dwindling time before launch. It won't go well.Julia Ellingboe/US/You’ve Come a Long Way, BabyA game about gender, cultural, and ethnic representation in the movies. Kaisa Kangas/Finland/LipstickSofia is hesitating about whether to wear lipstick for a TV debate on feminism.Kaisa Kangas/Finland/PresidentThe war-waging Akhaian empire has elected its first female president, a very successful lady general, and feminists with conflicting agendas are trying to draft a press statement together.Kajsa Greger/Sweden/Three Games About the BodyDances with Vulvas: A silly warm-up game about the taboos around women's anatomy.Dying for a Cup of Coffee: A playful scene about the terror of being deprived of coffee at your workplace.Just Put Some Salt on It: A story about what happens when you put period stains on your mother in law’s white sofa.Karin Edman/Sweden/Spin the GoddessesA kissing game of lesbian witches.Kat Jones/US/Glitzy NailsGlitzy Nails is a freeform scenario about intersectional feminism, interactions between women, and nail salons.Katrin Førde/Norway/First DateA game about a date gone wrong and a rant about the orgasm gap.Kira Magrann/US/SelfieAn intimate game about feelings in images.Laura Simpson/US/Driving to the ReunionAn intergenerational game about four Black women trying to understand each other, as they drive back for college reunion.Leïla Teteau-Surel and Baptiste Cazes with Laura Guedes/France/Family Planning ClinicA game about women’s health where players will play short scenes from the daily life of a French family planning clinic (inspired by real stories).Livia von Sucro/Brazil/GIRL: A Game for BoysA small exercise about empathy, designed for cis gendered men to take a glimpse of what it feels like to be a victim of violence against women.Lizzie Stark/US/Manic Pixie Dream Girl CommandosA military unit undertakes its last whimsical mission before retiring to civilian life.Moyra Turkington/Canada/Tour of DutyA freeform nano-scenario about the what it’s like to serve and defend as a woman in the US Military. ﻿Muriel Algayres/France/A Friend in NeedA nano-game about street harassment, victim-blaming and friendship. After a bad encounter on the street, can Ella get over victim-blaming with the help of her friends?Rowan Cota/US/Her Last TweetA microgame exploring being a potential victim of a campus shooting event.Sarah Bowman/US/Curtain CallA larp about the experiences of a woman in the music industry over the course of four decades.Siri Sandquist/Sweden/The Grey ZoneA larp about the grey zone between rape and consensual sex in a relationship.Sofia Stenler and Frida Karlsson Lindgren/Sweden/RestrictionsA non-verbal game on how we are and aren't allowed to move together, as two genders.Susanne Vejdemo/Sweden/So Mom I Made This Sex TapeDifferent generations of feminists argue it out about sex, porn, and what the main point of feminism really is.Tora de Boer/Denmark/CatcallingA catcalling situation feels different depending on whether bystanders support the target or the cat caller.Who are the organizers?The project managers are Anna Westerling, Misha Bushyager, and Lizzie Stark. She's a database analyst, mom of two, award-winning baker, and former Jeopardy! contestant. When not working, parenting, or gaming, she finds time to quilt, crochet, sew, design clothing, edit, craft, and code.Anna Westerling is the main organizer of the Stockholm Scenario Festival, a convention of freeform games held in Sweden. She was the designer and producer of the larp A Nice Evening With the Family (2007). A member of the Vi åker jeep collective, she designs freeform games. She also produced the Diana-Jones award-winning Nordic Larp book, as well as Knutpunkt 2006 and Knutpunkt 2010.Shuo Meng is an art director with over ten years of experience in print design, branding, marketing, illustration, and user experience design. story:
"When you die, you normally have only one simple wish - to return and tell them - "Hey, guys - it's OK! No need to feel sad! Cause you know what? It's actually OK on both sides, really." But returning is not easy - the only way would be dreams - "half-dreams" - "ghost-dreams". The problematic part is if you get stuck - you turn into a demon. Hard to say what exactly it is, but we presume it's a painful and useless existence. Better to avoid doing this, really.

My personal "problematic part" is that I am already stuck here. No idea how I'll get out this time..."


On his journey to the "Other Side" Reader (and his "natural companion" Writer) meets various Ghosts and Demons, Holy Spirits and Gods. He also meets Singer, who is neither Ghost, nor Demon. At some point she becomes important to Reader. Realizing this won't stop him though.

The world of Ghostdream should be scary, but it is not - it is just dark. The story should be sad since all the characters are more or less dead, but it is not, because they normally remember nothing, except some minor detail or two (for example the protagonist remembers himself reading a book - this is why they call him Reader. It is his only memory after all).

Ghostdream is a retro-style Point and Click Adventure game with puzzles, exploration and story.



Features/Stats

  • 55+ entirely animated locations (rooms)
  • 14+ characters
  • 7 Major Puzzles (more or less Myst style: no items required, exploration of the whole accessible area is a must) + standard adventure actions (like get here, talk there, press this, press that...)
  • 10+ Optional Secrets
  • 16 000+ words story
  • 20 songs OST
  • It’s hard to calculate how long an adventure game can last, but I believe it will take about 10 hours to beat Ghostdream for the first time (not including the already mentioned optional secrets here).
  • PC Windows exclusively.
  • Ultimately digital.

Ghostdream Demo 02 Download

Full Version Release date: 2016



General Situation/State Of The Project

At the moment more than 50% of the whole game is done and eventually it will be finished in one way or the other. Naturally with some financial help it will become slightly bigger, slightly better, with slightly more extra content. My problem is – I’m broke. I have no idea how to get money remaining an artist and I have no idea how to remain an artist doing something else. I won't deny though - I am a horrible businessman. My relationship with money is always full of drama and suspense.

Honestly, I don’t believe in the success of this campaign – making a game is one thing, promoting a campaign for the said game is a completely different thing I have no time for. But my strategy is “try everything that is legal”. Not like I have a lot of choice here. Yes, it would be awesome to have a successfully crowd-funded project on IGG – I would be able to concentrate on the game entirely. But I believe I’m mentally prepared for any result.

I’m quite brilliant regardless of anything. I just need some money to maintain the brilliance.


You can see a lot of screenshots in the gallery above. If there will be any interest at all I may add more stuff in the updates. Here you can see some additional concept arts:

Reader meets Singer in an outer space between Ghost World and the Other Side...


Organ Grinder's head. "Red mass" signifies she's a demon.


Perfect umbrella. Concept Art for the "Other Side".

(UP: When I was trying to upload this picture with my update 2 IndieGoGo has deformed it once again making it unreasonably smaller, so I re-upload it here. Surprisingly it looks normal on the main page.

(Reader's friend - Writer. He believes he's the protagonist and Reader is his "sidekick".

(The villain - Actor, Each time he appears he wears different masks - first two masks are quite normal as you can see... the rest - not as much...

(If Reader would have a "love interest" it would be Singer, but since the concept of love is laughably pointless for a ghost they simply talk once in a while...


I wanted to put some nicely looking little players here from SoundCloud, but IndieGoGo doesn't allow me to do this. So here's the link to my page on SoundCloud: Soundcloud.


You can get the game. You can get the book. You can get the standard extras (OST, Wallpapers, Avatars). All - ultimately digital.

If you absolutely need it I can make a T-Shirt for you, but it will definitely be cheaper (and faster) to make one yourself using the high resolution extras you can get. If you want tokens, figurines or some other wasted plastic I can give you several links to clearly superior campaigns with all the neat stuff mentioned.

You can also help me design some optional scenes for the game – almost anything can work in one way or another (except the unpleasant stuff that can offend some people (racism, sexism, nationalism, etc…)). I’ll explain it better to you personally, if there will be… you.


Art, Music, Story, AGS Coding – Myself.

Acting – if I won’t find a better alternative: Myself


If you are interested in my biography, I wasn’t always a game designer. I’ve started as an artist, drawing and painting. Naturally, as a kid I thought all I need is to get my paintings to some gallery and that would make me popular and awesome. When I was older I found out you need BIG money to do so – the kind of money young artist could never get even if he would sell both of his kidneys. At the same time I was playing guitar attempting to compose my own music – naturally I always had problems with the sound quality (still have) and I still don’t have the money to get my music to professional studio. Music and art were always the most important parts of my life, but I was also trying countless other things (mostly art-related). At some point I’ve started to work on my animated film, but back then I couldn’t afford a good computer and eventually my project was killed by the epic slow-downs of my old machine. I realized it would be a good idea to switch to video games back then – I wouldn’t need such a big resolution and all the animations are small and very short. I still had slow-downs, but it was bearable. Eventually, I realized video games is where I want to be. I can talk about video games as an art form for hours, but to sum it up I believe if video games isn’t an ultimate art form already it will surely be born from it in the future.

Risks & Challenges

Significantly more than 50% of the game is done, I have no questions to myself at the moment. I don't think there is anything that can harm my progress, except the natural disasters nobody can control. If that will happen - see the news for more detailed info on my situation.

Other Ways You Can Help

As a multimedia artist and solo developer I don't have that much time left to promote the game, or anything else in general... I'll just continue to work on the game following my normal schedule. I won't do a single thing for this campaign to become even remotely known (because as I said before I don't believe in its success myself). Believing is stressful - it never gave me anything except blues and pointless paranoia.

If this will ever work it will work because of you. You can help me spread the word on facebook or other social resources. I am quite anti-social myself – Facebook is very close to what I believe to be the perfect digital interpretation of hell. No way I’m going there myself.



Ask me some questions, please. There is literally nothing more depressing than an empty F.A.Q section.

story:
Intro
The throne lies empty and the clans are restless. As a powerful lord with lands, men and money at your disposal, now is the time for you to lay claim to the throne of Scotland. But, you are not alone. Your rivals have been waiting for just such an opportunity themselves and they are poised to act as well. With the clans of Scotland ready to follow the strongest leader, it is up to you to win the loyalty of the clans before any of your rivals. If you can demonstrate your prowess in battle to enough clans, then the rest will fall in line behind you. Do you have both the audacity and cunning that it takes to be king?

Pieces: 96 Cards
Time: 25-50min
Players: 2-5
Ages: 10+

Game Page at Evertide: http://evertidegames.blogspot.com/p/lords-of-sc...

Project
The design for Lords of Scotland is complete, but in order to move forward I need to bring in some artistic talent. I have a creative guy with years of experience in the game industry lined up, as well as a PoD shop. So, all I need to do now is find a way to pay for it. If I can raise the funds for the art and printing, then I’ll be able to bring the game to market. And that’s where you come in.

With your pledge, you’ll get a copy of the game, as well as the latest updates on its progress. But, more importantly, you’ll be helping me bring my game company to the next level.

Timeframe
Once the funding goal is reached, the game will take about 2 months to complete. During that time, I will update you on the project with sneak peaks of the art. You should receive your copy somewhere between a week or two after that. Your pledge includes shipping and handling costs to the U.S. So, if you live outside the continental US, please add $5 to your pledge.

My Company
Evertide Games is the company that I set up to represent my game designs. It is a game design studio made up of me, the designer and producer, as well as all the other people that I bring in on a project by project basis to make my games happen. So far, I’ve been lucky enough to see two of my games published: Straw by AEG and Court of the Medici by Z-Man Games. You can find either one online or your local game store right now! Woohoo! With Lords of Scotland, I want to move one step farther. I want to realize my vision of Evertide Games as truly independent game developer, fully funded and able to pay everyone involved market rates. With your help, I know that I can do that.

story:
The Interactive Bible Apps project is bringing engaging Bible content to the Apple and Android marketplaces.  We are creating interactive books, games and videos to be distributed around the world and in many languages.

INTERACTIVE BOOKS

We are contracting the best storytellers we can find so that our apps can serve small children who can't yet read.  These apps will have "read to me" capabilities so that no matter how young your child is, they will be able to begin experiencing the Bible. 

We want to create interactive experiences that help children understand the Bible and ultimately, fall in love with the God who wrote it.

 

GAMES

Interactivity on portable devices makes learning fun for "digital natives" who have grown up watching pixeled screens.  Apps have the ability to make detailed information interesting, turning the learning process into a video game.  

Interactive apps can creatively reinforce key concepts with better retention.

 

VIDEOS

 

TRANSLATIONS

We create our content so that we can quickly translate our productions into new languages.

This allows us to serve many around the world, giving them these amazing stories told in their own language!

 

GET A BIBLE, GIVE A BIBLE

Most people in developing nations don't have access to credit or the ability to buy products online. Our business model sells to those who have so we can give away for free to those who don't.  So with every Interactive Bible Apps purchase, you are helping give this content for free to those around the world who would not otherwise have access to it.

 

REPURPOSING CONTENT

We are also working with innovative Christian publishers to turn their graphic novels and comics into interactive apps and videos.

So we can go from this:

To this:

We hope to broaden the reach of these materials by repurposing them into a new media that young people love.

 

THANK YOU

Thanks for considering our project.  Please check out our perks to the right and help us put Interactive Bible Apps into the hands of children all over the world. 

The app animations used above are samples and are still a work in progress. These animations will be the visuals we use to explain our concepts to the programmers.  The actual animation when the app is released will likely differ slightly from these animations pictured.  We look forward to serving you, your family and millions around the world with Interactive Bible Apps!

story:
What is ARCHAIC SOULS?

"Archaic Souls is a dream studio, our canvas is phosphors and our paint is light."

We've been wanting to make video games for a long time, and now that the market is opened up, it is more than a possibility. It's a certainty! No more wondering if you're going to get picked up by a publisher, you can publish on your own, direct to consumer!

 

Who am I, and why can *I* make this happen?

I am a 34-year-old producer with experience in the gaming industry. Due to NDAs and things of that sort, I cannot discuss projects that I have worked on.

 

I just received my degree in Communications (TV/Film/PR/Marketing) with a minor in Global Business (entrepreneurship, the way money works, etc) from the University of Houston (go coogs!) I graduated with honors, taking 6 classes my last semester and getting a perfect 4.0 that same semester.

 

I am a guy who "gets things done" (singlehandedly, if need be).

I have already released an Xbox Live Indie Game called Punch THAT Face, completed within a month, and completely created (all graphics, all sounds, all programming) by me. Think of what can be done with a budget and a team!

I have built and repaired Arcade Machines for a living, from the ground up, board to monitor.

I have been running, updating, and building the Geeks And Dorks (.com) brand name for 5 1/2 years.

Now, under the moniker of Archaic Souls, I want to begin to produce low cost, high quality Indie titles ("indie" meaning independent and self-published games, not attached to a big name distribution house).

Why should you donate?

Being as indie as we are, that means we have no initial budget.

A studio like ours means we NEED support from a crowdfunding platform to get started! We have no means from Traditional Finance Houses, so it's up to the true Private Sector (you) to become the real job creators in this economy!

 

Since none of us live in California (I live in Houston, artists in Washington State, programmer and music/sound are in Texas), our expenditures are low. Without the bloated costs of running a big-name studio, the costs to produce this game only include those costs which keep this production talent alive!

With the initial funding goal, the team will consist of 2 1/2 people : 

  • Producer / Design Lead / Programmer - Jason Chase
  • Lead Artist / Character Designer / UI Design - Matt Thew
  • A second Programmer part-time - TBA

With our goal, we'll be able to put forth 2 & 1/2 full-time efforts on these projects, making the projects as professionally created as it gets! (instead of as much as we can do in our free time!)

If we extend beyond our goal, we'll be able to add more people to the team, making the games even greater with each milestone achieved!

With each extra $5k, we're able to add some really awesome features, and some most excellent people:

@ $15,000 : We get the 2nd programmer full time AND add a 2nd artist to the mix! Games improved 25%.

Great Apes Content Pack 1 (2 new characters, 20 new stages, 3 new backgrounds, and 2 new weapons) will be free! (estimated release : DEC, 2013)

Final Right Content Pack 1 (new weapons, armor, skills, and 2 new end-game areas) will be free! (estimated release : NOV, 2013)

@ $20,000 : We add a dedicated Sound / Music duo, enhancing the games by 50%!

Great Apes Content Pack 2 (3 more characters, 30 new stages, 5 new backgrounds, and 2 new weapons) will be free! (estimated release : APR, 2014)

Final Right Content Pack 2 (more weapons, armor, skills, and 2 more end-game areas) will be free! (estimated release : FEB, 2014)

@ $25,000 : We get to hire an out of work Graphic Designer to really make the games slick, taking a large load of work off our artists (as they won't have to retask themselves from game assets to UI work) thus improving the games by 100%, and EVERY donator gets a bonus signed Archaic Souls poster!

@ $30,000 : We go international! That's right, if we reach 30k in preorders, we're fully localizing Final Right for Japan! Full-on Japanese voiceacting and text, all of which will be selectable in the US version (same version of the game for both markets, just expanded! Everybody wins!)

 

 

 

 

What you get for just $10: 

  • A copy of the two games of your choice! ($6 value)
  • A cool box of swag! (Buttons, Stickers, Pencils!) ($3 value)
  • The satisfaction that you KNOW you helped employ people / create jobs in the current economy. Self Employment is the original American dream. (priceless)

Thats just the beginning. Check out all our other perks to the right ----->

You can even order a Limited Edition Final Right Arcade Edition which comes complete with a CUSTOM ARCADE CABINET! This cabinet is 100% JAMMA compatible, which means you can pick up most older arcade boards, plug it right in, and have YOUR CHOICE of ARCADE game, right in your own home, NO EMULATION, the REAL thing! 

A gamer's dream!

So, we're here, direct-to-consumer looking for PREORDERS to fund this amazing company we're starting out of our garage. Some of the biggest companies started in a garage or room (Microsoft, Apple, ENCOM :P )

We are looking to make games BY gamers FOR gamers. Help us become one of the forefront studios that helps change the gaming industry as the movie industry changed -- from large, giant studios to smaller production houses in association with a lot of other small production houses.

One more reason to care :

There is a large pool of 25 - 40 year old talent who, for many reasons (children, bad luck, wrong city), are out there working min-wage jobs living paycheck to paycheck... or even unemployed due to cutbacks... who have the chops to make it professionally. There just is no money out there for "has-beens" or "wannabees". Traditional Private Sector financing is a joke, as it rewards guarantees and success rather than ambitions.

These guys have all the talent, but haven't been able to get that break. This is their break, and YOU can help me help them!

Each game we release is a stepping stone to the next game. We aren't planning anything too ambitious to start, yet are making things that are going to be fun and enjoyable! Games don't have to be huge epics. If you get about 5 hours out of a $1-$3 dollar item, that's about right!

These first games mainly will allow us to get some releases under our belt, and begin to mesh together as a team!

We have a slew of games, all interesting and humourous, just waiting to be made. We have selected a from a wide variety of other titles to bring you these 5, chosen because they showcase different features and reach different markets. These titles will be released in the order you see below.

We want the company to have a portfolio of works, not hedge all bets on one title! Plus, if you actually look at what Great Apes proposes, it's pretty much "as good as it gets" for iOS. Final Right has a lot of ambition in it, because it will play and look like something you've always wanted to play.

GAMES SOON TO BE AVAILABLE : 

DUNGEON / NETWORK 2-pack           XBOX/WEB

DARK SLAYER                                 XBOX

DINO RAMPAGE                              XBOX

FINAL RIGHT                                   ARCADE/PC/XBOX

GREAT APES                                  iOS/WINDOWS PHONE/FACEBOOK APP

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

DUNGEON/NETWORK 2-pack

How will you die? Did a lizard slurp on your entrails? Did the Dragon sneeze, and fuse your riches to your bones? Did you fall in the pit with the sign next to it saying "Danger, Pit!?"

The dungeon is a precarious place. Watch your self at all times.

Network! You know your circuits like you built them yourselves, and you practically did! Now, it's time to become friendly with a few other systems. How will you handle the power?

 

DARK SLAYER

Somewhere, sometime, some town is in peril. Whenever this happens, a hero will arise to the occasion. This hero is you.

Battle through 5 areas, and fight over 20 monsters! When you think it's over, think again! Scaleable difficulties and persistent characters means that you'll power up to fight the harder fights, rooting out the darkest of evils in the process. 

 

DINO RAMPAGE

"It's a Dino Rampage!"

It's the cretateous period, and you're out for a light snack. But wouldn't you know it, those pesky aliens are back... and they're not just here for a visit! Battle through 9 stages alone or with a friend, and take this planet back!

You'll never guess the ending!

 

 

GREAT APES

 

 

Great Apes is (effectively) the spiritual successor to Angry Birds. It will fill the hole the Angry Birds has left in peoples daily lives, and that is the NEED TO FLING THINGS!

 

 

In Great Apes, the player plays one of 8 Great Apes. Each ape has their own personality, their own character. The apes will be able to throw different types of weapons, to hit successively more difficult targets.

Through 50 stages, you will fling bananas, grapes, strawberries, coconuts, and an assortment of other throwable objects at targets and at opponents. Bonus stages and upgrades will be available to the player progressively.

The game also has a few multiplayer modes. You can throw a banana at a friend, and start a feud. Like Artillery or even Gorillas.bas, Great Apes will be a widespread success!

"A banana has been thrown at you. Click to see where it lands."

These sorts of notifications make up the core of Great Apes online component. Turn based (like old email games) gameplay is available, as players take turns thowing bananas at each other. Maps are generated randomly, and a number of options are selectable by the person initiating the game.

GREAT APES! Coming Fall 2013 to iOS, Windows Phone and FACEBOOK!

FINAL RIGHT

 

Final Right can best be described as a 2 player co-op arcade sidescroller with RPG elements. Persistent characters allow the player to upgrade, collect, and progress at their own pace.

 

 

Final Right also incorporates elements of modern gaming (random loot, repeatable dungeon instances with scalable difficulties), and integrates a third button to the standard 2 button action-arcade controls.

This third button adds a Switch Equipment capability to the already familiar Attack and Jump functions. In Final Right, players will be able to have 3 sets of equipment they will be able to actively switch in game, at any time.

The game also introduces a kind of super meter to the genre, which is filled by damaging enemies. Once the meter is filled, and all 3 buttons are pressed, FINAL RIGHT mode is engaged. During FINAL RIGHT mode, the player can perform moves normally unavailable. Once engaged, the FINAL RIGHT meter ticks down, slowly. Once empty, the player returns to normal and the meter can be filled again.

By chaining together combos while in FINAL RIGHT mode, and switching weapon sets during combos, the player is able to customize their play style any way they choose.

Individual armor pieces and each weapon found will have extended capabilities, which will have various effects such as the helmet adding to the players speed (20% during FINAL RIGHT), or the left gauntlet increasing drop chances (+5% gold or rare drop at all times).

Harkening back to the days of Cadash (Taito), with some elements of Diablo (Blizzard), Final Right will keep you playing!

We are scheduling our release Mid-July, 2013. The game will be available for download on your Xbox (with an internet connection), or for Arcade and PC.

SPREAD THE WORD!

Even if you're not sold on these games, or even the company, please let others know. If you don't play games, but if you have nephew who has an Xbox (and an internet connection) or an uncle who has always wanted their own arcade cabinet, let them know!

Video games make great presents! $10 is almost as low as they get!

Help us get the word out, and get people excited. Like us on Facebook, share us on Twitter! Help make Archaic Souls as brutally awesome as it possibly can be!

story:
You take control of one of six factions in the criminal underworld. The aim of the game is to take down the other criminal organiztions while also defending your own and running businesses on the side to make money. This is a tower defense/money management game where each decision you make has a consequence. This game is known for its unique take on rules. Besides the basic instructions on how to play the game, every choice you make is up to you. You make work together with other players to take down an opponent, or act as a lone wolf. You may trade cards with other players and make deals such as truces. Any deal made though may be broken and players can be backstabed and betrayed, as is the life of a criminal. You can play dirty, or you can play clean. In the end though you must do whatever it takes to survive and become the last criminal organization standing.

So here is the breakdown of what the money will be used on.

  1. The images used on the cards are from a fantastic website www.shutterstock.com. I don't yet have the rights to display these images on my cards. In order to attain these rights it will cost me $250. I will then be able to sell this board game online.

  2. The next thing the money will be going towards is the perks. As you donate money you will be given perks, such as an exclusive T-Shirt or the board game itself. These things cost money so in order to make sure I have enough money to license the images I need to take perk costs into account.

  3. The indiegogo fee. Whether I make my goal or not indiegogo takes a percentage of the money I make to keep the website running. The fee falls between 4% and 9% of the money I make.

  4. Any extra money that I gain from this campaign I will put towards the development of the first expansion deck for this game. The deck will feature new offense and defense cards. It will also go towards the marketing of my board game so more people can hear about it.

There are eight different perk levels:

Perk One/$5 (Soldier) - A donation in this amount would be greatly appreciated and would immensely help the production to this game. 

Perk Two/$10 (Lieutenant) - The last page of the instructional booklet will be dedicated to those who have funded this project. This donation amount will get your name featured on the Funded By page.

Perk Three/$15 (Capo) - Get your name on the Funded By page. Also send in a picture of yourself to be featured next to your name on the Funded By page, that way no one can doubt that it is you that contributed to the creation of this game. Of course if you would rather have no picture just let me know.

Perk Four/$25 (Consiglieri) - Get your name on the Funded By page. Place a picture of yourself beside your name and for this donation amount I will place your twitter handle below your name that way anyone who purchases the game may also follow you. Again your picture and twitter handle don't have to be included.

Perk Five/$50 (Underboss) - Get your name on the Funded By page. Place a picture of yourself beside your name. Get your twitter handle beneath your name and get a criminal underworld poker deck. A full 54 card deck including jokers.

Perk Six/$75 (Boss) - Get your name on the Funded By page. Place a picture of yourself beside your name. Get your twitter handle beneath your name. Get a Criminal Underworld poker deck. At this donation point you finally get the game itself to play with your friends. Get the Criminal Underworld board game.

Perk Seven/$100 (Crime Lord) - Get your name on the Funded By page. Place a picture of yourself beside your name. Get your twitter handle beneath your name. Get a Criminal Underworld poker deck. Get the Criminal Underworld board game. You also get an exclusive Crime Lord T-Shirt that is available nowhere else other than this indiegogo campaign.

Perk Eight/$200 (FBI Agent) - Get your name on the Funded By page. Place a picture of yourself beside your name. Get your twitter handle beneath your name. Get a Criminal Underworld poker deck. Get Crime Lord t-shirt. Get the limited Gold Edition of the Criminal Underworld board game. The box, card box, and back of playing cards all have a new gold design. Also get the first expansion deck available for the game featuring new offense and defense cards.

     So I like to consider myself an entrepreneur or jack of all trades. Everything that I find myself needing to do I try to learn on my own. Whether software like Photoshop or Final Cut Pro I try my best. The same goes for every project I undertake. I have written a novella, made numerous short videos along with a web-series that went for two seasons, ran a website, and have now designed a board game (something I have wanted to do for years now). I love exploring my capabilities of what can be done and hope this is just the beginning in a very successful life. Whether I make it as a film maker, board game creator, or teacher (the degree I am getting in college) I know I will be happy and still carry on doing the thing I love most... pushing myself.

 

     This game is my first ever board game and something I am very proud of. Everything in this game was designed by me and I was fortunate enough to find a company willing to manufacture the game for me. So with your help this game can officially be released online and available for purchase. The best way to describe this game is a mix between Monopoly and Risk. If you aren't familiar with either of those titles then picture this game as a money management/tower defense board game. You control a criminal organization; one of six. For example there is the Italian Mafia, American Motorcycle Club, and a Japanese Crime Syndicate. Your objective is to take down the other players and be the last criminal organization standing. You do this by playing defense cards to guard your headquarters and offense cards to attack the headquarters of other players. There are also currency and item cards which you use to obtain money. Money is important because it is needed to play any offense or defense cards. There are also Business and Service cards. Business cards generate money each round for you but also need defense cards to remain safe. Service cards provide special abilities for the players and cost a large amount of money. Abilities such as playing two extra cards in a turn or repairing your headquarters or a business. You can even make another player lose a turn. It is a simple game that allows you to play however you'd like. Making for a unique experience everytime you play. Make truces with others players or act as a lone wolf. Whatever gets you to the end.

     Not everyone has the money to help fund this campaign. That is alright because you can still help me in a big way. If you can spread the word about this campaign or even share the link with others that would be great. The more attention this campaign gets the better. Even if you decide to do nothing I appreciate you taking the time to look into it and am happy you came this far. Thank you in advance for anything you can do.
story_txt:
You take control of one of six factions in the criminal underworld. The aim of the game is to take down the other criminal organiztions while also defending your own and running businesses on the side to make money. This is a tower defense/money management game where each decision you make has a consequence. This game is known for its unique take on rules. Besides the basic instructions on how to play the game, every choice you make is up to you. You make work together with other players to take down an opponent, or act as a lone wolf. You may trade cards with other players and make deals such as truces. Any deal made though may be broken and players can be backstabed and betrayed, as is the life of a criminal. You can play dirty, or you can play clean. In the end though you must do whatever it takes to survive and become the last criminal organization standing.



So here is the breakdown of what the money will be used on.


The images used on the cards are from a fantastic website www.shutterstock.com. I don't yet have the rights to display these images on my cards. In order to attain these rights it will cost me $250. I will then be able to sell this board game online.


The next thing the money will be going towards is the perks. As you donate money you will be given perks, such as an exclusive T-Shirt or the board game itself. These things cost money so in order to make sure I have enough money to license the images I need to take perk costs into account.


The indiegogo fee. Whether I make my goal or not indiegogo takes a percentage of the money I make to keep the website running. The fee falls between 4% and 9% of the money I make.


Any extra money that I gain from this campaign I will put towards the development of the first expansion deck for this game. The deck will feature new offense and defense cards. It will also go towards the marketing of my board game so more people can hear about it.





There are eight different perk levels:
Perk One/$5 (Soldier) - A donation in this amount would be greatly appreciated and would immensely help the production to this game. 

Perk Two/$10 (Lieutenant) - The last page of the instructional booklet will be dedicated to those who have funded this project. This donation amount will get your name featured on the Funded By page.

Perk Three/$15 (Capo) - Get your name on the Funded By page. Also send in a picture of yourself to be featured next to your name on the Funded By page, that way no one can doubt that it is you that contributed to the creation of this game. Of course if you would rather have no picture just let me know.

Perk Four/$25 (Consiglieri) - Get your name on the Funded By page. Place a picture of yourself beside your name and for this donation amount I will place your twitter handle below your name that way anyone who purchases the game may also follow you. Again your picture and twitter handle don't have to be included.

Perk Five/$50 (Underboss) - Get your name on the Funded By page. Place a picture of yourself beside your name. Get your twitter handle beneath your name and get a criminal underworld poker deck. A full 54 card deck including jokers.

Perk Six/$75 (Boss) - Get your name on the Funded By page. Place a picture of yourself beside your name. Get your twitter handle beneath your name. Get a Criminal Underworld poker deck. At this donation point you finally get the game itself to play with your friends. Get the Criminal Underworld board game.

Perk Seven/$100 (Crime Lord) - Get your name on the Funded By page. Place a picture of yourself beside your name. Get your twitter handle beneath your name. Get a Criminal Underworld poker deck. Get the Criminal Underworld board game. You also get an exclusive Crime Lord T-Shirt that is available nowhere else other than this indiegogo campaign.

Perk Eight/$200 (FBI Agent) - Get your name on the Funded By page. Place a picture of yourself beside your name. Get your twitter handle beneath your name. Get a Criminal Underworld poker deck. Get Crime Lord t-shirt. Get the limited Gold Edition of the Criminal Underworld board game. The box, card box, and back of playing cards all have a new gold design. Also get the first expansion deck available for the game featuring new offense and defense cards.




     So I like to consider myself an entrepreneur or jack of all trades. Everything that I find myself needing to do I try to learn on my own. Money is important because it is needed to play any offense or defense cards. There are also Business and Service cards. Business cards generate money each round for you but also need defense cards to remain safe. Service cards provide special abilities for the players and cost a large amount of money.      Not everyone has the money to help fund this campaign. That is alright because you can still help me in a big way. If you can spread the word about this campaign or even share the link with others that would be great. The more attention this campaign gets the better. Even if you decide to do nothing I appreciate you taking the time to look into it and am happy you came this far. Thank you in advance for anything you can do.

story:
click to support us on Steam!

 

We are a group of gaming enthusiasts, focusing on developing 2D games. We work in a studio in the city of Kraków, Poland. 

We are the first Polish company to have release launch title (and this was A-Men for PS Vita). During last 12 months, we have cooperated with:

 

We seek your support to publish our game with no necessity to involve 3rd parties – we did put a lot of effort and resources to get the job done and we would like to publish the game on our own.

 

We do also run Steam Greenlight campaign - give us an UpVote!

 

As some of you may know, we have already released A-Men for PS3 (published by Namco Bandai) and PS Vita. Reviewed by many, our game received
90% by Konzolista
84% by GamingXP
85% by PSX-sense
83% by ShopToNews

A-Men was designed as a tribute to the classics, so it should be available for the most hardcore PC gamers, right? Hence our efforts to release the game in this format.


Ok, but what is it all about?

3minutes of gameplay available here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=NRTt0mEm4Sg

The game requires you to plan your strategy in ever-changing environment (as you play, you gain new skills, new objects appear in the game). We applied "inmap saves" system - you will not have to got through whole level from the beginning, if you fail. 

A-MEN unfolds at A-Corp, the world's biggest producer of the robot soldiers known as A-Droids. It's where we meet A-MEN's heroes, following a massive explosion at the factory which accidentally releases hundreds of lethal A-Droids. These wayward troopers must be rounded up before they cause chaos around the globe.

In chasing down the A-Droids and thwarting their traps, A-MEN presents you with a series of complex puzzles. Turn the mechanical army's devious tactics back onto them and pick your enemies off one by one. 

See what you have at your disposal to complete the mission:


Have a look at some PS3 gameplay screens:

 

What we wanted to accomplish is classic gaming experience.

Simple, yet funny, graphics + necessity to use logic = pure fun!

 

 Thank you! 

We would like to thank all of you for your support!

We understand that sometimes it’s not so easy to find couple of dollars to spend on someone else’s dream – if you still would like to help, you can! Follow the link to our Steam GREENLIGHT profile and give us a thumb up!
  

If you have any questions, opinions you would like to share, or you have an idea how we could make our game better, don’t hesitate and contact us: a-men@blooberteam.com

 

TERRITORIAL RESTRICTIONS: Please note that inhabitants of Poland, Germany, Austria and Switzerland will receive ALL perks BUT game itself, as we already have publishers for this countries and they own exclusive distribution rights!
