story:
Bauwerk - 1st Edition

My name is Yoda. Read more about me below. The game BAUWERK is a strategic building board-game I created and produced some time ago in a limited edition of 150 pieces, and it's already sold out. The only drawback in the first edition was, that it was quite tiny-sized. The game-board was on the back-side of the box and it measured only around 6" by 8". Due to it's popularity, I want to create an improved 2nd edition now. Read here what the game is about ...

Bauwerk - The game

Bauwerk is a two-player strategic-building game. It features a game-board with two different colors of territory for the two players. Goal is to connect all your plots with each other, by building a path that leads from one field to the others. You do this by placing blocks and connecting the blocks with sticks. Actually you are building bridges. The point is, the more blocks a bridge has, the higher score it counts. And, a direct connection counts more than an indicrect, i.e. one that has branches in it. Also, you can place the blocks in three ways:

Flat, sideways or upright, thus creating three levels of height for building the bridges. The higher the level, the higher the score. And you gain extra-score for creating bridges over others and paths under others. The scoring-system is very cleverly made and it creates a lot of challenge in placing the blocks and bridges, while trying to score as many points as possibe. Did I mention that, the more territory you have already built on, the less material you get for the next building-round?

Bauwerk - 2nd Edition

I want to make a second edition of this great game, with a nice and big game-board sized 16" x 12", really beautiful playing-material and an attractive professional box and instruction-booklet. Since I'm creating games since more than 20 years, I know exactly what is needed and how to do it. The first edition of the game already proved it's quality and fun gameplay, so the second edition will be even better with the bigger size and professional packaging. My plan is to re-design the full game, with a theme like San Francisco Bay or Roman Aquaeduct, the actual theme has to be decided for and a professional graphics-artist will be hired to design the game-board and box-art when the funding-goal is reached.

The Goal

The money will be used for design-work, ordering the game-parts, producing the game-boards and the boxes. It goes into the final game, that you will recieve as your perk. Here's what will happen exactly and what you will get:

When the first goal is reached, the second edition can be produced in the desired quality - wooden playing material, a big gameboard and a professionally made game-box together with a full-color instruction-booklet in German and English. Each supporter will get his perks, which includes the copies of the final game. You will have a lot of fun with that!

The Perks

Perk #1 - Surprise-Postcard & Code (5.- EUR)

We will print surprise-postcards with designs from the game and send them to you by snail-mail. Worldwide shipping is already included. On the postcard, there will be a scratch-field that reveals a discount-code for ordering games on the Yodagames-website. With this code, you may order the finished BAUWERK game after release for a discounted price, or you may even order other games. The discount will be valid for any games you like.

Perk #2 - Website-Memorial (10.- EUR)

You will get the postcard as explained above, plus we will put your name in the list of supporters on the website of the game.

Perk #3 - Soundtrack CD (20.- EUR)

You will get a full CD of Brainwater's Techno Tracks, including a full-length version of the one in the Bauwerk-video. All these tracks are personally made by me, Yoda. Worldwide shipping included.

Perk #4 - Super Earlybird (35.- EUR)

You will get the complete boxed game for a super-reduced price! It already includes shipping to Germany, but you can simply add EUR 8 for international shipping. This is available to the first 10 supporters only, so you better be quick. If you miss this, you can still get #4.

Perk #5 - Earlybird (40.- EUR)

In case you missed the Super Earlybird, you can still get this one. You also will get the full game for a still reduced price. Also, shipping within Germany included. Add EUR 8 for international shipping. Also the complete boxed full game! Limited to 10 supporters.

Perk #6 - The Game (49.- EUR)

This is the complete game, including shipping withing Germany. Add EUR 8 for international shipping. No limit here, treat yourself with this super-fun game!

Perk #7 - Double Fun (95.- EUR)

I'm sure you have a friend, partner or family-member who would also enjoy this great game! This is your chance. Get two complete games and save money. Shipping within Germany included. Add 14 EUR for international shipping.

Perk #8 - Pack of Five (230.- EUR)

Get five of the games and save money. Perfect for small resellers or if you have a lot of great friends. Shipping within Germany included, add 30 EUR for international shipping.

Perk #9 - Reseller Pack (400.- EUR)

Are you a reseller? Own a games-shop or games-website? This is your perk! Get 10 of the games for a reduced-price. Shipping within Germany included, add 50 EUR for international shipping.

Perk #10 - Mega Pack (700.- EUR)

Big resellers should consider this option - 20 of the games for an even-more discounted price. Shipping within Germany included, add 100 EUR for international shipping.

Perk #11 - Game Sponsoring Fame (1,500.- EUR)

You will be mentioned as a main-sponsor in the instruction-booklet of the game, together with your photo if you want. Also, we will send you the full range of all available Yodagames, that's at least 15 different great games for you and your family to enjoy! This of course includes the new Bauwerk-game. Worldwide shipping included! Only available to the first five sponsors!

Perk #12 - You're the hero! (3,000.- EUR)

All of the above Game-Sponsoring-Fame perk, plus you will be invited to my booth at the 2013 international games-fair in Essen. In the evening after the fair, we will have a private party with dinner and nightlife in Essen. The date for this will be October 24th, 25th or 26th. One night in a hotel in Essen is included. Airfare is not included, please book your own flight.

Stretch-Goal #1: 9000.- Euros

When this first stretch-goal is reached, every supperter who gets the final game will get a cool bonus: The game "Pillz". This is a strategic card-game for two players. You place cards with parts of pills on it and try to build two-colored pills to score points. Also a tested and proven game that is already selling on the market. You will get a special edition of this game as a free bonus when the first stretch-goal is reached!

Stretch-Goal #2: 13,500.- Euros.

When this stretch-goal is reached, it's getting really interesting: Each supporter who gets the full game will, additionally to the bonus-game "Pillz", get a third game: "Picnic Panic". This is an action-cardgame where you have to defend your picnic against nasty attacking insects. You need fast reaction and quick reflexes to survive this!

Risks

Since I am a professional game-designer and have already produced 15 board-games, the whole project-planning is very reliable and safe. No risk on this side. However, the only challenge that can occur is if the funding goal is not fully reached, it will become very difficult to order the wooden game-parts in a smaller quantity, so only in that case we have to be flexible in terms of the game-theme and final material. But I will find a way, because I'm determined and dedicated enough, so no need to worry.

About Yoda

First, yes, Yoda really my name is. Sometimes talk like this I have to, expect it people do. But most times I'm speaking normally. I started as a computer-game-programmer in the 80's on an Atari 400 computer. Many years of creating video games later, I started creating board-games. Until today I created 15 board-games, which you can read about on my website www.yodagames.de. There are videos of all games. If you're more into video-games, retro-style, then you can check-out my webpage www.yodasvideoarcade.com and play my new retro-style games.

I know that the final game will be quite high-priced, but believe me, the material I'm going for and fun you will have with it is absolutely worth it!

I hope you like this game, or at least the idea. Even if you don't support this game with cash, please share the link with your friends and tell them about the game, so it will be supported as much as possible. Thank you in advance I will!

 

Update #1

It looks like it's not exactly clear why this game is so interesting and fun to play. So I decided to upload the whole instructions (of the recent version) so you can understand it fully and see the tricky part: You have to build as much and as fast as possible in order to finish first and take the space before the other player takes it, but at the same time, the more you build, the less material you get in the next round, so you have to plan carefully where and how you build. And, of course it's tricky and needs good skill to place the roads on the blocks perfectly, otherwise you miss a lot of distance or get penalty if something is falling down. So here are the complete instructions, English and German:

If you're more into video-games, retro-style, then you can check-out my webpage www.yodasvideoarcade.com and play my new retro-style games.
I know that the final game will be quite high-priced, but believe me, the material I'm going for and fun you will have with it is absolutely worth it!
I hope you like this game, or at least the idea. Even if you don't support this game with cash, please share the link with your friends and tell them about the game, so it will be supported as much as possible. Thank you in advance I will!

 
Update #1
It looks like it's not exactly clear why this game is so interesting and fun to play. So I decided to upload the whole instructions (of the recent version) so you can understand it fully and see the tricky part: You have to build as much and as fast as possible in order to finish first and take the space before the other player takes it, but at the same time, the more you build, the less material you get in the next round, so you have to plan carefully where and how you build. And, of course it's tricky and needs good skill to place the roads on the blocks perfectly, otherwise you miss a lot of distance or get penalty if something is falling down. So here are the complete instructions, English and German:

story:
Short Summary

Hello, Klive Kraven and Sundermunk here representing Grizzly Gambit Gaming. We are a budding Trading Card Game company based in Maryland. We are currently working on creating and releasing our first set of cards for our first game we created "Monsters, Mayhem and Murderers". This campaign is very important to use because it was created out of our mutual interests. We both are huge horror fans and both of us are into TCG's. So we decided to create something that we could both build on and enjoy. Hence the birth of our company and first game. With the Help of you, the wonderful and adoring fans and public alike we can reach our goals which will help us finance our first run of cards and help us legitimize the company so we can legally press and distribute our products. We can't bring this to life without your help!! Get involved today!!

What We Need & What You Get

As a basic breakdown of where the funding will go, essentially we will be throwing the funds into: printing, materials, packaging as well as trademarking and copyrighting our brand/company and game. These are essential to our start up and will leave us in a spot where we can maintain and continue on to produce additional sets with ease. To entice our contributors a bit more we will be offering great one of a kind items as perks or incentives for your donation to our campaign. Some of these items include: Over sized promo cards, Signed cards, Sealed Starter kits and much, much more! Even if our ultimate goal isn't reached any and all donated funds will be put towards the project which will bring us one step closer to completion regardless of how much we raise here.

The Impact

The impact of your contribution is major, it can essentially make or break us. However, If you do decide to donate to our cause and help us bring our game alive you can take solace in knowing that you are assisting a rising company in a very competitive world and at the same time helping us achieve our dreams of seeing this game reach production and our company succeed. We are both long time players of TCG's so we know the in's and out's to make a strong playable and fun game, Help us bring this game into the real world with your help!!

Risks & Challenges

It will not be easy for us to get where we need to be. There is a ton of work to be done and lots of organizing to do. Despite the fact we have all major social media outlets covered (Facebook, Youtube, Twitter, Instagram, Ect...) and an official website with its own forums site. We still need the financial backing from our fans and believers for us to achieve such a task. It will also be a time consuming effort for us to fill out the countless pages of forms for trademarking and legalizing the company 100% for full scale production. We are prepared to meet these challenges head on though. We will do this by doing what we have been doing, Which is dedicating every minute of every day to creating something unique and fun. We are both determined and dedicated enough to see this through and bring the game along for many years with many sets to follow but we can't do it alone! Help us eliminate the risk and get involved with us.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone will be able to help out by donating funds, which is fine. However, there are other ways you can assist in this campaign. One of those is simply spreading the word. Repost links to this page on facebook and retweet them on twitter. Tell your friends and family about this especially if they are interested in Horror or Trading Card Games on any level. Additionally, you can use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word. Any and all help is greatly appreciated!! Let's make this a success!!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, all: This project will use the OGC Talented Guides from Rogue Genius Games to create a gallery of characters for use at your gaming table. Each character is presented from 1st to 20th level.

I'm putting this project together to provide aid to my disabled, single-parent sister and her son, who lost everything in a fire in June of this year, including their pets. This will help her pay bills and provide a Christmas for her teenaged son. It has pained me greatly that I haven't been in a position to help my sister financially, as I'm also struggling to make it as the only breadwinner in the household. I've been a game writer and editor for over a decade, though, so I'm turning to my skills to see if I can gain some help this way. I'd honestly love to be able to provide her a thousand or two from this project.

The following authors have volunteered contributions to this project: the Talented Guides author himself, Owen K.C. Stephens; RPG Superstars Mike Welham and Steven Helt; Rick Hershey of Fat Goblin Games; Mark Gedak of Purple Duck Games; artist and author Jacob Blackmon; Robert Hudson, Jr.; Andrew and Heleen Durston; Thilo Graf, Matt Stinson, Amanda Hamon, Carlos Ovalle, Tracy Hurley, and myself. More to possibly come!

Art will be by Rick Hershey and Jacob Blackmon.

What We Need & What You Get

Money is what is needed. These have been some rough times, and I'm reaching out with the skills I have to gain some assistance for my sister. Gamers have said they wanted a Rogue's Gallery, if you will, of the Talented classes, so I'm hoping this project interests you enough to support the cause.

 

  • This fundraiser goes to my sister and her son, to help them pay some bills and have a small Christmas. I'd love to be able to get her way more than I'm asking for here! The insurance settlement only helped her so much after the fire--and they took forever to pay! 
  • The remainder goes to IGG fees.
  • Regardless as to whether I reach the final goal, the money raised will go to my sister, thus the flexible spending option. The pdf gets produced for those who contribute at that level. Print options are made available through DriveThruRPG.com.

 

The Impact

The impact is that you will help a struggling family get through the end of the year, and you will get a cool gaming product by the end of April 2014 in the process. It's a win-win.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know everyone is dealing with some tough times right now, so I very much understand that you may not be able to assist monetarily. But you can help spread the word! I would very much appreciate some help in this regard. Please make some noise by forwarding the link and spreading the word on your social media.

story:
This is who we are!

The NerdQ launched January 1st this year to create a brand that covered independent video game development in the midwest. We are gamers just like yourself, and we want to cover the news of the independent video game culture. Our focus is niche because it is where we see the most value occurring—and it's through this we hope to provide the most value to listeners and developers alike. With this campaign we want to raise our base goal of $2000 for equipment and marketing.

For now our sights are set on the upper Midwest which will be our domain while we operate out of Fargo, ND, don't ya know. We aim to assist in ushering a golden era for independent video game development.

Along the way we hope to make key business partnerships that will help accent our unique flare for getting the job done. By beginning this movement, we're not only enriching the gaming industry, but also opening up different avenues to create value our in local economy; by only endorsing and generating business with local homegrown taste-makers.  

What We Need & What You Get

For this campaign to be successful, we will need at least $2000, all the funds will go to the purchase of radio equipment and production; such as microphones, soundboard, marketing materials, and merchandise.

Everyone who donates to the campaign, will receive some some form of merchandise—from unique pins to limited edition T-shirts. We will be working with local businesses in the Fargo Moorhead area to provide massive amounts of value through their services.

If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds we do raise will be put toward purchasing immediate needs from our list of equipment. Anything above our minimum amount, will go toward us getting studio space for us to operate out of.  

The Impact

Everyone who participates is being impactful because we are all taking a stance to give the little guy a voice and possibly someone in your own neighborhood. We are bringing new games to the forefront, because in the video game industry there hasn't been a renaissance in a long while. With this station we hope to bring about a new era in gaming, and while we are small everyone who helps spread the word—or even gives us their attention–is helping that movement grow.  

Risks & Challenges

Because we are intending to operate with a low overhead the risk is minimal. I have been podcasting for over 5 years with just a microphone and a computer. Through the connections I've made in this time I've been able to bring independent developers and gamers together. The goal of this campaign is to widen these horizons. I won't stop podcasting if this fails, and this won't deter me. I'm going to be famous!  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like The NerdQ, turn your support into action. Even if you can't give money to the campaign there are so many ways for you to help with support! You can spread the word, using the Indiegogo share tools, through all of your social media. You can even just show your support through liking our Facebook page, and just being apart of our community!

story:
Who is Oscar Celestini? 

                     


Oscar Celestini, an italian comic artist, work as illustrator and colorist since 2002 for many editors from all over the world, DC, Image, Zenescope, Arcana, Moonstone, Bonelli, Mondadori, Soleil, Le Lombard and private commissioners.

My second passion is for Videogames, i've worked on graphics and sprites for Iphone Apps and Android Videogames, Online mmorpg and many other little things.


What I need and what you'll get

Simple and fast, I need some money cause i spend hours and hours each day, fixing little things and adding contents, and mainly, to pay the software and cover part of the costs.
You'll have a complete PC game, lots of levels, nice graphics (i hope you'll like it) full storymode, special features, a fantastic artbook, awesome t-shirts based on the game, original sketches and maybe more if i'll have new ideas during the campaign.


The game 

Shot and destroy enemies! Try to survive from monsters, robots, mortal traps and everithing can kill you or stop your adventure.
The game is done in a retrogame style, inspired from great classics: Turrican, Megaman, Strider, Bubble Bobble...
You'll have some bonus to make it more funny, special weapons, missiles, speed-up, armors... If this is not enough, Syro, the hero of the game, is a beautiful sexy girl with a very small armor on her curves, what do you think about her?

The game is completed at about 80% and i'll complete it for January 2015, so you'll be able to play it for sure next year, middle-end of January.
Broken core is a PC game for Windows.

TRY THE PLAYABLE DEMO
http://www.oscarcelestini.com/LAVORO_IN_PROGRESS/BrokenCoreDEMO.zip


1$ Perk
A lot of projects here on IndieGOGO does'nt give nothing for 1 dollar, not me! Not here! With only 1 dollar you'll have the name in the credits at the end of Storymode and Survival mode. With only 1$ you'll become a part of this project without moving a finger, not bad at all!

2$ Perk
Minimal cost, good result! With only 2$ you'll have BROKEN CORE SV, that means you can play the full Storymode with no limitations, so, 2$ for a complete and playable game with monsters, traps, deadly robots and much more!

3$ Perk
Come on, with only 3$ (only 1more than the SV) you'll have BROKEN CORE FV, that means more levels and the Survival mode available. Survival mode is another kind of game where you must resist 12 hordes of enemies + a final boss. This version is for harder gamers, new levels are really hard to beat and Survival mode will make you happy (or sad if you'll not complete it eheh)

5$ Perk
You'll have BROKEN CORE FV (that means all thing up there) + a digital copy of the artbook and the original OST.
With only 5$ you'll have the full pack about my game.

Maybe i'll add some other perks in the next days, awesome things, but for now that's all my friends!

25$ Perk
Come on! With 25$ you'll have ALL the content of the SUPPORTER FULL and an ORIGINAL BROKEN CORE T-SHIRT!
You can choose between 3 different models: Classic, Vintage, Special, and 7 different colors!
All sizes available, just send a private message or e-mail with your choose and that's it!
For non-european supporters, please add 5$ cause shipping costs.

50$ Perk
With 50$ you'll have ALL the material in the 25perk + an original sketch by me, blue pencil + black pencil.
I'll do some of them and i'll add in the updates next days, you'll receive it randomly from them.
I'll draw them on paper 15x21cm, and i can add a few word for you if you'll like them, just send a pvt or e-mail oscar_celestini@hotmail.com



100$ Perk
With 100$ you'll have ALL the material in the 50perk + the fantastic Luxury Box, that includes:
1 USB pendribe (2Gb) with inside Broken core FV + Artbook + Ost and 6 fantastic cards, look at the pictures and tell me if it's not just AWESOME!


200$ Perk
With 200$ you'll have ALL the material in the 100perk + one and only Broken core mini figure, created by me, ONLY ONE copy in the world! A cute little piece of art that can stand on your desktop remembering to you that also one person can do good things if well motivated. I believe in this project and i think this is the last proof you needed to believe in me.


What else?
Not many other things to tell, i'll be very happy to complete my game and i'll be more than happy if you'll enjoy playing it! If i'll not be able to reach the goal, no matter, i'll try to improve my skills and provide better stuffs in the future, i'll never give up!

Some screenshots

story:
A Documentary About Gaming From a Unique Perspective

In the bowels of Northern New Jersey, a small independent radio station plays hosts to a variety of podcasters, including several stand-up comedians that run a comedy show on the same night that a bunch of gamers have their podcast role-playing night. Passing each other often in the halls of the studio, each clique would eye the other with suspicion and derision; unable to understand just what exactly each was up to. This documentary examines the results when these comedians are asked to sit down and play their very first role-playing game, live, on camera.

And what game did they play, you ask? Why, Fiasco, of course!

While much of the principle photography has already been shot, we're running this campaign to try to raise enough revenue to hire help/rent equipment to streamline the editing process, shoot b-roll, and go on tour to promote the film.

Gaming is still a misunderstood hobby, and we hope that Playing with Comedians will help shed some light in a fun, entertaining, and completely unexpected way!

What We Need & What You Get

The project needs funding if we're going to be able to get it out in time for film festivals, not to mention the actual production of a DVD. This will take a little bit of money, but we have some awesome perks for your help:

  • We're offering exclusive copies of the DVD for the finished film
  • We're offering custom playsets and editions of the Fiasco role-playing game that the comedians played in the film
  • We're asking our contributors to join us for some comedy shows AND game nights to celebrate the premiere! Yes, you too can play with comedians!

The Impact

Since the dawn of the hobby, rpgs have been misunderstood. Somehow, this form of entertainment is maligned and ridiculed - even by those who, bias aside, would have an awesome time trying it out!

With this film, we want to show gamers how they are viewed by the public, show non-gamers what gaming can really be like, and show everyone a different perspective of looking at their world. We hope you can help!

Other Ways You Can Help

Because they project is effectively trying to bridge two very different worlds together, we're having issues getting the word out to the right people that may want to support us. Please help get the word out about this incredibly worthy project! Tell your friends, bug your enemies!

We're offering exclusive copies of the DVD for the finished film
We're offering custom playsets and editions of the Fiasco role-playing game that the comedians played in the film
We're asking our contributors to join us for some comedy shows AND game nights to celebrate the premiere! Yes, you too can play with comedians!



The Impact
Since the dawn of the hobby, rpgs have been misunderstood. Somehow, this form of entertainment is maligned and ridiculed - even by those who, bias aside, would have an awesome time trying it out!
With this film, we want to show gamers how they are viewed by the public, show non-gamers what gaming can really be like, and show everyone a different perspective of looking at their world. We hope you can help!


Other Ways You Can Help
Because they project is effectively trying to bridge two very different worlds together, we're having issues getting the word out to the right people that may want to support us. Please help get the word out about this incredibly worthy project! Tell your friends, bug your enemies!

story:
Hi, here is the English version of our project. The french version is below...

Bonjour, pour accéder à la version francaise, cliquer ici FRANCAIS

On a strange, tiny planet, live primitive tribes. They are composed of chubby little creatures fighting for their survival. One of those are of particular interest to us.

The main character is Grom'k, a lonesome warrior destined to become the leader of his tribe which grows as he embarks on more adventures.

A confirmed bachelor, Grom'k will have to adapt to face new challenges, such as feed, defend and grow his tribe. Bel’ana, his future wife, never lets him forget his duties especially when he loses himself daydreaming. Over the course of his various missions  he will discover his destiny and find the ansers his most existential questions.

He will have to go through very varied worlds, from his initial hunting ground to much less reassuring landscapes. He will even uncover complex relations between the bright world of the living and the chilling world of shadows - one of the worlds he will have to find during his quest.


This is the story we’re going to tell you. But we’re not going to do it in the usual manner.  
Instead, we’re going to create a universe in which we will develop many games and media.

We’ve finished two games already :

- The first chapter of our platform game 'TribeQuest Green Valley’, which showcases Grom'k's adventures.

- The initial version of the first ‘mini game’ called ‘TribeQuest Red Killer’: a puzzle game containing 40 different levels so far.

We’re working with experienced art directors. They are also in charge of establishing the curriculum for ESIA3D school in Lyon. We are working with some of their students.  
Our wishe us to achieve the highest graphical quality in our games that we can possibly get.

The first phase of our projet is completed. We just launched a first version of ‘Green Valley’ and ‘Red Killer’ on MAC and PC.  
We are also launching our own online sales platform with our own distribution technology.

We are now starting the second phase. We’re fixing and enhancing the first chapter of ‘Green Valley’.
We’re finishing a first version of the second chapter and we’ve started the production of the third. 

We’re also going to make ‘Red killer’ better and bigger, and we’re developing a second ‘minigame’.

In our mind, TribeQuest is a huge project. You’ll be able to play with Grom'k but also a lot of other characters; you’ll get a ton of different gameplays and you’ll follow Grom'k in some incredibles adventures that will get him very, very far away from his starting point.

You’ll also get a lot of ‘side’ games that will extend the TribeQuest universe in many directions...

But for the moment, we start small and slow and we hope that this begining will please you enough to make you want to follow us in our journey.

IOZO GAMES :

IOZO was created in 2004, primarily to manage development of technologies linked to video games.

In 2009 IOZO started shifting its activity to focus primarily on the creation and development of video games. To get the means to properly distribute its productions, the owner of IOZO created an online distribution company, Play’n Buzz.

In 2010 IOZO collaborated with Philippe Louvet to launch the project ‘TribeQuest’.

Under the direction of Gilles Benois, former artistic director of Eden Studios and current Director of Studies at Esia 3D, the project Tribe Quest was launched.

In  2011 the development of TribeQuest started as well as the creation of technology linked to digital distribution for the Play’n Buzz platform.

List of games that IOZO contributed to: 

- IOZO GAMES Titles : TribeQuest Green valley, TribeQuest Red Killer, Startoonz: Elysez 2012.

Dominique Pavlin :

Dominique started his carrier in 1988 in software engineering. He then created Netquartz, a company developing a software distribution platform primarily for video games and multimedia. He left in 2004 to create IOZO.

Philippe Louvet:

Philippe Louvet: Philippe started his career in video games in 1992 as a game tester for Infogrames. He became a full time employee in 1996 and occupied several roles within the publishing department. After several years as a producer, he left the company (which became Atari in 2002) to become an independant producer.  

Philippe has been involved in the following games :  
http://www.mobygames.com/developer/sheet/view/developerId,2606


We make the games we like but we do them for you, which is why we want to work with you to make the best games we can together.

The more help you give us at the start, the more we win in autonomy and independence.  

We want to bring you the best gaming experiences, ones that are interesting, deep and stimulating. That requires more time and effort than working on a small game. No disrespect for those games, we just want to work a bit differently... We could bring our ideas to big publishers, to gain the means to achieve our ambitions, but we would loose our independence and we would not be able to listen to you.

For those willing to make the journey with us, we will include you little by little in the project. We’ll give you access to a forum where we can discuss things together, we’ll present our ideas and talk about them, we’ll make you test our games as we go along. We’ll ask you questions, and we will listen to your answers...


First, we believe that it’s important to ask you to finance phases that will end up in the creation of something concrete. But during those phases, all the parts of our project will keep on moving forward and you will take part, thereby, to the whole.

First Objective: 0€

Yes, that's right, this campaign is in a flexible financing mode. This means that we are not setting a minimum of money to start the project. It’s already started and moving along quite well. We already spent a lot of our own money to be where we are and we could continue.  But to do everything we want is taking us a lot of time and now that we have launched a first version of our game, we would like to go a little faster.

For this budget, we are doing :

  • A better version of the first chapter of ‘Green Valley’.

  • A first version of the second chapter of ‘Green Valley’.

  • A better version of ‘Red Killer’.

If you dig our adventure and are generous, what can we do with more money?

Pretty simple...We start the next phases and we keep our autonomy while involving you.

Second objective : 20 000€

With this budget, we will be able to achieve:

  • Better versions of what we already released.

  • A first version of the third chapter of ‘Green Valley’.

  • A new minigame from the TribeQuest Universe.

Third objective : 50 000€

With this budget, we will be able to achieve:

  • Better versions of what we already released.

  • Two new minigame from the TribeQuest Universe.

  • A first version of the fourth and fifth chapter of ‘Green Valley’.

  • Adding more musics and improvement of our sound design.

Fourth objective : 100 000€

For this budget, we will do :

  • Development of a comic book to tell the stories of Grom'k before and after the events of ‘Green Valley’.

  • Launch the pre-production of the second episode of TribeQuest.

  • Development of the Iphone and Android versions of ‘Green Valley’.

Fifth objective : 250 000€

With this budget we will be able to develop the second episode of TribeQuest.

Special Objective : 1500 000 €

If a miracle happens and such a budget is raised, that would change the game radically ...

With this amount, we would increase our team, and we wouldn't have to build the game a little bit at a time. Insteand, we’ll do it less as “indies” and more like we’re used to do, as a “big studio”...  

This means that, from the start, you’ll get a lot more and better gampelay and more varied content.

Also, with this budget, we will directly port the game to console: PS3 and xbox 360 (… and maybe wii if you help us find good ideas for the wiiU...)


At IOZO GAMES, we maintain a ‘Sandbox’  where we share our ideas, concepts, drawings and games somtimes, or bits of games.

If you’re willing to take part in our adventure, we will invite you to play in our Sandbox. Much more than a simple forum, it will allow you access to tools to give us advice, to help us make decisions, to rate our ideas, concept and even prototypes.

Even though we are protecting our IPs and ideas, we trust you to keep what you see in our Sandbox for yourselves.

Once in this zone, you’ll get access to all its content, without restrictions, we will only ask you to not distribute in any way what you will find there.


The following is our current planning, it could change depending on the succes of this crowdfunding campaign.

May 2013 :

  • Launch of the first versions of ‘Green Valley’ and ‘Red Killer’.

  • Launch of this crowdfunding campaign.

  • Enhancement of the released versions.

June 2013 :

  • Release of the second chapter of Green Valley.

  • End of the Crowdfunding campaign.

  • Opening of our Sandbox to our benefactors.

  • Sending of the ‘goodies’.

July 2013 :

  • Release of the Third Chapter of Green Valley.

  • Release of the second mini game.

Septembre 2013:

  • Release of the Fourth Chapter of Green Valley.

  • Release of the third mini game.

Novembre 2013 :

  • Release of the Fifth Chapter of Green Valley.

  • Release of the fourth mini game.

Decembre 2013 :

  • Release of the full package of the ‘Green valley’.


The rest will be completely dependant on the result of the crowdfunding.

 

About TribeQuest :

Grom'k, our hero, after having snored his night out, wakes on a sunny morning, having overslept a little as always and will leave to hunt for food.

But today is different: during the night a meteor crashed not far away from his hut and  triggered changes that will disrupt his eventless little life...

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

This white rabbit is not going to help Grom'k, at all.

He’s going to do whatever it takes to prevent him from having a great day.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Bel’ana, the mysterious beauty who Grom'k will meet and who will radically change his life.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

About Red Killer :

Red Killer is the first puzzle game from the TribeQuest Universe.

In this game, you’ll find a series of level where you will have to get rid of all those mean creatures living in red cubes. But be careful, you must not lose the cute little monsters in the green cubes.

This is the first version of the game, we intend to keep on working on it a lot and make it much better. We first wanted to develop as much gameplay as we could without creating dozens of level each times.

We whish to make this game bigger with the help of the players, according to their preferences.

Enjoy this version of the game and tell us what you think. 

 

Rewards

  • 2€  : You’ll get Red killer and all the future updates.

  • 5€ : previous plus ‘Green valley’ and all the future updates (and new chapters)

  • 10€ : previous, plus all the other mini games that we announced, an access to our sandbox, your access to the IOZO GAMES community with a ‘friend’ sponsor badge.

  • 25€ : previous,  with a ‘Bronze’ sponsor badge, and we will put your name in the special thanks of all the games.

  • 50€ : previous, plus 10 licences of TribeQues (Green valley plus all the minigames). You can offer them to your friends or familly or you can keep them and you will be able to use our distribution technology to sell them when the game will be in its full version with a bigger prices (15€ at least).

  • 100€ : previous with a ‘silver’ sponsor badge, plus a collector Tribe Quest tshirt only available to donors of this level, you can add personalized the tshirt with your name.

  • 200€ : previous with a ‘Gold’ badge, a Unique Tribe Quest Mug with your name on it. We will do your caricature, we’ll use it in the bonuses of the game with a TribeQuestion version of your name. We will send you the signed original version of your caricature.

  • 500€ : previous with a ‘Partner’ sponsor badge, plus a zipped hoodie, unique to this level, with your name on it. We will use your caricature to create a character that we will use later in the game. Your name in the credits will be as a producer.

 


Re-Bonjour

 Imaginez une toute petite planète dans un coin pénard d’une galaxie lointaine... Sur cette planète luxuriante, mais un tantinet dangereuse, vivent des petits êtres primitifs et roudouillards. 

Notre Héros s’appelle Grom'k, un guerrier solitaire, qui habite une petite hutte au bord d’un lac. Il se contente de plaisirs simples. Ses journées sont bien réglées, chercher à manger, ... manger, dormir...
Mais un jour, quelque chose va venir bouleverser sa petite vie tranquille et l’obliger à partir à l’aventure vers des dangers importants. Il va même rencontrer l’amour...

C’est cette histoire que nous allons vous raconter. Mais on ne va pas se contenter de la manière conventionnelle.

Nous allons créer un univers dans lequel nous développerons plusieurs jeux et médias.

 

Nous avons déjà terminé deux éléments :

Le premier chapitre du Jeu de plateforme ‘TribeQuest: The Green Valley’ qui raconte les aventures de Grom'k.

 

La première version du premier ‘mini jeu’ : ‘TribeQuest : Red Killer’ qui est un jeu de puzzle comportant pour le moment une quarantaine de niveaux.

 

Nous travaillons avec des directeurs artistiques expérimentés. Ils sont également en charge des cursus d’infographie et animation 3D de l’école ESIA 3D à Lyon. Nous travaillons avec certains de leurs étudiants. 

Notre volonté est d’avoir, dans nos jeux, la plus grande qualité graphique possible.

La première phase du projet est terminée. Nous venons de lancer une première version de ‘Green Valley’ et ‘Red Killer’ sur PC et MAC. Nous avons lancé notre propre plateforme de vente en ligne avec notre propre technologie de distribution.

Nous lançons maintenant la deuxième phase. Nous allons corriger et améliorer le premier chapitre de ‘Green Valley’.
Nous allons aussi finir une première version du deuxième chapitre et attaquer la production du troisième. Nous allons améliorer et ajouter du contenu dans ‘Red Killer’ et nous allons aussi finir une première version d’un autre ‘mini jeu’.

Dans notre esprit, TribeQuest est un projet gigantesque. Vous pourrez jouer avec Grom'k mais aussi plein d’autres personnages. Vous aurez pleins de gameplays différents et vous suivrez Grom'k dans des aventures incroyables qui vont l'emmener très, très loin de son point de départ, à travers des dizaines de niveaux très variés. Vous aurez aussi pleins de jeux secondaires qui vont étendre l'univers de Tribe Quest dans pleins de directions.... 

Mais pour le moment, on commence petit à petit et on espère que le début vous plaira suffisamment pour vous donner envie de nous suivre pas à pas.

  

 IOZO GAMES :

  •  IOZO a été créée en 2004, principalement pour gérer du développement de technologies liées aux Jeux Vidéos.

  • En 2009, IOZO a entamé une transformation de son activité pour se concentrer essentiellement sur la création et la réalisation de Jeux Videos. Pour se doter des moyens nécessaires à la commercialisation de ses productions, le gérant de IOZO a créé une société de distribution en ligne, Play'n Buzz.

  • En 2010, IOZO s'est associée avec Philippe Louvet pour lancer la production du projet 'TribeQuest'.

  • Sous la direction artistique de Gilles Benois, ancien directeur artistique d'Eden Studios, actuel directeur pédagogique de l'école ESIA 3D, le projet TribeQuest a pu s’organiser correctement.

  • En 2011, la réalisation de Tribe Quest a démarré, ainsi que le développement de technologies liées à la distribution digitale pour la plateforme Play'n Buzz.

Principaux Jeux auxquels IOZO a pu participer :

  • Titres IOZO Games : 'TribeQuest - The Green Valley', 'TribeQuest - Red Killer', 'StartoonZ: Elisez 2012'.

     

Dominique Pavlin : Dominique a démarré sa carrière professionnelle en 1988 dans l'ingénierie logicielle puis a créé la société NetQuartz, plateforme technologique de distribution de logiciels, jeux vidéos et contenus multimédia. Il la quittera en 2004, époque à laquelle il va créer IOZO.

 Philippe Louvet: 

Philippe a démarré sa carrière dans les jeux videos en 1992, comme testeur externe de jeux pour la société Infogrames. Il a intégré cette société à plein temps en 1996 et occupé différentes responsabilités au sein du département d'édition. Après plusieurs années passées comme producteur, il a quitté la société (devenue ATARI en 2002) pour développer une activité de production indépendante. Philippe a participé aux jeux suivant :
http://www.mobygames.com/developer/sheet/view/developerId,2606

 

On fait les jeux dont on a envie, mais on les fait pour vous. Donc on veut travailler avec vous pour faire les meilleurs jeux possible, ensemble.

Au plus vous nous aiderez au départ, au plus nous gagnerons en autonomie et indépendance. 

Nous voulons vous apporter des expériences de jeu intéressantes, profondes et stimulantes. Mais pour cela, on a besoin d’y passer un peu plus de temps que pour des jeux plus simples.
On pourrait aller proposer nos jeux à des éditeurs, pour avoir les moyens de nos ambitions, mais nous perdriions alors notre indépendance et nous ne pourrions plus vous écouter.

 Pour ceux qui veulent bien se lancer dans l’aventure avec nous, nous allons vous inclure petit à petit dans le projet. On va vous donner accès à un forum où nous pourrons discuter tous ensemble, où on va vous présenter nos idées, où on vous fera tester des bout de nos jeux au fur et à mesure de leur réalisation. On va vous poser des questions, on va vous écouter...

 Il nous semble tout d’abord important de vous proposer de financer des phases qui aboutissent à la création de quelque chose de concret. Mais pendant ces phases, toutes les parties du projet vont avancer aussi et vous participerez donc, de fait, à l’ensemble.

 1 / Premier objectif : 0€

Oui, vous avez pu le constater, nous lançons cette campagne de financement en mode flexible, ce qui veut dire que nous ne fixons pas un objectif minimum pour démarrer le projet. 

Comme nous l’avons déjà dit, le projet est déjà en bonne voie, nous avons dépensé beaucoup de notre argent personnel pour arriver où nous en sommes et nous avons les moyens de continuer comme ca.
Mais tout faire nous même prend beaucoup de temps et maintenant que nous avons lancé une première version de nos jeux, nous aimerions aller un peu plus vite.

Pour ce budget, nous assurons :

  • Une version améliorée du 1er chapitre de ‘Green Valley’.

 

  • Une première version du 2ème chapitre de ‘Green Valley’.

 

 

  • Une version améliorée de ‘Red Killer’.

 

Si notre aventure vous branche et que vous êtes très généreux, que peut-on faire avec plus d’argent? C’est simple... On lance les phases de développement suivantes en gardant notre autonomie et en vous impliquant...

 2 / Deuxième objectif : 20 000€

Pour ce budget, nous assurons :

  • L'amélioration de ce qui a été mis en vente.

  • La sortie du chapitre 3 de ‘Green Valley’.

  • La sortie d'un nouveau ‘mini jeu’.

3 / Troisème objectif : 50 000€

Pour ce budget, nous assurons :

  •  Les chapitres 4 et 5 de ‘Green Valley’ pour finir le premier épisode des aventures de Grom'k.

 

  • Deux nouveaux mini jeu.

 

 

  • L’amélioration constante, avec vous, des jeux déjà en vente.

 

 

  • Ajouts de plus de musiques et d’une meilleure ambiance sonore.

 

4 / Quatrième objectif : 100 000€

  • Création d’une bande dessinée pour raconter l’histoire de Gromk avant et après les évènements de ‘Green Valley’
  • Lancement de la pré-production de l’épisode 2.
  • Réalisation des versions Iphone et Android du premier épisode.

 5 / Cinquième objectif : 250 000€

  • Réalisation du chapitre 2 de Tribe Quest.

 6 / Objectif spécial : 1 500 000€

  • Si jamais un miracle se produisait et que vous participiez à hauteur d’un tel montant... ca changerait carrément les choses... Avec un tel budget, on agrandit l’équipe et on met plus de gameplay et de contenus.
  • On fait le jeu directement pour consoles PS3 et Xbox360 (et wii si vous nous aidez à trouver une bonne idée pour la wiiU)

  

On a un endroit un peu spécial chez IOZO Gamesqu'on appelle notre ‘bac à sable’. C’est un endroit où l’on se partage des idées, des concepts, des dessins, des jeux mêmes, ou des bouts de jeux.

Si vous tentez l’aventure avec nous, on va vous inviter à jouer avec nous dans notre bac à sable. Bien plus qu’un forum, vous aurez accès à des outils pour donner votre avis, nous aider à prendre des décisions sur nos développements, noter nos idées et concepts et même nos prototypes.

Bien que nous protégions nos créations et nos idées, nous vous faisons confiance pour garder pour vous ce que vous voyez dans le ‘bac à sable’. Une fois dans cette zone, vous avez accès à tout son contenu, sans restriction, nous vous demandons juste de ne pas diffuser ce que vous y trouverez.

 

Ce qui suit est notre planning actuel qui peut etre amené à changer en fonction du succès de cette campagne de financement.

Mai 2013 :

  • Sortie des premières versions de ‘Green Valley’ et ‘Red Killer’
  • Lancement de la campagne de financement participatif
  • Améliorations du chapitre 1 et de 'Red Killer'

Juin 2013 :

  • Sortie du chapitre 2 de 'Green Valley'
  • Fin de la campagne de financement participatif
  • Ouverture du Bac à Sable aux participants.
  • Envois des ‘Goodies’

Juillet 2013:

  • Sortie du chapitre 3 de 'Green Valley'

  • Sortie du deuxième mini jeu.

Septembre 2013:

  • Sortie du chapitre 4 de 'Green Valley'

  • Sortie du troisième mini jeu.

Novembre 2013:

  • Sortie du chapitre 5 de 'Green Valley'

  • Sortie du quatrième mini jeu.

Décembre 2013

  • Sortie du package complet de ‘Green Valley’.

Pour la suite, ca va dépendre du résultat de la campagne de financement.

 

A propos de TribeQuest :

Grom'k, notre héros, apres avoir ronflé copieusement toute la nuit, va se réveiller un beau matin, trop tard, comme à son habitude et partir chasser pour manger. Mais cette journée ne va pas être comme les autres. En effet, dans la nuit une météorite est tombée non loin de sa cabane et va provoquer des changements qui vont bouleverser sa petite vie tranquille...

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Ce lapin blanc ne va pas du tout aider Grom'k, il va tout faire pour l’empêcher de passer une bonne journée...

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Bel’ana, la beauté mystérieuse que Grom’k va rencontrer et radicalement changer sa vie.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

A propos de 'Red Killer' :

'Red Killer' est le premier jeu de puzzle tiré de l'univers de TribeQuest.

Il consiste en une série de niveaux dans lesquels vous allez devoir vous débarrasser de toutes les vilaines créatures se trouvant dans un cube rouge tout en faisant attention à ne pas perdre les mignons petits monstres dans les cubes verts.

Ceci est la première version du jeu, nous comptons continuer à travailler dessus et l’améliorer. Nous avons d'abord voulu développer le plus de 'gameplay' différents, sans créer des dizaines de niveaux à chaque fois.

Nous souhaitons faire grandir ce jeu avec les joueurs, en fonction de ce qui plait le plus.

Alors amusez-vous bien avec cette version du jeu et donnez nous votre avis. 



Etapes de financements :

  • 2€ : TribeQuest ‘Red Killer’ plus tous les updates

  • 5€ : Contrepartie Précédente + TribeQuest ‘Green Valley’ plus tous les updates

  • 10€ :  C.P. + Tous les prochains minis jeux annoncés et tous les updates. Accès au sandbox. Votre accès à la communauté IOZO Games avec un badge de sponsor ‘ami’

  • 25€ : C.P. + badge sponsor ‘bronze’. Votre nom dans les credits du jeu.

  • 50€ : C.P. + 10 licences de Tribe quest (tous Green valley et tous les mini jeux) pour que vous les offriez à vos amis ou votre famille ou bien pour que vous les revendiez quand le jeux sera dans sa version complète et vaudra 15€

  • 100€ : C.P. + idem C.P. 25€, avec badge ‘silver’, plus un t-shirt collector TribeQuest reservé uniquement aux donneurs de ce niveau et vous pourrez ajouter votre nom au t-shirt.

  • 200€ : C.P. avec badge ‘Gold’, plus un mug nominatif, plus votre caricature utilisée dans les bonus du jeu avec une version tribesque de votre nom, plus le dessin original de votre caricature signé.

  • 500€ : C.P. ,plus un polo collector comme le t-shirt, et votre caricature utilisée pour un futur personnage du jeu.

Under the direction of Gilles Benois, former artistic director of Eden Studios and current Director of Studies at Esia 3D, the project Tribe Quest was launched.
In  2011 the development of TribeQuest started as well as the creation of technology linked to digital distribution for the Play’n Buzz platform.
List of games that IOZO contributed to: 
- IOZO GAMES Titles : TribeQuest Green valley, TribeQuest Red Killer, Startoonz: Elysez 2012.
Dominique Pavlin :
Dominique started his carrier in 1988 in software engineering. He then created Netquartz, a company developing a software distribution platform primarily for video games and multimedia. He left in 2004 to create IOZO.
Philippe Louvet:
Philippe Louvet: Philippe started his career in video games in 1992 as a game tester for Infogrames. He became a full time employee in 1996 and occupied several roles within the publishing department. After several years as a producer, he left the company (which became Atari in 2002) to become an independant producer.  
Philippe has been involved in the following games :  http://www.mobygames.com/developer/sheet/view/developerId,2606

We make the games we like but we do them for you, which is why we want to work with you to make the best games we can together.
The more help you give us at the start, the more we win in autonomy and independence.  
We want to bring you the best gaming experiences, ones that are interesting, deep and stimulating. That requires more time and effort than working on a small game. No disrespect for those games, we just want to work a bit differently... We could bring our ideas to big publishers, to gain the means to achieve our ambitions, but we would loose our independence and we would not be able to listen to you.
For those willing to make the journey with us, we will include you little by little in the project. We’ll give you access to a forum where we can discuss things together, we’ll present our ideas and talk about them, we’ll make you test our games as we go along. We’ll ask you questions, and we will listen to your answers...

First, we believe that it’s important to ask you to finance phases that will end up in the creation of something concrete. But during those phases, all the parts of our project will keep on moving forward and you will take part, thereby, to the whole.
First Objective: 0€
Yes, that's right, this campaign is in a flexible financing mode. This means that we are not setting a minimum of money to start the project. It’s already started and moving along quite well. We already spent a lot of our own money to be where we are and we could continue.  But to do everything we want is taking us a lot of time and now that we have launched a first version of our game, we would like to go a little faster.
For this budget, we are doing :


A better version of the first chapter of ‘Green Valley’.


A first version of the second chapter of ‘Green Valley’.


A better version of ‘Red Killer’.

If you dig our adventure and are generous, what can we do with more money?
Pretty simple...We start the next phases and we keep our autonomy while involving you.
Second objective : 20 000€
With this budget, we will be able to achieve:


Better versions of what we already released.


A first version of the third chapter of ‘Green Valley’.


A new minigame from the TribeQuest Universe.

Third objective : 50 000€
With this budget, we will be able to achieve:


Better versions of what we already released.


Two new minigame from the TribeQuest Universe.


A first version of the fourth and fifth chapter of ‘Green Valley’.


Adding more musics and improvement of our sound design.

Fourth objective : 100 000€
For this budget, we will do :


Development of a comic book to tell the stories of Grom'k before and after the events of ‘Green Valley’.


Launch the pre-production of the second episode of TribeQuest.


Development of the Iphone and Android versions of ‘Green Valley’.

Fifth objective : 250 000€
With this budget we will be able to develop the second episode of TribeQuest.
Special Objective : 1500 000 €
If a miracle happens and such a budget is raised, that would change the game radically ...
With this amount, we would increase our team, and we wouldn't have to build the game a little bit at a time. Insteand, we’ll do it less as “indies” and more like we’re used to do, as a “big studio”...  
This means that, from the start, you’ll get a lot more and better gampelay and more varied content.
Also, with this budget, we will directly port the game to console: PS3 and xbox 360 (… and maybe wii if you help us find good ideas for the wiiU...)

At IOZO GAMES, we maintain a ‘Sandbox’  where we share our ideas, concepts, drawings and games somtimes, or bits of games.
If you’re willing to take part in our adventure, we will invite you to play in our Sandbox. Much more than a simple forum, it will allow you access to tools to give us advice, to help us make decisions, to rate our ideas, concept and even prototypes.
Even though we are protecting our IPs and ideas, we trust you to keep what you see in our Sandbox for yourselves.
Once in this zone, you’ll get access to all its content, without restrictions, we will only ask you to not distribute in any way what you will find there.

The following is our current planning, it could change depending on the succes of this crowdfunding campaign.
May 2013 :


Launch of the first versions of ‘Green Valley’ and ‘Red Killer’.


Launch of this crowdfunding campaign.


Enhancement of the released versions.

June 2013 :


Release of the second chapter of Green Valley.


End of the Crowdfunding campaign.


Opening of our Sandbox to our benefactors.


Sending of the ‘goodies’.

July 2013 :


Release of the Third Chapter of Green Valley.


Release of the second mini game.

Septembre 2013:


Release of the Fourth Chapter of Green Valley.


Release of the third mini game.

Novembre 2013 :


Release of the Fifth Chapter of Green Valley.


Release of the fourth mini game.

Decembre 2013 :


Release of the full package of the ‘Green valley’.

The rest will be completely dependant on the result of the crowdfunding.
 

About TribeQuest : 
Grom'k, our hero, after having snored his night out, wakes on a sunny morning, having overslept a little as always and will leave to hunt for food. 
But today is different: during the night a meteor crashed not far away from his hut and  triggered changes that will disrupt his eventless little life...
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 
 
 
 
This white rabbit is not going to help Grom'k, at all.
He’s going to do whatever it takes to prevent him from having a great day.
 
 
 
 
 
 

 
 
 
 
Bel’ana, the mysterious beauty who Grom'k will meet and who will radically change his life.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
About Red Killer :
Red Killer is the first puzzle game from the TribeQuest Universe.
In this game, you’ll find a series of level where you will have to get rid of all those mean creatures living in red cubes. But be careful, you must not lose the cute little monsters in the green cubes.
This is the first version of the game, we intend to keep on working on it a lot and make it much better. We first wanted to develop as much gameplay as we could without creating dozens of level each times.
We whish to make this game bigger with the help of the players, according to their preferences.
Enjoy this version of the game and tell us what you think. 
 
Rewards 


2€  : You’ll get Red killer and all the future updates.


5€ : previous plus ‘Green valley’ and all the future updates (and new chapters)


10€ : previous, plus all the other mini games that we announced, an access to our sandbox, your access to the IOZO GAMES community with a ‘friend’ sponsor badge.


25€ : previous,  with a ‘Bronze’ sponsor badge, and we will put your name in the special thanks of all the games.


50€ : previous, plus 10 licences of TribeQues (Green valley plus all the minigames). You can offer them to your friends or familly or you can keep them and you will be able to use our distribution technology to sell them when the game will be in its full version with a bigger prices (15€ at least).


100€ : previous with a ‘silver’ sponsor badge, plus a collector Tribe Quest tshirt only available to donors of this level, you can add personalized the tshirt with your name.


200€ : previous with a ‘Gold’ badge, a Unique Tribe Quest Mug with your name on it. We will do your caricature, we’ll use it in the bonuses of the game with a TribeQuestion version of your name. We will send you the signed original version of your caricature. 

500€ : previous with a ‘Partner’ sponsor badge, plus a zipped hoodie, unique to this level, with your name on it. We will use your caricature to create a character that we will use later in the game. Your name in the credits will be as a producer.
 
Re-Bonjour

 Imaginez une toute petite planète dans un coin pénard d’une galaxie lointaine... Sur cette planète luxuriante, mais un tantinet dangereuse, vivent des petits êtres primitifs et roudouillards. 
Notre Héros s’appelle Grom'k, un guerrier solitaire, qui habite une petite hutte au bord d’un lac. Il se contente de plaisirs simples. Ses journées sont bien réglées, chercher à manger, ... manger, dormir... Mais un jour, quelque chose va venir bouleverser sa petite vie tranquille et l’obliger à partir à l’aventure vers des dangers importants. Il va même rencontrer l’amour... 
C’est cette histoire que nous allons vous raconter. Mais on ne va pas se contenter de la manière conventionnelle.
Nous allons créer un univers dans lequel nous développerons plusieurs jeux et médias.
 
Nous avons déjà terminé deux éléments :
Le premier chapitre du Jeu de plateforme ‘TribeQuest: The Green Valley’ qui raconte les aventures de Grom'k.
 
La première version du premier ‘mini jeu’ : ‘TribeQuest : Red Killer’ qui est un jeu de puzzle comportant pour le moment une quarantaine de niveaux.
 
Nous travaillons avec des directeurs artistiques expérimentés. Ils sont également en charge des cursus d’infographie et animation 3D de l’école ESIA 3D à Lyon. Nous travaillons avec certains de leurs étudiants. 
Notre volonté est d’avoir, dans nos jeux, la plus grande qualité graphique possible.
La première phase du projet est terminée. Nous venons de lancer une première version de ‘Green Valley’ et ‘Red Killer’ sur PC et MAC. Nous avons lancé notre propre plateforme de vente en ligne avec notre propre technologie de distribution.
Nous lançons maintenant la deuxième phase. Nous allons corriger et améliorer le premier chapitre de ‘Green Valley’. Nous allons aussi finir une première version du deuxième chapitre et attaquer la production du troisième. Nous allons améliorer et ajouter du contenu dans ‘Red Killer’ et nous allons aussi finir une première version d’un autre ‘mini jeu’.
Dans notre esprit, TribeQuest est un projet gigantesque. Vous pourrez jouer avec Grom'k mais aussi plein d’autres personnages. Vous aurez pleins de gameplays différents et vous suivrez Grom'k dans des aventures incroyables qui vont l'emmener très, très loin de son point de départ, à travers des dizaines de niveaux très variés. Vous aurez aussi pleins de jeux secondaires qui vont étendre l'univers de Tribe Quest dans pleins de directions.... 
Mais pour le moment, on commence petit à petit et on espère que le début vous plaira suffisamment pour vous donner envie de nous suivre pas à pas.
  
 IOZO GAMES :

 IOZO a été créée en 2004, principalement pour gérer du développement de technologies liées aux Jeux Vidéos.

En 2009, IOZO a entamé une transformation de son activité pour se concentrer essentiellement sur la création et la réalisation de Jeux Videos. Pour se doter des moyens nécessaires à la commercialisation de ses productions, le gérant de IOZO a créé une société de distribution en ligne, Play'n Buzz.


En 2010, IOZO s'est associée avec Philippe Louvet pour lancer la production du projet 'TribeQuest'.


Sous la direction artistique de Gilles Benois, ancien directeur artistique d'Eden Studios, actuel directeur pédagogique de l'école ESIA 3D, le projet TribeQuest a pu s’organiser correctement.


En 2011, la réalisation de Tribe Quest a démarré, ainsi que le développement de technologies liées à la distribution digitale pour la plateforme Play'n Buzz.

Principaux Jeux auxquels IOZO a pu participer :


Titres IOZO Games : 'TribeQuest - The Green Valley', 'TribeQuest - Red Killer', 'StartoonZ: Elisez 2012'.
 

Dominique Pavlin : Dominique a démarré sa carrière professionnelle en 1988 dans l'ingénierie logicielle puis a créé la société NetQuartz, plateforme technologique de distribution de logiciels, jeux vidéos et contenus multimédia. Il la quittera en 2004, époque à laquelle il va créer IOZO.
 Philippe Louvet: 
Philippe a démarré sa carrière dans les jeux videos en 1992, comme testeur externe de jeux pour la société Infogrames. Il a intégré cette société à plein temps en 1996 et occupé différentes responsabilités au sein du département d'édition. Après plusieurs années passées comme producteur, il a quitté la société (devenue ATARI en 2002) pour développer une activité de production indépendante. Philippe a participé aux jeux suivant : http://www.mobygames.com/developer/sheet/view/developerId,2606
 
On fait les jeux dont on a envie, mais on les fait pour vous. Donc on veut travailler avec vous pour faire les meilleurs jeux possible, ensemble.
Au plus vous nous aiderez au départ, au plus nous gagnerons en autonomie et indépendance. 
Nous voulons vous apporter des expériences de jeu intéressantes, profondes et stimulantes. Mais pour cela, on a besoin d’y passer un peu plus de temps que pour des jeux plus simples. On pourrait aller proposer nos jeux à des éditeurs, pour avoir les moyens de nos ambitions, mais nous perdriions alors notre indépendance et nous ne pourrions plus vous écouter.
 Pour ceux qui veulent bien se lancer dans l’aventure avec nous, nous allons vous inclure petit à petit dans le projet. On va vous donner accès à un forum où nous pourrons discuter tous ensemble, où on va vous présenter nos idées, où on vous fera tester des bout de nos jeux au fur et à mesure de leur réalisation. On va vous poser des questions, on va vous écouter...

 Il nous semble tout d’abord important de vous proposer de financer des phases qui aboutissent à la création de quelque chose de concret. Mais pendant ces phases, toutes les parties du projet vont avancer aussi et vous participerez donc, de fait, à l’ensemble.
 1 / Premier objectif : 0€
Oui, vous avez pu le constater, nous lançons cette campagne de financement en mode flexible, ce qui veut dire que nous ne fixons pas un objectif minimum pour démarrer le projet. 
Comme nous l’avons déjà dit, le projet est déjà en bonne voie, nous avons dépensé beaucoup de notre argent personnel pour arriver où nous en sommes et nous avons les moyens de continuer comme ca. Mais tout faire nous même prend beaucoup de temps et maintenant que nous avons lancé une première version de nos jeux, nous aimerions aller un peu plus vite.
Pour ce budget, nous assurons :

Une version améliorée du 1er chapitre de ‘Green Valley’.
 

Une première version du 2ème chapitre de ‘Green Valley’.
 
 

Une version améliorée de ‘Red Killer’.
 
Si notre aventure vous branche et que vous êtes très généreux, que peut-on faire avec plus d’argent? C’est simple... On lance les phases de développement suivantes en gardant notre autonomie et en vous impliquant...
 2 / Deuxième objectif : 20 000€

Pour ce budget, nous assurons :


L'amélioration de ce qui a été mis en vente.


La sortie du chapitre 3 de ‘Green Valley’.


La sortie d'un nouveau ‘mini jeu’.

3 / Troisème objectif : 50 000€
Pour ce budget, nous assurons :

 Les chapitres 4 et 5 de ‘Green Valley’ pour finir le premier épisode des aventures de Grom'k.
 

Deux nouveaux mini jeu.
 
 

L’amélioration constante, avec vous, des jeux déjà en vente.
 
 

Ajouts de plus de musiques et d’une meilleure ambiance sonore.
 
4 / Quatrième objectif : 100 000€

Création d’une bande dessinée pour raconter l’histoire de Gromk avant et après les évènements de ‘Green Valley’
Lancement de la pré-production de l’épisode 2.

Réalisation des versions Iphone et Android du premier épisode.
 5 / Cinquième objectif : 250 000€


Réalisation du chapitre 2 de Tribe Quest.

 6 / Objectif spécial : 1 500 000€

Si jamais un miracle se produisait et que vous participiez à hauteur d’un tel montant... ca changerait carrément les choses... Avec un tel budget, on agrandit l’équipe et on met plus de gameplay et de contenus.
On fait le jeu directement pour consoles PS3 et Xbox360 (et wii si vous nous aidez à trouver une bonne idée pour la wiiU)
  
On a un endroit un peu spécial chez IOZO Gamesqu'on appelle notre ‘bac à sable’. C’est un endroit où l’on se partage des idées, des concepts, des dessins, des jeux mêmes, ou des bouts de jeux.
Si vous tentez l’aventure avec nous, on va vous inviter à jouer avec nous dans notre bac à sable. Bien plus qu’un forum, vous aurez accès à des outils pour donner votre avis, nous aider à prendre des décisions sur nos développements, noter nos idées et concepts et même nos prototypes.
Bien que nous protégions nos créations et nos idées, nous vous faisons confiance pour garder pour vous ce que vous voyez dans le ‘bac à sable’. Une fois dans cette zone, vous avez accès à tout son contenu, sans restriction, nous vous demandons juste de ne pas diffuser ce que vous y trouverez.

 
Ce qui suit est notre planning actuel qui peut etre amené à changer en fonction du succès de cette campagne de financement.
Mai 2013 :

Sortie des premières versions de ‘Green Valley’ et ‘Red Killer’

Lancement de la campagne de financement participatif

Améliorations du chapitre 1 et de 'Red Killer'
Juin 2013 :

Sortie du chapitre 2 de 'Green Valley'

Fin de la campagne de financement participatif

Ouverture du Bac à Sable aux participants.

Envois des ‘Goodies’ 
Juillet 2013:


Sortie du chapitre 3 de 'Green Valley'


Sortie du deuxième mini jeu.

Septembre 2013:


Sortie du chapitre 4 de 'Green Valley'


Sortie du troisième mini jeu.

Novembre 2013:


Sortie du chapitre 5 de 'Green Valley'


Sortie du quatrième mini jeu.

Décembre 2013


Sortie du package complet de ‘Green Valley’.

Pour la suite, ca va dépendre du résultat de la campagne de financement.
 
A propos de TribeQuest :
Grom'k, notre héros, apres avoir ronflé copieusement toute la nuit, va se réveiller un beau matin, trop tard, comme à son habitude et partir chasser pour manger. Mais cette journée ne va pas être comme les autres. En effet, dans la nuit une météorite est tombée non loin de sa cabane et va provoquer des changements qui vont bouleverser sa petite vie tranquille...
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 
 
 
 
Ce lapin blanc ne va pas du tout aider Grom'k, il va tout faire pour l’empêcher de passer une bonne journée...
 
 
 
 
 

 
 
 
Bel’ana, la beauté mystérieuse que Grom’k va rencontrer et radicalement changer sa vie. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
A propos de 'Red Killer' :
'Red Killer' est le premier jeu de puzzle tiré de l'univers de TribeQuest.
Il consiste en une série de niveaux dans lesquels vous allez devoir vous débarrasser de toutes les vilaines créatures se trouvant dans un cube rouge tout en faisant attention à ne pas perdre les mignons petits monstres dans les cubes verts.
Ceci est la première version du jeu, nous comptons continuer à travailler dessus et l’améliorer. Nous avons d'abord voulu développer le plus de 'gameplay' différents, sans créer des dizaines de niveaux à chaque fois.
Nous souhaitons faire grandir ce jeu avec les joueurs, en fonction de ce qui plait le plus.
Alors amusez-vous bien avec cette version du jeu et donnez nous votre avis. 

Etapes de financements :


2€ : TribeQuest ‘Red Killer’ plus tous les updates


5€ : Contrepartie Précédente + TribeQuest ‘Green Valley’ plus tous les updates


10€ :  C.P. + Tous les prochains minis jeux annoncés et tous les updates. Accès au sandbox. Votre accès à la communauté IOZO Games avec un badge de sponsor ‘ami’


25€ : C.P. + badge sponsor ‘bronze’. Votre nom dans les credits du jeu.


50€ : C.P. + 10 licences de Tribe quest (tous Green valley et tous les mini jeux) pour que vous les offriez à vos amis ou votre famille ou bien pour que vous les revendiez quand le jeux sera dans sa version complète et vaudra 15€


100€ : C.P. + idem C.P. 25€, avec badge ‘silver’, plus un t-shirt collector TribeQuest reservé uniquement aux donneurs de ce niveau et vous pourrez ajouter votre nom au t-shirt. 


200€ : C.P. avec badge ‘Gold’, plus un mug nominatif, plus votre caricature utilisée dans les bonus du jeu avec une version tribesque de votre nom, plus le dessin original de votre caricature signé.

500€ : C.P. ,plus un polo collector comme le t-shirt, et votre caricature utilisée pour un futur personnage du jeu.

story:
IMPORTANT:

If you donate for alpha keys, please contact me on here (IndieGoGo) with your forum username (AoA Forum) and we can work on giving you access to the current alpha that is being run.

UPDATE (05/05/14):

Project GE is currently offline, this is because we are performing a full migration to a new server and actually moving over to a new PHP framework. We hope to have GE back online within the next few weeks!

This does not mean that I will stop giving your keys out, be sure to message me once you've donated with your forum name. I will then message you on the forum with your alpha key that will work when we move to http://projectge.com!

UPDATE (20/04/14):

If you're still looking to get your alpha key, please message me using the IGG message system! Thank you :)

(Side note: For BETA, we will send your serial keys out via email)

UPDATE (18/04/14):

I have been coding for hours on end, to finally show off a new balanced system along with 62 new mobs that get categorised into 15 levels.

The max level cap of 15 is currently in place, but will expand as more gets added.

Feel free to check out the full CHANGELOG for more information!

UPDATE (17/04/14):

If you have pledged on our IndieGoGo, PLEASE ENSURE IT IS PUBLIC.
I need to use the list that IGG provides to confirm that your pledge links to a forum account.


This means going to "My Contributions" > "Visibility" > "Show Name and Amount"
If you have pledged, please message me on IndieGoGo with your forum name on the account that you pledged with.

Thanks for reading! I hope to issue out all your alpha keys as soon as possible. 

Short Summary

Thanks for taking the time to view our campaign! I am XenoWarrior, a web-developer at Age of Aincrad.

Since the development for Age of Aincrad is going to take a fair few years, this is a side project that will take a fraction of the time.

This project is by the same team developing Age of Aincrad, but any funds taken for this project will not be used on the main development of Age of Aincrad. All funds taken for this will be used to improve GE.

Please remember, this is for GE Alpha! NOT AoA Alpha!

Mechanics that we have talked about:

  • Simple game
  • Health System (Players must be careful when doing raids. Going in with little health could result in ending up in a hospital for a set time)
  • Skills (Players can use these skills to improve the chance that an action/quest is completed)
  • Sub Levels (These levels link in with the skills, the skills can be levelled to increase the chance)
  • Quests (At the moment, there is a basic quest system. This will be expanded upon)
  • Item System (You can collect items in GE to increase your stats)
  • Currency (Gold will be a currency in-game, this can be obtained by defeating mobs and quests)
  • Trading System (This is something we are currently talking about, might or might not happen)
  • Raids (Raids are like quests, but they are risky and do not have an energy limit. It could result in being hospitalised)
  • Death System (As mentioned above, if you are killed, you will end up in a hospital. Locked there for a set time)
  • Overall Experience System (You can gain levels in GE with obtaining EXP)
  • Skill Point Tree (Different Trees, points that add to skills in trees)
  • Specialization points (Used to unlock different keys)
  • Drop Tables
  • Guilds Bonuses
  • Random Events (You'll see)

Screenshots of Alpha

This screen shows a logged in user using the actions list. (Soon to expand into full quests or skills to gain EXP)

Here are many of the current features in and working! (The UI is only a template, we are working to make a nice flash UI with the UI designer!)

You can also check out the CHANGELOG and view the full history of GE!

What We Need & What You Get

Here is a break down of how your funds help to develop GE:

  • Funds will help me buy quality, ready made code to instantly implement into GE. This will significantly improve the development time!
  • By donating using the £1 perk, you will have helped the development of GE and we thank you for your generosity!
  • By donating using the £5 perk, you get access to both alpha and beta!
  • By donating using the £15 perk, you get a badge/custom title on your account when the game reaches beta! (Alpha not included)
  • By donating using the £50 perk, you can design your own item for GE that you will get upon release of the game! (All previous perks included)
  • By donating using the £100 perk, you get all previous as well as the following: Design a quest, reserve your name for beta, get your name on an NPC in-game and a founder title for your guild (soloers get founder badge)! (All previous perks included)
  • If we do not reach our goal, anything we have will be greatly appreciated and have a significant boost on the GE development!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate, please feel free to join and get involved in the chat :

  • You can always follow the development for both AoA and GE on our forum at http://age-of-aincrad.com/forum/

Thanks for reading! I hope we can tempt you to donate to our side project, Project GE!

~Ashley Scott (XenoWarrior) (GE Developer)

~Jordan Knights  (Xalchs) (GE Game Designer)

~Jordan Shaw (Zenro45) (GE UI Designer)

Simple game


Health System (Players must be careful when doing raids. Going in with little health could result in ending up in a hospital for a set time)
