We started working on Outer Space Exiles in January and we have almost finished our work on the game prototype and will be able to release it this fall. Our goal is to build up a community and release our first alpha by the end of the year. And now we need your help to make this dream come alive!




Outer Space Exiles features a unique plot, written by an award-winning author. Player immerses into a future world in which Earth and Human race are at the edge of collapse. Planetary resources are almost depleted, humans need to find a new home pronto. While preparations for the great conquering of space take place for few decades, it's decided to scrap Earth's most unwelcome residents - criminals, convicts, chronically sick, unemployed, uneducated, poorly skilled...

All the marginals were no longer treated as equally right and were soon sent to outer space looking for their luck or in most cases, death. Meanwhile massive inbreeding took place on Earth for 50 years. And there it is, the shiny new generation of new hopes that is believed to save humanity.
And the day came for them to reach for the stars, looking for a new place to reform the Human race.
But what was everyone's surprise when they found long ago exiled marginals not only survived, but grew stronger and are now about to unleash a long awaited payback. To you, the players, this is certainly good news. Because unlike other games in Outer Space Exiles you will join the "BAD GUYS" and deal some justice for what your people had to suffer and go through during these 50 years.
Be sure to read the complete back story on our blog.

Outer Space Exiles combines elements from different genres and fuses them in an unique way.
One can look at it as a Real-Time Strategy, but it's far from the truth. Our major concern with these games is vast majority of them involves mindless production of cannon fodder and it's the quantity, not the strategy that determines mission outcome.
Well, we never liked that and decided to turn it upside down.
So instead of mass producing and not caring about mass losses, we would like the player to treasure their units. And the units on the other hand respond accordingly. The more you take care of them, the more they tend to develop and become of higher value to your game.
Add the idea that, each and every NPC has their own personality and mindset it will act according to and you end up with the equation that no two NPC's ever share the same personality that makes for a completely different game every time with endless replay possibilities.

The colony itself has a limited capacity and infrastructure and although transport ships regularly come and go bringing new goods and eventually colonists, there will never be abundance of resources and workforce. This is outer space and player needs to make do with what they have at hand. Knowing that colonists can also decide to leave the colony, you can easily understand that this experience will be nothing like walk in the park.
And here we come to the enemy. Of course there are enemies. Your major enemy is the inbred generation and Global Government. And you are going to give them mama's boys hell for the 50 years you spent in exile. But don't get comfortable after pushing them back to where they came from. You might soon end up fighting on two or more fronts with enemies you never thought existed.

Player assumes the role of a colony manager. They come to a freshly inhabited colony where they place their shops. Generally there are 4 types of shops that produce medical supplies, weapons, vehicles and protective equipment.
Medical supplies feature field medikits, boosters and drugs to enhance colonists durability. Weapons shop produce a vast array of weapons. Vehicle shop brings the next combat level to your colony by adding quads, tanks and other heavy machinery. Protective equipment deals with armors, suits and barriers to make your colonists less vulnerable.
The player starts with a choice of two shops.

One of the main differences with other RTS games is in Outer Space Exiles you CAN'T control the colonists directly. They do things as they please and see fit at the moment. However you can INFLUENCE their decisions by adding bounties and increase their loyalty offering them better equipment.
The RPG element comes from them developing with each and every new challenge and enemy they encounter. And the tycoon element comes from you not only dealing with the shops, but also trying to anticipate and satisfy demands for technologies and equipment by constantly researching blueprints and producing new items.
Of course there are also resources involved with that and that's how it all ties up together - if your colonists don't mine resources for you because they don't feel the urge to do it, you will end up buying resources off remote black markets. That means there will be delays in production while resources arrive and production costs will skyrocket. So it's all about finding the perfect balance.
The Multiplayer mode on the other hand provides a whole new dimension for your gameplay as it lets you interact with other players within your solo campaign. Once you join a Colonial Trade Chamber you end up among buddies you can rely on.
But be aware that CTC membership also requires you to give. It's a two-way relation. Colonial Trade Chambers have contracts with Global Government.

They need to provide specific amounts of ores and technologies each month. In exchange, Global Government will provide them with books and blueprints CTC members can freely grab and use. Failing to fulfill your quota however will have consequences and Global Government will send some forces to put some sense in you and get you back on track.
There is a fearsome competition between CTC's as the more successful ones have access to much better items.
Our goal is to create a working prototype by the end of the year, including things like professional made music, sound effects and a game server, where we can test the multiplayer part on.
Here is a breakdown of what we will use the campaign money on:

hire a sound engineer for the sound effects
and a band for the soundtrack
work on the Mac and Linux versions of the game
rent game servers for our multiplayer part
buy licenses for professional game developer software
spend more time on awesome game features which we would like to develop

We hope to raise enough money with our campaign, so we can launch a alpha / beta in spring 2014, that has all the features, including graphics and music, ready.
